text: My dad and I came here for breakfast.  I got the hot chocolate with whipped cream on top and smiled like a kid the whole time I drank it.  Hands-down, the grits were the best I've ever had in my life !  Lots of butter in them.  Don't even tell me the calories, don't want to know. I got the scrambled eggs with turkey bacon.  The bacon was excellent.  The pancakes were thick and fluffy.  There was so much food I couldn't eat it all. Dad complained about paying extra for tomatoes, but he's from a small place in Indiana and doesn't understand city life.  Lol

Stop by after a Christmas party on a Saturday night; the place was jamming!  As most places like this on a Saturday late night it was packed.  Every seat cushion filled and the jukebox blaring some "ol' skool" seventies soul!  People who come here looking for a Maitre d'Hotel, check that at the door.  Here your going to get a wait staff who dance, call you sweetheart and try to keep up with the huge influx of late orders.  What do you think you going to get from a late night diner.  I can tell you what you should get at a late night diner.  From this one get the French toast!  It is unbelievable!  Made from fresh challah bread it's soft and gooey like hot caramel!  Did I mention it was large?  Oh my, you know it's homemade from the size of the slices!  I ate mine without syrup, because it was so good I simply forgot about it!  Going back tonight to get the shrimp and grits!  See ya there at Midnight or later!

Ate a delicious big breakfast here. Food was warm and nicely prepared. Clean environment and friendly staff. The only thing that turned me off was a tall black male staff member chewing on food as be serviced customers. It's not a good message to customers. I'm in food service.  If you eat go to employee section.
The chicken was awesome and the Coconut crunch French toast was perfect be prepared for a while to be seated it's always packed on the weekends and late night

Food was awesome! But definitely not getting a full 5 stars because the service sucked. I asked for sweet tea, never got it. I had to use my friends spoon to eat my food because I was never brought silverware. And I would've asked for it, however we never got checked on. My water stayed empty. We asked for the checks, and waited 30 minutes before the waitress came back to even take the checks. And she had to be REMINDED to come get our cards to run them. Pretty much the worst service ever.

When people started commenting, "you know the names and shifts of the staff?" I should have taken it as a hint that I go here too often. And yet, the hashbrowns keep me coming back for more. Oh, I've had other menu items too and have never been disappointed (the veggie burger is a favorite, and the specials are usually a good call). But dangit, when it comes down to it, I just love a good breakfast.   And in a city that can get awfully caught up in frills, this place is about as frill-less as you can get. Straightforward, simple and cheap.  Why four stars? The servers can sometimes get overwhelmed. Ultimately that doesn't bother me that much in a place like this, though. It's the sort of joint where imperfection just makes it more endearing.

We were there for breakfast. I had the waffles nothing to write home about. I make better waffles at home with Aunt Jemima mix.  Husband order pancakes eggs sausages well over 9 dollars for that. He did  not even finish his pancakes and thats normally his favorite.    Enjoyed the interior.. but the food lack in taste and overprice.  Took forever to get the food too.  Perhaps since they are still new.  Management will work out the problems.  Overprice foods. Would not being going there again.

This will probably be our next go to diner. We just moved to the Charlotte area and are huge diner people. Prices were very reasonable and our food was great. My husband ordered the corn beef slam and I ordered the firecracker shrimp salad. I wasn't a huge fan of the creamy Parmesan dressing but if you like Caesar dressing then this is the dressing for you. We went in at 2:30pm on a Wednesday and were seated right away. Also, it's open 24hrs!
Came for breakfast today , I had the midnight breakfast platter . Had a mimosa , it wasn't all that great but then again this is a diner . My meal was decent and my server was friendly .

The french toast is excellent, real thick cut bacon, and its 24 hours! I'm a native Charlottean back in town from Atlanta. I hoped something better than Landmark would one day be added to all the new nightlife. This is that hope. I didn't find the food compromised by the diner vibe at all. The challah was authentic & real maple syrup aren't exactly low brow. My suggestion: they have fried chicken AND waffles on the menu...but not together. What's that oversight about?

The Midnight Diner is a great choice for inexpensive comfort food and breakfast anytime. The fried chicken is especially good and I love the shrimp & grits. No wine though - only beer & liquor - kinda weird!

I've eaten here a few times now and I think it's fair to say that the diner is consistently yummy.  Each time the service has been good and the food has been exactly as a bright silver diner's food should. It's the perfect place for a nightcap, a "morning after" breakfast or even a quick lunch. A word of advice, try the mac-n-cheese. I'm confident the recipe was borrowed from someone's grandmother.

Very interesting diner, really does seem like nothing has changed since these types of diners were THE thing. The place is crowded and parking is pretty rough. The overall cleanliness is pretty poor but not horrible.   Service was pretty slow but nothing absurd.   Food was very good for diner food, however I'll say it's usually expected to be over fed at a diner...  This is not the case here. Serving sizes are pretty small.

Stopped in after attending an event uptown. We waited just a few moments to be seated at nice cozy corner booth. The place had a wide variety of customers which I truly enjoyed.   I had the chicken and waffles although wasn't the best I've had but not the worse. The chicken had been sitting for a bit as it was certainly not hot. Next time I will request fresh chicken. My dw had chicken dinner with greens and mashed potatoes. She enjoyed it except for the chicken was cold.   My ds(7) & dd(9) had the pancakes and enjoyed them but how can you go wrong with pancakes if you are in the mood.   We will go back again & I will make a special request for fresh chicken if I choose to get it next time. The prices were very fair and my family of 4 left with a 32 dollar bill. Not bad.

Me and my husband went to the dinner. Ive never been disapointed the food is always good..This time my food was served cold. My husbands was sreved just right. I let the waitress know and she took my plate back and told me they were making a fresh order.I sat and watched my husband eat his food from begining to end. Mean while I sat and waited. Finally my food came out. I told the waitress it should be free. She told tha manager or supervisor what I said and when we recieved the bill 2.00 was deducted from the bill. I requested to speak to the person in charge about the situation and she took her time getting over to our table. I told her my food should be free since there was a problem with my order. She said to me that all she can do is take off 2.00. I told her that was poor customer service and she looked at me like I was crazy. I will be calling the diner and speaking to someone in upper management. Im sure they would like to know what happend. Losing customers is not an option for them.
Good after hours spot! I usually go around 2am on the weekend after hanging out at the epicenter. The food is okay, but the people watching is hilarious. FYI, the crowd can get a little rough.
The shrimp and grits are ON POINT!!!! Service with a smile and very courteous! This is one of my favorite get a way spots!

Came here for brunch on Saturday morning. This place was busy for its small size but our group of 7 only had to wait about 25 minutes to be seated. Our server, Chauney, was full of personality, very attentive, joked around with us, and we just loved her. We are in town for a bachelorette party and Chauney really catered to the bride. The food is amazing, southern comfort food. I had the French toast and it was awesome! Overall, cute little traditional diner and would definitely recommend Chauney!

I really really wanted this to be great. It was not.   The good:  - Cool place, great look, wonderful authentic feel  - The story of the diner presented in the vestibule, very cool  - The location is awesome, and it has parking  - French fries are thick steak fries and tasted great   The Bad: Everything else.  - Service started with "I just got triple sat so I'll do what I can" and went down hill from there to "this is why I hate when they run my food for me".  - mac and cheese is baked style with congealed cheese. Probably good when first made but not when served. Ate like leftovers from church picnic  - Philly Cheese steak had hard bread, very greasy, wrapped in paper then cut and served. You are forced to remove this very sloppy paper in order to eat  - "Smothered" hash browns are hash browns with 2 slices of American Cheese put on plate and stuck in melter, the meal served on same blazing hot plate. The worst hash brown I have ever experienced  - Chili on Chili Dog very chili powder tasting with no other balancing flavors  - Burger comes in same wrapped paper. Not as sloppy as cheese steak, but still not a fun way to eat a burger   I will try this again only because I love diners and really want this place to be what it can be. We need a good diner in Charlotte. As of right now, we still don't have one. Maybe tomorrow.

As a self proclaimed Charlotte foodie I had to try out the midnight diner. Our server was awesome. My only concern for this restaurant is that it could be a little cleaner. One of my pet peeves when I go out to eat is when there is food all over the seat when I go to sit down. The seat was sticky with syrup and crumbs. I ordered the chicken and waffles and it was delicious. I would definitely go back just for that!
Been here two times today first and my last food is good but the new waitress with a attitude throwing food at u don't sit well with me.
Stopped in after work...nice atmosphere and staff.  I ordered a waffle with cheese eggs and a side of bacon.  Waffle was good.  Eggs and bacon were not.  Bacon seemed very old and was tough.

Food is great. Service is terrible. Got kicked out for wanting to place a to go order. About 2 am on 5/14/15 there was a line waiting to to sit, like usual. So I walked past the line to the inside and to the register, as i usuallly do, to place a to go order. I have "skipped" the line several times before to place a to go order bc there is no need to to wait in line if ur not waiting to be seated. All the while i had called ahead to place my to go order  and was placed on hold. I was still waiting on Hold on the phone as I approached the register to place my to go order. I was approached by 3 officers and was told to leave the facility and that I needed to wait at the end of the long line  to place a to go order. I was extremely upset but I went to the end of the line anyway and called back about 39 times. After the 40th time I called someone finally picked up and I asked for a supervisor or  corporate number. I was told there was no corporate number and then i was hung up on. Terrible service wouldn't recommend going here unless you were desperate for food.

Food, Service, Atmosphere tied for AWFUL! Blaring music Adele? BBD? Hip/Hop? in contrast to rock and roll theme tacky and annoying.  Asked to turn down, cranked up again before we left.  Server disinterested, beyond rude( walked away abruptly when a concern over food quality was expressed) zero listenening skills or attention span.   3burger/fries ordered, no way meat is ground fresh, over cooked , tough and similar to jerky in texture to dry to taste if seasoned.  Hand cut fries, limp, underseasoned, cold, why bother?  Staff seemed more consumed and concerened with their inner circle than actual customers.  I felt sorry for the line of people entering when we left.  Like us maybe they just didn't know better.  One of the few times I would never go back.  First impressions: horrible.

When restaurants and stores put out banners that say "Best (fill in the blank) I am usually disappointed when I try it. Well, let me tell you I was not disappointed at this place who boasts the best chicken and waffles--I haven't had chicken and waffles (together) anywhere else in Charlotte but I have had chicken and I have had waffles in Charlotte and let me tell you I haven't found any that are better than Midnight Diner. Maybe it's the combination but its freakin' delicious. One of my friends got the same and a side of mac and cheese (gooey cheesiness, could use a little more flavor though) and she loved hers too! We were in C&W heaven. Our waitress was supernice, checked on us regularly and told us the truth when we asked questions about the menu (i.e. are the shrimp big or little in the shrimp and grits...LOL).  As I looked around the diner, everyone else seemed to be enjoying their meals too. While I can't visit toooo often I know that when I do I will be in for a treat. For some reason, I don't think they have anything bad on their menu. I hope they don't prove me wrong.   Oh and how great is it that they are open 24 hours--a definite need in Uptown. Yum-O.

To start off, I absolutely love this place. I live in downtown so this is such a convenient place to grab food after working late. It's exceptional diner food! I'm wary about ordering veggie burgers, but it's actually pretty good. But what keeps me coming back are the scattered hasbrowns! With a side of toast and scrambled eggs of course, and its under $4! My only qualm is if you're getting food to go, check it first, sometimes the guys in the back don't pay as much attention to the order. If you're headed there past 11pm definitely say whats up to Maria, you can't miss her!

One of the few places open late night in Charlotte to dine in besides a pizza joint. I found this place on Yelp and people raved about the shrimp and grits so I wanted to find out what is all about. I must say it really lives up to the hype. It's made to order served in a large soup bowl and a biscuit to sop up the rest of your sauce. Grits were creamy and savory delicious. The shrimp was cooked perfectly. When I was done I wanted to lick the bowl so I didn't waste any of it. But I didn't because I'm in a public establishment.  The place looks like a classic diner, long a and narrow but plenty of seating. Even after midnight the place was pretty busy. The servers were very nice and attentive. I will definitely be coming back here the next time I'm in Charlotte.

As diners go, I think that this is a very serviceable and decent place to go.  I think that might seem like damning with faint praise, but I really mean it.  Actually I'd give it a 4 stars for the breakfast (ate there a year ago and really loved the MIdnight Diner special).  Had the famed chicken and waffles, and while I'd give the chicken wings a definite 4-5 stars (so flavorful, so crispy, so moist!) I thought the waffle was "meh" and the side of broccoli I got (to be healthy) was also fine--plain steamed broccoli.  And the hash browns this time around were a bit soggy (a year go they were crisp and delicious--maybe the cook was off on this round).  My husband had the BLT and coffee and said it was good.  Cousin had the seasonal fruit--which was your basic melon/grapes/pineapple combo and the chicken soup (which she said was good but on the salty side).  I'm willing to give them another try--maybe they'll get another star next time.
I absolutely hate waiting in lines for a seat at a restaurant but I'm glad my partner made me do it. Great food friendly staff really a fun experience.

One of the few places in the world that I would stand in line for over 1hr.   FOOD WAS GREAT @ 2 AM. I got the Midnight Special with chicken wings.. the French Toast was great..and the grits...oh my..If someone wants to buy me a Christmas present get me a bowl of grits from Midnight Diner. No lie.. I ate the best grits in the universe.  Best part was the waitress Angela yelling.."If you have been here over 2hrs and your ticket is on the table..you ain't gotta go home but you got to get the hell out of here!"

I give this place 3 stars because it needs a huge makeover. The servers do not make sure to clean the seating area after customers have left before seating someone else. It's trash on the floors and you have to bring it to their attention to sweep it up. The food is very good though!!

The first thing I think of when I hear Midnight Diner is, "MMM! Grits!!!!" Their grits are incredible! Whatever I order whether it's the Veggie Omelette (delicious), the Chicken & Waffles (yummy!), or the San Bernardino (yes!), I get grits on the side.   So you know the Shrimp & Grits is an absolute winner in my book.  Every time my mom visits, she asks about this place. I try to spread the Charlotte eatery love by taking her to different places when she comes, but I know it is her absolute favorite.

As one of the only eateries within walking distance of my location, MD was slightly above average. Ordered the Midnight Special - two eggs, choice of grits or hash browns, 4 different meats and 2 pancakes (subbed a waffle for $1$)  Pluses - Breakfast served all day. Service was good, not too much, not too little. Coffee served in large, heavy duty mug. Food (with the exception of the bacon) was cooked properly and served hot and relatively quickly.   Minuses - bacon was undercooked and rubbery. Waffle was good but unremarkable. No idea why there's a dollar surcharge to swap out. No sugar substitute on table. 50s music (while appreciated) was waaay too loud. The single $ rating is misleading. Kinda pricey. Can get the same meal with equal quality at a Waffle House for $5 less. For a short order motif, the broad "no substitution" policy is puzzling  Bottom line - if you're in the area, a decent place to dine. Will try the non-breakfast fare another day
Great food. Fast service. Fun atmosphere. Open all day and all night. Yes, go here for the food and for the jump back in time.
The Bubba is delicious. Has a little bit of everything for breakfast. I will return. Seems like my review is a little short. But I think I got my message across with the first sentence.

You know you have to try a place when your waitress at another (very nice) restaurant recommends it and tells you their shrimp and grits are better than the place you're at. She was right. Shrimp and grits were $9.99 and cooked fresh when I placed the order. They were the best I've ever had - great texture, creamy and with a Creole sauce and jumbo shrimp. They were served with a huge, also excellent, biscuit.   Our waitress was friendly and efficient. She checked in to make sure I liked the food and offered to pack up the leftovers, send me off with more lemonade, etc. All of the staff seemed pretty sharp and customers were a good and fun mix of groups of friends plus families.   This is walking distance of the convention center; maybe a half mile from NASCAR.
Awe man the shrimp and grits is heavenly...  Also the fried chicken with collard greens and macaroni and cheese is addicting..

All was well and good until we saw a giant roach crawl across the floor as we ordered, to which the waitress grabbed a napkin and caught him with then put it in the trash can. She apologized and said they had just sprayed and he must have been a stray. Um, okay?!?  We decide to stay despite this because my wife really wanted shrimp and grits and had read that theirs were good.   Food comes... My burger had literally the nastiest looking shredded lettuce which smelled like it was turning and was a lovely pale yellow/green color and the tomato had the hard stem included in the center.  Completely inappropriate for a sandwich of my kind. I try to make the best of it and just dissect the burger and rebuild it. I squeeze some ketchup out for my hash browns and the taste was so foul I just couldn't bare to eat them. The ketchup was in one of those red picnic bottles and obviously had been refilled over and over again, and never cleaned out, because the ketchup tasted old and thick-- just plain bad.  We will NOT be back!   I suggest Eddies Place or The Diamond instead if you are in the mood for delicioua diner food along with a clean establishment and quality service.

I have mixed feelings about this place, but I continue to eat here often due to its proximity to my house (right across the street). There are certain things that they do very well, Chicken and Waffles, Shrimp and Grits, and breakfast. These are the only things that I have had here and they have all been exceptional (expect one time, see below)  You know whats coming now. Sometimes the service is spotty. Everyone is always very nice, but they seem weeded all the time! I once was sitting at the bar and stared at my food in the window for like 10 mins. When I eventually asked the manager to pass it over, it was mostly cold.   That aside, I think that the Diner filled a much needed void in downtown Charlotte and I will continue to be a cautious customer.
Delicious chicken and waffles.  Well worth the wait for the food!
Food was good but the service was terrible. Had to go out my way to get more water and to order dessert. Food was also overpriced.
I absolutely loved it!!!! The food is great and the waitresses are so happy and friendly, they messed up my sons order and fixed it quickly and gave us free cake!! Will surely go Again!!!
Food is good, like home cooked food. Always open, so perfect after a night of drinking or post night shift. Good sized portions. Ask for Luke he is the best waiter there, always on top of things.

This is my favorite breakfast diner in Charlotte. While there are lunch/ dinner options I know my go entrée is the shrimp and grits. I have never been steered wrong there! If you plan to go after a night out, the wait will be horrendous but the food is definitely worth the wait. The booths are very spacious and good for groups. The staff is overall friendly  (unless dealing with impatient, intoxicated people during the late night hours which is understandable). If you are not from Charlotte then this is a place you can't overlook on your visit.

I've frequented this dive for breakfast, lunch, and , dinner!  Lets get down to the point.. Fried chicken, corn beef hash, hash browns, waffle, biscuit sandwich, chicken sandwich Have all been out of hand. I am now a fan of grits thanks to this place.. And what better than a beer with your chicken n waffles.  Dont come here if your looking to watch your weight because you will be disappointed and come on yelp and write a bad review, ruining it for potential patrons. When you visit MD go in with an open mind and a appetite. I can then guarantee you will leave with a smile from ear to ear. Oh yea and the waiters are great!

I came here on a late night/early morning 3am munchie trip. Dear lord am I glad that I did. At 3am my biscuit was soft and buttery, my food hot and fresh and my server friendly. Yes there was a group of cop cars surrounding the place because some of the crowd had gotten into a fight and had taken it outside. But that doesn't reflect on the restaurant, the customers maybe. Anyway, I had two eggs over medium, hash browns and sausage with the afore mentioned biscuit. The hashbrowns were my least favorite, a little to greasy, and not really crisp enough, the eggs were cooked well, but the sausage stole the show. Link sausage might I add. Juicy, crisp outside, perfectly seasoned little links from heaven. I'm not a big meat lover, but I devoured all 3 links and dared the hubby to try to steal a piece. All in all, even with the somewhat rowdy crowd, I will be returning. My food was served quickly, the decor was cool and funky and the food was good. In need of a late night bite? Stop by the midnight diner, you will not be disappointed.

I love the diner, and the food is great. The issue for me is there general manager.eddie south, he has no relationship with his employees, he's not hands on at all, he comes in and looks around like he's afraid to eat from the diner, he want even shake your hand, I don't know if that's racist or just down right disrespectful. He's definitely not a hands on type of manager. He works all his employees to the bone,yet he's never there to help pick up the slack! To Eddie south your a hell of a general manager!

We just had wonderful breakfast at the Midnight Diner! This place was REALLY busy & the wait staff was moving! Our server, Tammy, was super friendly & gave us the "low-down" on how to eat the local cuisine. She was very attentive to our needs & really wanted us to enjoy our experience at the diner-she was a sweetheart. Good food too!
Fish San was really good. Mac n cheese just like moms.

The Midnight Diner is amazing me and my dad went there for lunch one although it can be very busy at times it has great food. Also there milkshake machine was down when I went there and they made me a milkshake by hand

I'm from the north so diners are kind of our specialty. They got the diner part right and it's nice to have a late night option, but the night I went here I was kind of scared for my life. Cops everywhere both inside and out, and the people going there to eat were pretty abrasive. Food wasn't bad, it's just your typical diner food. I guess it's a good after bars/clubs place.

You can expect a wait if you visit this small but popular diner. I'm happy to report that the Shrimp n' Grits dish was worth the wait. Creamy  grits are paired with shrimp covered in flavorful creole sauce. You'll feel satisfied and eager to explore other popular dishes.

While their food is quite filling anytime of the day; the staff could be more efficient and accurate. I agree with one of the reviews here, I've been here 5 times and every single time I go(all evenings-around 9pm-2am), there is a number of staff taking smoke break right outside of the restaurant. I don't like breaking through a barrier of smoke just to go to the entrance nor do I like having the smell cling from such a short encounter. Sometimes the host is nowhere to be found so the servers just sweeps you off your feet to their section when eyed upon.   DON'T EVEN think about doing carry out orders either, it's never accurate and when you try to see if your order is correct by opening your to-go boxes by checkout, you get a slap down saying that "you don't need to check it, I made sure everything is in there." BALLS. I've had spaghetti without the house salad it is suppose to come with, no dressings, no sausage...the side items never made it either. They have a pretty clear sign that once you step out with your order, they are not responsible for missing items. CAN A SISTER PHYSICALLY CHECK IF HER ORDER IS RIGHT BEFORE SHE PAYS? WITHOUT NO FALSE ASSURANCE?   While I'm done with being bitter, I would love to thank the wonderful cooks and chefs. You guys make my tummy happy.  Their fried chicken is crispy and just right. French toast is enough to explode your abdomen on half orders. Tea is southern sweet. Grits are wonderfully buttery and creamy. Make sure when you order a breakfast sandwich, check if it's biscuit or sandwich bread. We were bummed when we got bread. Shrimp and grits, spaghetti hits the spot if you're "hangry". Can't pledge for the burgers since it's been dry(patty) and bland the last two times I've tried it.    If you're ever hungry late at night, try midnight diner. It's a miss or hit on the menu but give it a try. Some of the servers are to adore but some could use a good pair of boots up their donk.
We love midnight diner! Great food, better service and what tops it all off in my book? It was CLEAN!

Well, it's no WaHo, but as everyone here seems to reiterate, it IS right down the street...  With some friends in town this weekend, after a night of carousing, we were looking for a basic breakfast place and decided to walk down to Midnight Diner to check out the fare.  I have to say, I'm not as impressed/delighted with old-timey-style diners as maybe I'm supposed to be... they always seem a little too affected for my taste.  The good thing is that because of the family clientele Midnight Diner seems to attract (at least on a Sunday morning), it seemed like a relatively clean place; the bad thing is that it's kind of sterile.  That said, the breakfast food was good - standard breakfast food, but they didn't eff anything up.  The portions were gigantic and left us all feeling like little round butterballs that had to be rolled home through Southend.  My biggest contention?  Price.  This may look like an old school, old-timey diner from the outside, but when you look at their breakfast prices, you realize it's just another "Uptown" Charlotte, Super Charlotte People flytrap.  $9 for a basic breakfast combo?  Well, OK.  To each her own.

I would have never tried this place had my niece (NC resident) not brought my son and I here after our afternoon of shopping.   The chicken and waffles are VERY GOOD. I was pleasantly surprised at how soft and moist the Belgian waffle was. No joke. I didn't use any utensils because I just wanted the "finger lickin' good" affect after I tasted my first bite.   The chicken wings are probably one of the best I've had. Simple down home cookin' is what this meal reminded me of. Traysel took good care of us too!   This SoCal girl will definitely be back the next time she is in Charlotte.

Now this is my kind of a place! Well worth the 3 block walk from the conference center to a 24/7 diner with the best grits I have ever had in my life. Stopped in for jambalaya for lunch and went back the next morning for a 5:30 breakfast called "The Bubba" - wow - large biscuit smothered with cheddar scrambled eggs then smothered with sausage gravy, three links and grits.
Late night food option. Great service for drunks. Try the grilled cheese all the way.
Five out of five stars because we had the best breakfast in Charlotte!  We had great service from Parry but, the whole staff was so happy!  Great great!

This is my favorite diner in all the cities in which I've lived.  Number one, they serve alcohol which is fantastic and number two, the solid diner fare is accompanied by some of the friendliest staff I've met.  There is one waitress who puts on old school funk and sings like a pro--I love it when she's there.  It can get a bit crowded and loud, but it's a crossroads of life in the Queen City.

Back when I used to drink like a fish, I ended up here at the end of the night or early the next afternoon many times. In a drunken stupor or in the early stages of a hangover, I want the grease cure and anything that is bad for me. The food is probably fit for consumption sober as well.  This is a comfort food zone & its best to put all thoughts of counting calories out of your pretty little head & replace them with thoughts of chicken and waffles. Yes, just like everyone else who has eaten here, I've had the chicken & waffles.  This is THE meal to sop up a night's debauchery & it's just awesome all around. I'm a waffle purist and don't go for all that fruit and circuses on a waffle. Why mess with perfection? I mean if it ain't broke, don't fix it. But if you want all that shit on your waffle, they have it. Gotta be making stuff complicated.   A huge Belgian waffle with a side of 3 fried crispy chicken wings.  The waffle is light yet slightly firm(as it should be). Nothing worse than a waffle that is as soft and floppy as a pancake. If I wanted a pancake, I'd get a pancake. Lookin at you free breakfast at Hampton Inn.  If that doesn't sound good to you, then I don't know what to tell you. Get a salad? Find a place with linens & pay too much? One of those two.  The fried chicken could be some of the best in Charlotte. Once upon a time, some friends & I split a whole fried chicken meal in the wee hours of the morning with friends. After spending too much at the bars, it works out perfectly divided 4 ways since we are cheap & broke at that point. Chicken quartered, fresh and fried, always hot & never greasy. Food here doesn't sit under some heat lamp for 15 minuted before making it to your table. What's up with places like that? Bring it already.  Served with two sides, the mac & cheese is superior. And it was served with made from scratch biscuits.  All the other diner favorites are available. Deli sandwiches, omelettes, grits, etc. But weren't you listening?! Just get the chicken & waffles.

Three times and out! Though their food is great, their customer service absolutely SUCKS and they really could care less if you dine there or not. First, we stood on a Saturday night for more than 45 minutes while they refused to seat anyone due to short staff in the kitchen (though several people were allowed to skip the line altogether and walk right in to be served, go figure). They then passed out cards to go to another diner in the Epicenter. Giving them another chance due to their close proximity to my work, I called in an order for pick up only to arrive to find no one ever put it in. This last chance I just attempted to call in an order and was told I needed to call in closer to the time of pick up. Im done.
Latosha and Leroy were awesome! Great service. Food was hot and great sense of humor.

Shrimp and grits! Chicken and waffles! Philly cheese steak! OMG you have to go multiple times and try everything on the menu. It gets crowded on the weekends between 10p-3a so make sure you're ready to wait in line. The owner yells across the restaurant if your just sitting after you've eaten to let everyone know that she has ppl waiting to be seated so GET OUT! overall a great place to grab a bite

In Charlotte for my fraternity's convention and tried this place. Had the Carolina Burger. Very tasty with the cole slaw, chili, and cheese. Not a combo I would have thought would be as good add it was. Fries came out cold but our waitress Corie replaced them right away. Cori was really helpful and made good recommendations on the menu items. She was on point with the service too.  Bruhs had the chicken and waffles and they looked really good. They cleaned the plate so I would say they enjoyed it. Would deff recommend this place.

Is this true?  I ordered a PLAIN burger and it was brought out the total opposite and the manager came to our table to say "that a new law was discovered "today", that if an order is delivered to a table, the customer has to pay for it regardless"!!!  On top of that, the server came back to our table and wanted to argue with me to tell me that I DID NOT order it plain.  She was very rude and was shaking her head at me....with that being said, I asked for the burger "to go" and came home and gave it to my dog!  It was a bad experience and merely do not understand because we were nice customers.  We've NEVER had this experience and will not return.

Carolina Classic Burger, oh so good after a late night of partying! Go during the week, late at night b/c it packs out really quick on the weekends after the clubs close. The food is great, menu is like upscale waffle house with a 1950's diner theme. Very clean restaurant, the clientele is varied, and the waitstaff are very good. Prices are great too!

My family and I stopped at this diner after leaving the Carowind amusement park.  The diner was packed and the food didn't disappoint.  I had the coconut French toast.  This was the best French toast I've ever had.   Everyone else enjoyed their food and the prices were reasonable and the service was good.

I went to the Midnight Diner with my boyfriend this morning for breakfast. We've past it a million times, but have never been before. We were seated immediately and had a friendly and attentive waitress.  We both had chocolate milk (yummy and cold!), I had corn beef hash, scrambled eggs, and a biscuit (all delicious, especially the biscuit), my bf created his own omelette and he really enjoyed that.  The food was good, the menu is huge, the prices are extremely reasonable, and the service was great. I'm happy we finally tried Midnight Diner and I will definitely be back. Next time maybe I'll try the chicken and waffles :)

I came here a few days ago for breakfast and it was great.  I got a simple two egg breakfast.   Came with choice of meat, and I got a biscuit and grits.   Being from out of town, I am always down to try regional foods.  Both the grits and biscuit were amazing!    Fast forward for dinner tonight.  4 in my party ordered firecracker chicken sandwich, buffalo chicken sandwich both of which were good.  My brother said the firecracker was not really spicy as you would expect from the name.   Mom got shrimp and grits.  Wonderful!  I got a half fried chicken since my brother couldn't decide what to eat.  I figured might as well get the extra chicken for only $3 more for him.  I ate the white,  he ate the dark.  Sooooo juicy and hot.  Omg, the best.  We were going to go to Prices the other day, but they were closed for Christmas week.   No worries, the chicken here exceeded expectations!  Came with a biscuit and two sides. I ordered the mac and cheese and by recommendation from our server, the collard greens.  Both of which were great.  The collards were a better than the mac and cheese.    And such a fun, happy place!  Everyone was in a great mood.

Absolutely wonderful experience! Super clean, awesome music variety, amazing food! The hostess was attentive and the waiter was super accommodating and was very personable! The experience was great as there was a good atmosphere and friendly staff. I've never been in the Charlotte area and happened to stumble upon this gem of a secret in downtown Charlotte! I will definitely be back and bragging about my experience and highly suggesting it to my family and friends as well as my fellow yelpsters!

If I could give this place a "0" I would but I will give it 1 star because the food is GREAT. However the Customer Service is TERRIBLE. Especially when you order to go. They never get the order correct....NEVER. I live downtown and would order from here like every two weeks. SOMETHING was always wrong with my order. You speak to the Manager about it and they are so lackadaisical. So only thing I could do is not spend my money there. So I didnt eat there for a Year. Even when my friends wanted to go, I would decline and sometimes we would choose another place or I would just go home.  My wife wanted the grits really bad today so I got POSTMATES to pick up the order for me. Yeah, it was wrong...AGAIN. Missing my bowl of Grits (main reason we ordered) and I ordered 2 midnight specials and only received the eggs and bacon for one of them. So All i got for my meal is the pancakes! what makes is worse is the POSTMATES guy was like "man.....they are kinda rude and rushy.." He showed me the receipt and the receipt is CORRECT.  I called spoke to "Reba" who said she was the manager on duty. Might as well had spoke to a street sign. Had to repeat myself multiple times and she seemed annoyed.   I will not be going there ANYMORE and I have already secured the contact information for the owner. I will be writing him directly. I am a business owner and i think its important for him to know that though his business seems successful on paper because people come back for the food, they probably could be doing 10xs better if the service was better.  Owner Name from NC Secretary of State website: Brian M Dominick

Good food, good value, friendly service, in a comfortable casual atmosphere. The real rating - I'll be back.    - Food: Had shrimp & grits and their "famous" chocolate cake. Very good food.  - Ambience: Classic shiny diner. Great mix of music from hip hop to classic rock, fitting a very mixed clientele.  - Service: Good service, enough attention without being annoying.  - Location: Convenient - just south of downtown.

Tried Midnight diner tonight for the first time. Meh describes it perfectly. Had Gails famous chicken salad sandwich hubby had club sand. both bland had to keep adding pepper to the chicken salad to get some kind of taste. Saturday night at 7:00 and they were out of banana pudding? Who does that? This was supposed to be one of their famous desserts! Don't you think if you saw you were running low Saturday morning you could whip some up since it is supposed to be made "in house"? We have tried Madies and like it better it also got a better write up in the paper from food critic, it is just a little hard to find but food was better and better value for the money. Will not go back.

Ok... This is Charlotte's biggest secret!!  Shhhhhh.... don't tell anyone..but their Shrimp & Grits, Chicken & Waffles, Fried chicken Mac & cheese collard greens dinner is the "BOMB"....     I truly can't believe,  that I've been in Charlotte for 4 1/2 years...and no one gave me the 411 on this place..    Well, I guess that's why it's Charlotte's secret..lol!!     Seriously... it's one of the cleanest, nicest place in Charlotte to enjoy a delicious meal, without breaking the bank.                                                                                         Great diner atmosphere, coupled with old skool music... What more can you ask for....  Check it out!!!!

Great spot to eat at. Reasonable prices, upbeat & friendly staff, short wait times (in my opinion)...and most of all great food. We had Chicken & Waffles, Chicken & French Toady and a Burger. All were solid and satisfying meals. The chicken was moist but wasn't greasy. And the French toast were nice thick crispy slices. The waffle was ok, nothing to rave about but nothing to diminish either. And The burger was about a 4 out of 5. The atmosphere is always popping and fast pace which I love. This diner is a staple on the Southend Charlotte scene that one MUST eat at.
Friendly service, tasty food  This place is good when you are not dieting lol  Could be a bit faster service and cleaner
OMG! You must try the shrimp and grits. I crave them all time. Mmmmmm.  Cute diner, service was kind and nice

Fun atmosphere, basic breakfasts and meals, some taken up a notch.  OH, and a beer menu! Hubs was thrilled with The Bubba and it looked amazing. Eggs on biscuits with sausage gravy.   I was happy to get the Midnight special with turkey bacon.  Basic egg breakfast made your way, but the pancakes were heavy/dry, although good flavor.  Obviously a favorite in walking distance of the Uptown!  Good thing we got there early, or we would have stood in line.

I'm a bit surprised by the bad reviews. I've been here 3 times since it opened in September, and I've been very pleased with the food and the service. After all, it's a diner, and if a diner can fix a grilled cheese sandwich the way it's supposed to be made, then it gets good marks in my book. The fried chicken is ridiculously good, and I have a hunch they might be getting the fried chicken from Price's Chicken Coop! Okay, maybe not, but it's just as good.  I'm sure this place will get better with time. I like it, so that should count for something, no?
Loved this place , dinner was good :)  food is too much to eat though :) I liked the ambience , it's cozy n bright :) I feel bad for eating after my gym though :(

I seem to be odd man out here. I've been here several times and never had any real delay getting sitted or attended to by a waitress. Admittedly, I tend to focus on sandwiches and burgers. My wife and I have enjoyed every visit and are a quickly becoming regulars. Service is always friendly without being pushy or constantly. The manager has checked on us every visit so far as well.  Personally, I would happily recommend it for some one looking for a good, reasonably priced meal.  The music and memorablia on the are nice touches as well.  You also must try the hand-mixed shakes, as they are excellent and remind me of what you get at the little mom & pop restaurants.

The food here was good! We were lucky to have gotten here before they got busy on a Saturday night around 630pm. The portions were HUGE and the service was good. All the food we ate was extremely hot and fresh, you could tell they just made it before bringing it to our table. I would definitely recommend if you're in the mood for comfort food  also, the music they played here was on point! Haha my family and I will be returning.
Amazing!! Service was awesome and food is delicious. You have to try the chocolate cake. It is the moistest cake I have ever had. Well worth the price by far.. Will definitely be back soon.

This was my first time going here and I was highly impressed. I arrived at the midnight diner with two of my coworkers for a evening meal and boy was it Great!!..the atmosphere inside was a 50s vibe. The music was modern and throwback which was perfect and our sever was very young attentive and social.  I purchase the midnight special with 2 scrambled eggs with cheese, two sausage patties, grits with cheese and two pancakes. Boy was that food cooked just right and affordable..will come again. THANK YOU!!
This is a neat diner but I was underwhelmed with the food.  I ordered the chicken tenders which were good.  My friend had avocado burger which he said was bland.  Cute concept but would not return.

Food is OK but the music is obnoxiously loud.  I left there 2 hours ago and my ears are still ringing.  I put in my earbuds to tone down the music but it only cut it by 10%.  You have to yell to be heard over the music just to order your food.    I wouldn't eat there again if the food was free and they gave me a $50 bill when I departed. Totally disgusted.

This place was ok when we came in the hostess was kind of rude. We didn't get a waitress until we asked for one. When we eventually got a waitress he was cool kinda sarcastic. The food was great the hash brown just needs more salt GRITS ARE PERFECT would come again.
The food is great. Customer service is great. Only downside to this place is it gets too packed and loud. On a busy night you can barely hear the person sitting next to you.

Something about this place that just kind of sneaks up on you unexpectedly when you first come upon it. I've always been sort of a night owl roaming around Uptown in search of social events to keep myself entertained and I spot this retro looking dinner that apparently is 24/7 which is terrific because I can't think of a better area in town that could benefit from a restaurant like that (There was an older one back in the day near the CPCC central campus but it had to close due to that school's vast expansion) The appeal of the place was too enticing and I was due for a meal anyhow so I popped in to give them a try. It's not a huge place but sizeable enough to handle the type of steady traffic they would generate. The nostalgic feel is replicated on the inside as good as it's exterior. The menu offers a nice variety of what you what expect from an all hours place with enough breakfast & dinner choices to suit all tastes. They on the menu some different shakes & deserts that looking promising although I haven't gotten around to trying them yet. They also have some beer\wine choices and they are willing to make you a mixed drink but they don't really advertise any particular kinds so it could be sort of hit or miss depending on what they have on hand. The food quality in very solid, won't blow you away but never anything that would keep you from coming back for more.  All in all, a nice diversion from the chain restaurants in the world  that is well worth a visit if you need a good meal in the uptown\south end area!
Friendly service.  Food was fresh and hot and delicious. Will be back tomorrow.  Grits and Shrimp... Yummy!  Chicken strips ... Fulfilling!

Walked down to the Midnight Diner on a frigid night in Charlotte... was warmly greeted and seated instantly... service was friendly. Food was good diner fare and the milkshake was above average!  Highly recommended for 24x7 food, and its only just outside the main downtown area!
Above-par for diner food. I'd skip the grilled cheese but the chicken soup is great.  This place never disappoints for late-late-night dining, people watching and tunes.
Omg the BEST  shrimp and grits I ever ate...yes there was a line buy with food that good there should be a line

Such an awesome find last night! I got the Bubba and my gf got the chicken and waffles. Everything tastes great and the staff was super nice. Also it was a very clean diner I recommend this place to anyone who loves comfort food!
I finally got a chance to stop by Midnight Diner and I must say I was impressed! The food was great and the service was excellent! Tammie\Tammy was an amazing server!

I came in about 9:30 on a Thursday night and the place was packed. I got the famous shrimp and grits and they were phenomenal. Our server Cori, was excellent and very entertaining. I love the classic diner look and feel. Overall my experience was outstanding. Good food, good prices, and great hours all through the night.
Where else can you get a shot of Jack Daniels with your breakfast?  A truly 1 of a kind atmosphere.  Why settle for IHOP when you can come here?

Good ole' Midnight Diner.. a classic stop for a Sunday hangover.   This little diner is quiet small on the inside so wait times can be lengthy (20-45+ minutes) on peak times (Sunday Brunch particularly).   There is a large variety of options on the menu to satisfy any mood you are in. Breakfast is served all day and all night (thank you lord). They also have your typical diner food (burgers, fries, shakes etc). I stick with my normal brunch plate: eggs, grits, and potatoes. It never disappoints.   Rating 4 stars only because it can sometimes be dirty with the high volume of traffic in such a small place. The wait time is also tough on a hangover (out of their control but still a struggle).

I live right across the street and I don't know why I don't eat here more often! I have been here about 4 times now and there is always a line out the door later on in the night on the weekends and on Sunday morning. I ordered take out on Thursday night and it was ready in about 15 minutes. I got the Firecracker Shrimp salad and I'm kind OBSESSED now. First off, that bread! Whoa, topped with shredded cheese then under neath all the ooze is garlic/honey flavor. You will want to eat both pieces right away.The portion was generous and full of veggies. The creamy Parmesan dressing goes perfectly with the spicy breaded shrimp.  I also took a few, ok numerous bites of the bacon ranch wrap and mini burger sliders. Both were great, but the sliders....oh I could have ate both of them! Grilled onions, cheese and pickles. That's all you need. Ohh, and that secret sauce! Delicious! The buns are baked in house and they had a sweetness about them. I loved their seasoned fries. I need to try the shrimp and grits next!   I'll be back soon!

The only negative thing I can say about this place is the long wait. The two times I've been there, the line was out the door. Once I was seated and started eating, I understood why. The food is outstanding. I've had the chicken wings and waffles. Delicious. The chicken was crispy, fried hard and well seasoned. The waffle was perfection. But to me, the absolute best item on the menu was the grits. They were the most creamy grits I've ever eaten. I got them to put cheddar in my grits. They were delicious. Next time I'm there, I will definitely get grits again. The menu has a very large selection of food. I really enjoyed dining there.
Fried chicken n biscuits with a side of sausage gravy and shrimp grits ... to die for! Best I've ever had!  Great service!  Must stop if your driving through Charlotte ... Just off Route 77!

Charles H. is a liar. There is no way his review is genuine. We had lunch there today and our experience was not even close to Charles' fantasy. However, I am not here to review Charles.   Diner itself is cool. No police cars there today. Diner's are, as one reviewer put it, supposed to be places serving fast,greasy,cheap food in large quantities. Showmar's has larger quantities and the food is probably at least as good.     The service was fine. I had the Philly Cheeseteak but didn't order the a la carte fries. The sandwich was cooked well and tasty but I could have eaten three of them. My companion ordered the fried chicken sandwich and it looked small and he said it was only OK. He did order the a la carte fries though and they were very mediocre, at best.   I asked the server if I could order breakfast at lunch and she said no sir but they are thinking about changing that. Also said the a la carte sides are something management is looking at as well.   This place could be very cool but right now it has the feel of a corporate chain "diner". Diner's, Drive In's and Dives will not be stopping here anytime soon.

The go-to spot for late night dining! They have everything you need. (Including a little bar lol) They have everything you would expect to find in a diner, but better! The fried chicken...gives the Chicken Coop a run for their money. Anyone from Charlotte (and transports) knows what that means. Well worth the 18 minute wait. I'm still trying to figure out what's in those darn grits!!!!!! They are so creamy. The food is simple and delicious. If there's any kind of event going on in Charlotte *cough cough...CIAA*, expect a long wait to get in the door! You won't be disappointed. SN: They also have a little food cart behind the Uptown Cabaret!

Went in to warm up and wait for crowds to clear after the ACC championship game. Diner has a unique personality, as does the wait staff. Sorry to say the food was not good: chicken soup was warm, not hot; grilled ham n cheese was cold enough that the cheese did not melt; sausage was overcooked and shriveled up; waffles were cold. On the other hand, chicken strips were good and the grits were tasty and hot. Overall, an underwhelming experience.
I absolutely love this diner. The waitstaff is friendly and the food is delicious! Try the grits!

I would have given the overall rating of 2 (because the staff was unprofessional and unpleasant), except I was there during CIAA weekend and I gave them a little credit since the restaurant was so packed.  Pros: -On a cold, busy night, we were sat within 15 min. -It was clean. Even with all the people there, they turned over tables quickly and everything looked good, even the restroom. -2 of us split a chicken and waffle meal and they gave us no trouble adding a wing. (Nor did they charge us a "share" fee). The chicken and waffle meal was EXCELLENT. -The sweet tea was excellent, but that's to be expected in the South. -The total bill for 5 people (4 meals) was only $40.  Cons: -The "host" (a big man at the front door yelling to guests) was not friendly. Very aggressive and not attentive. I know it was busy but still, he could have been nicer. -The waitress(es) (because we were served by about 3 of them) were ok. They were not overly friendly or accommodating. They were average. One of the ones that served us told us that she wasn't our server when we asked for more napkins. :-/   Overall, I'd go back to enjoy the food on a less busy night if I'm in town again. However, I'd hope that the service was better.
Food is good. Not a bad wait for Sunday afternoon. Had chicken and waffles. Had to wait for syrup. Server AJ was friendly.

Reading other reviews, both good and critical, there are some valid observations. Nothing about this place feels upscale, the crowd is a mix, it's always busy, the Shrimp & Grits is incredible. While Texas Pete is available and punches up the flavor, the creole sauce is robust enough to stand alone, the green peppers maintain a crunch of freshness, and the grits are smooth. Don't know if they can blacken the shrimp, but that would be a nice finish to this otherwise excellent plate the menu says is made to order. Five stars is based on this experience

If I could leave a negative star I would! I'm usually a regular at midnight diner because I work weekends at a night club not too far from there. However, I just went to place a to go order and was never acknowledged and finally after sitting there for 20 minutes me and my coworkers were informed by a waitress that they were not allowed to place a order. WHAT!? Never again!
First time here while visiting Charlotte. Nice environment. Food was delicious will definitely visit again when I'm in Charlotte.  My boys loved there food.

What you would expect in a Diner..... A good simple and hearty breakfast.  They have all the standard breakfast fare, be it omelets (egg white variety too), pancakes, french toast or belgian waffles.  They have amazingly tasty and buttery biscuits so forego the toast for the biscuit, and order a side of sausage gravy to split with your table.  Also the grits are amazing, and I'm not a huge grits fan, but these suckers have butter or cream in them that make them delectable.  I suggest having one person get grits and others in your party get the hash browns and you go halfsy and share.  The Friendly staff seem like they have been there for years, and they are efficient at least while sitting at the counter where I was.  Believe me you will leave this place exceptionally full that will last you all day.  I'm still full while writing this review, and I was there about 6 hours ago :)
Everything we had was SOOO good. Coconut French toast and wings is a must try. Service was great too. Definitely will be back!

The first time coming here was during ciaa and the waitress stopped the music to say "if you got your food and ate already, get the hell out of my diner! " Never have I ever experience such poor customer service. How  can an establishment treat their PAYING customers like this?? Solely based on that poor customer service, I would not recommend this diner to my worst enemy.

In town for the weekend, a charlotte resident recommended this place and im glad we did! Best grits i ever had! The fried chicken was excellent, perfectly done....juicy and crispy! Based on reviews i swapped the waffle for french toast which not surprising was delicious!  The waitress was a sweetheart. We definitely plan on going nack tomorrow to try out more....the menu had so much to choose from everything sounded so good!

It was my first time at midnight diner. Staff is really nice and attentious from the hostess to the server. Our server gave us suggestions before we ordered and was always present giving us refills and asking if everything was all right. She even cared about the fact that I'm pregnant and made sure that my food was well done and the broccoli cooked with no salt. Great service. The food didn't take too long to be prepared and everything tasted really good.  I got the hamburger steak with broccoli and mac n cheese and my husband got grilled cheese and breaded chicken tenders. It was all really delicious. For drinks we just got ginger ale that was always refilled, and that's how it should be. Overall we had a great experience and will for sure be visiting again.
Good food at a reasonable price. Pleasant staff. What more can you ask for. Oh, and late night hours WoW.

I've had bad experiences and good experiences here but what else could be expected of a place that has such high volume. This restaurant is very popular for a good reason. It has an awesome location and is open 24 hours plus has an extensive menu and booze! I'll definitely return and play "waitress roulette" because some of the servers are less than...

Been here about 6 times for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It's really uneven in terms of both food and service. Our first time, for a late lunch, food and service were both solid. After that, not so much.  Prices are good. Breakfasts are large. The sliders come with mayonnaise on them which I despise, so that kinda ruined one of the lunches. Had a spaghetti with meat sauce as a special last week that was truly bland and soggy -- and the most expensive item on the special menu. Also had the smallest Texas toast I'd ever seen.   Was there a few days ago on a sort of busy day and the staff were absolutely in the weeds. Couldn't even point people to empty, clean tables. We waited ages, with our small child getting increasingly unruly, before my husband just finally took a seat. They seemed annoyed by that and took forever to bring set-ups, water etc. I'd hate to see them when they were really full. As we left there was a line out the door and quite a few empty tables; the staff just never found their rhythm.  The place is clean and there is a good jukebox. At times the music can be too loud, but it's fun. I like this place and will probably return for staples like breakfast or a burger, but will stay away from their specials. I'll keep looking for the diner experience I know that's done better in other parts of the country.
Their shrimp and grits are fuckin amazing like everyone else stated. Their chicken and waffles are delicious. Would recommend!

There are few places near uptown that are as accessible and as easy to get to as Midnight Diner.  I ordered the coffee and it was generally what I expected from a diner lol.  I didn't come here for the award winning coffee.  It's a good place to stop by to grab a quick breakfast that is decently prepared.  The morning crowd is drastically different than the late night crowd; it is comprised mostly of professionals on their way to work.  The service is much better early in the morning.  You'll see what I mean if you visit this place during the night hours.  Overall I love occasionally stopping by this place.  Try the Fried Chicken for lunch.  It's good.

Great service, food is fresh.  Everybody is super down to earth and friendly.  Busy place, expect a 15+ min.wait, but worth it.  If you want to enjoy a casual dining experience with good food, come here.  We will frequent here. Thank you...

I usually get the fried chicken here, which is delicious.  It comes with a biscuit that's sadly usually old or overcooked that I end up not eating, but I don't really care 'cuz it's free.  They have French toast which is made of that huge challah bread and tastes like you're eating bread that's been dipped in the eggs from god's ovaries, ohhh it's that yummy.  (God has ovaries right?  He's like, both, right, has everything?)  Their chicken noodle soup is sadly a disappointment.  I'm always on the search for delicious chicken noodle soup, and theirs was all... bleh.  The broth was icky and the noodles were thin and twirly.  Restaurant chicken noodle should be thick strips of noodles, you foolish fools, not twirly little pathetic bastards!!  But that's not why they get four stars instead of five.  The reason is their music.  Usually I come there late at night and, I dunno, I guess they're going for this trendy club-atmosphere or something, because they BLAST that shit and it's awful.  It's not that I hate the music (which I do because it's awful trendy crap, but I could change it by picking something out of the jukebox if I wanted), it's that it's SO.  Friggin'.  Loud.  I guess, I dunno, the rest of you people have so completely damaged your hearing that you don't notice, but to me it's physically painful.  It's like sound warfare and I feel like I'm being attacked.  Plus I can't actually talk to my companion(s) without shouting at them.  Since atmosphere is a big deal when going out to eat, there have been a few times where we've decided NOT to go there because we aren't in the mood to put up with such loud nose.  But you know, they change that and bam.  I'll give 'em five stars.  And since we all know how much everyone wants MY five stars, I bet they'll be doing it within minutes.  Huhuhuhuhuh.  Update:  They don't do cheese fries anymore.  For some reason.  Considering cheese fries is just melting cheese on fries, both of which they have, in like a microwave or under a heat lamp, this loses them a star.  It was my favorite side.  :C

I haven't left a restaurant due to the service in a very long time so, it's upsetting that I had to leave this dinner because of it. I have eaten here on numerous occasions, both late night and for brunch. Though it seems the service has been put last on the list.  45+ minutes for two eggs and grits on a sunday at 2pm is inconceivable with over 10 people on wait staff, and I ended up taking my order to go which had not a single thing I ordered correct, and no utensils or napkins. I understand that this place get busy, its right off the light rail and good prices for a greasy spoon but dang, never have I waited that long

The midnight dinner misses the mark, the first time we went we thought it was great and than we went back and everything was very wrong. The restaurant is filthy, their sanitation score is a 90 and I should have know better. The cleanliness is a HUGE issue! Their floors are constantly slippery due to grease, the silverware and cups are always dirty food particles on them, it's just disgusting.

Got into Charlotte on a late flight and needed something to eat...with limited options at 12:30am gave it a shot. Ordered a Bubba special...wow that's a lot of food!!... Sausage gravy was amazing...Biscuits great and eggs done just right...sausage was the only let down...dry and no flavor but we'll definitely be back to try other options!!

Was excited to give this place a great review.  We had to wait awhile to get a table so my curiosity was building.  A very mixed crowd of college students,  senior citizens and families.  Our server was right on us as we sat down. We ordered several breakfast items and we were not disappointed.  All came quickly, correctly and hot. We love this place when traveling for business.  Great local place

I drove up to Charlotte yesterday to take my girls to Paw Patrol on Sunday and looked up some places to eat after the show. My girls are a little picky so I needed a place that has a bit of everything and Midnight Diner was a great fit! The inside and outside was very cool. Our waitress was really nice and the food came out quick! I will definitely like to come back for another meal.

It's been a while since my last visit. I've notice that many things changed. Ordered (as used to) the Bubba, used to had two biscuits with gravy, bacon, and hash browns. Yesterday I received only 1 biscuit (cut in two halves), the bacon was extremely salty and hash browns raw, not well done at all.  I don't think I'm coming back, I live in Ballantyne and I have best options around here now. The stars are only for Dave.

Holy smokes this place rules. My husband ordered the coconut crusted french toast and it was literally the best french toast I've ever had in my life. Biscuits and gravy were great, corned beef hash was excellent and I typically don't like it much. Our server Angela was really nice and prompt, will definitely be coming back here and bringing out of town guests also
Had fun in Charlotte....great city...horrible restaurant!
The food was great as far as the customer service not so good service was pretty quick but received the wrong food twice . With better customer service this place would easily get 5 stars.

We had another fantastic experience at Midnight Diner; this time for lunch instead of breakfast.  First, being close to Uptown, let me say that I'm SO glad they have very close parking for customers.    Our server, Rachael, was fantastic.  She's what every server should aspire to.  She was friendly, perky, attentive, and genuine.  I hope she never loses that optimism.    One of the lunch specials was Shrimp and Grits with a creamy Cajun sauce.  Rachael recommended it, but my partner was already contemplating it.  That sealed the deal.  He ordered that and I went with the Black & Blue Burger.  I tasted the Shrimp and Grits.  It was SO delicious and full of flavor.  The creamy Cajun sauce was a great addition.  I should have ordered it.  The Black and Blue Burger was just okay.  Maybe it needed more seasoning and blue cheese dressing in addition to the chunks of blue cheese.  Of course, being a bit redder/pinker inside would have been nice, too.  Unfortunately, you can't get that in NC (Boo!).  The fries accompanying it (with a side of ranch that I requested) were delicious, though.    And you can't beat the prices or clean, shiny atmosphere at Midnight Diner.  They're two for two in my book!

I came here a few weekends ago looking to get a late night dinner. Never again will I go here on a Saturday night. The wait is ridiculous. About 20 minutes later, I sat down at the bar area. The waitress was ok at best. It seemed like the place could have had more waiters on hand. Anyways, the wait wasn't too long for the food. I got 2 biscuit sandwiches which were good. Come here if you're done partying in Uptown for the night and looking for a decent midnight meal.

Ms. Vicki was hilarious and $7.99 for a 2 piece fried chicken and 2 sides, damn !  Went Midnight right before the crowd converged. A mixture of Charlotte I'm guessing as I was visiting. good food incredible prices. The huge slices of cake where really good. Our guest had the chocolate and red velvet and the tasted very fresh

Alright...this place has taken an early beating, but I still needed to try it for myself. And while they are still working out obvious kinks, my experience was A-OK. I went here for lunch by myself and sat at the countertop area in front for the TV. Nice that Sportscenter was on for me. The menu is extensive and detailed. About 7-8 pages I think, but don't be intimidated by the thinkness. It's just the words that are big, probabloy for those visiting late night that can't see so clearly.   Ordered the "midnight special" which is your typical breakfast place 2 of each. 2 eggs, 2 pancakes, 2 bacon/sausage and hashbrowns. All this for $8.99 (see biz pic as I took one). Maybe an extra $1 too much or so, but for the size of the pancakes I can see how they justify it. Only issues was that my over-easy eggs were a little too runny in terms of the egg white. Probably go over-medium to be safe.   A lot of people running around and I did see some food come back ans I was sitting in front of the expediting area. That said; my meal was good and I'd probably go back again.

I generally love diner food, but it's not here. I visit this location at least 4 times a year hoping it would change -- each visit lowers the expectations a little more. I ordered a simple 2 eggs, sausage and rye toast and it took in excess of 25 minutes. Why?  The eggs were wrong, then the toast, and finally it was cold. The wait staff remains disorganised. The service window is too small. The place could use a makeover  to decrease staff congestion.  I will try again in the new year.
Very friendly atmosphere. The shrimp and grits are amazing. Creamiest grits you can imagine. Check it out.   Two cautions: 1. Saturday and Sunday mornings are busy. 2. Limited parking.

This place is always over crowded it seems like and the food that I had I wasn't pleased with and it's always something happening here as far as crime. This place is always on the news it seems like and it's never for the food I wouldn't recommend this place to anybody I have people that swear by it and I have some people that feels the same way I do... I say try at your own risk rather it be the food or your life lol

Thank you Midnight Diner for not disappointing. This place has the best atmosphere and service and the food is amazing. I'm so glad we made it here while in Charlotte and I believe this place will become a regular stop on our go to places in Charlotte.
Great food, horrible service. Thats typical. If you can get pass not being greeted, multple different servers, no silverware, u should be ok.

Best Diner in Charlotte !!! Breakfast was outstanding. Generous portions prepared exactly as requested. Friendly service and fair prices. And I hate grits, but the waitress brought some over for me to try. All I can say is "Delicious!".

I went today for lunch. I have driven by this place waiting for it to open sooo many times!! Well it's finally here and I'm glad because it was pretty good for its second to third day open! Parking is annoying...not many spots.  The server was really overwhelmed when we first got there but turned it around midway through. It took a few minutes to be approached and then a little more time for our order to be placed but I figure it couldve been worse!!   It's rainy and gloomy in Charlotte today so I opted for the "Famous" Fried Chicken with Mashed Potatoes and Gravy....Famous? What makes it famous? (like in ELF when he finds the "Worlds Best Coffee"...I love that movie, anyways)The flavor was lacking and seasoning was needed, but the fry on it was good and the chicken was moist. The mashed potatoes were also bland along with the gravy.   All in all not that great of an experience BUT it has all the potential to be great once they figure things out! The servers are still learning the menu as the chefs are too! I will be back only to be proven right that they just need a few days to get into their groove!!

I went to Midnight Diner at 2:30 am. I was in town for a conference downtown. I ordered the shrimp and grits. It was okay, I didn't really care for the sauce included. The customer service was actually great and we didn't have to wait. Midnight Diner has limited parking on the backside.  This is the classic late night/early morning spot after a night downtown.

Not bad for the first time around. Dave started off pretty sluggish and inattentive but he pulled it together and redeemed himself. I ordered the chicken and waffles while my colleague ordered the burger. When her burger arrived with onions, she asked me to switch plates. Even though my taste buds were set for a sweet and salty combo, I was just as pleased with the burger and home cut fries. I will definitely return.

I was so excited to find a diner that was open late hours and serving real diner food.  Unfortunately, there were too many things about this place that I didn't enjoy that I most likely won't go back unless I'm with a group and I lose the vote.    Upon entering during a busy weekday morning, we were seated pretty quickly, but the hostess and people behind the counter did not appear friendly.  Our server was nice, and the orders came out after a wait, but the food was not great, and expensive for diner food.  I am used to breakfast bills coming in under $20, but not here.  Music was playing loudly at 8 AM and it was hard to have a conversation with someone.  I really wanted to like this place, but wasn't impressed.

I had a great experience and delightful tasting food today. The service was awesome (shout out to my waitress Ericka Harrison) as I was constantly checked on and my food came out shortly after coming off the burners. If you're in the neighborhood then stop by and check out this place. You won't be disappointed

Good fried food, beer, and liquor, plus stripers next door, if I could bring my dog along this would be a mans paradise.  I've honestly only run in to stuff my face and then be on with my day here.  Chicken biscuit with a water, in and out in less than 15 mins.  Will give it a proper review in the future, because I'm sure I'll be back.

I can't believe this place only has 3.5 stars. There must be some tough critics out there. Either that or people that don't know good food. I learned about this gem from a faculty member in my doctoral program. She told me she heard good things about this place and wanted to check it out. After talking to her, I naturally went on Yelp and looked at the reviews and pictures. Needless to say, my interest was peaked and I went that same night. There was no wait when I arrived and the hostess showed some southern hospitality. I'm not used to that up in Pa. I ordered the dark meat fried chicken dinner with two sides and an extra thigh (call me greedy). My sides were mac n cheese and collard greens. It also came with a biscuit. The food was so good, I had to eat it slow just so it wouldn't go away as fast. No...the food was so good I tried to come back for breakfast two days later. But I was in a rush and there was a 20 minute wait, so I was unable to indulge. Yes I was very heartbroken. Instead of pancakes, I had a Greek sandwich somewhere else. But if I'm ever in Charlotte again....guess where I'm going.
5 stars if you're drunk, two stars if you're sober.  Only come here late at night (midnight's in the name for goodness sake)

Keiosha was great. Chicken & waffles for $9.99. Group of us were 6 deep and were seated at 2:30 am and waited in a long line that went quickly. Roughly 30mins. And food came in 20mins...perfect for an after party/club'n crowd.

What can I say about the Midnight Diner???  Let's see....when you go here you should definitely expect an "experience". Whether it's the waiters and waitresses singing and dancing or the unique dining crowd which really just can't be explained...This place almost always makes one of those nights you and your friends will never forget.  But this review isn't based on any of that...these four stars are solely based on one dish...the shrimp and grits.   My goodness.   One bite of these grits will have you asking yourself: "Where in the hell did that come from??" These grits are creamy, dreamy and steamy (if I could think of another rhyming word I would use it) Top that awesomeness with shrimp and I just really don't know what else to say. Geesh...I loved them!   Seriously, if you can manage to find a parking spot and actually get a booth this place is totally worth it.

I refuse to eat at a places where the staff is rude. The very first person I encountered when I walked in the door had an attitude problem (the hostess). So we turned around and walked out the door. I don't care if the foods good. There's tons of great places to eat in Charlotte with friendly staff.
the coconut french toast is to die for!!! good service. friendly atmosphere.  would go back!

After giving it more shots than it deserved, I'm never going back.  Food: unpredictable, but overall bad Atmosphere: cute decor, poison air Service: spotty, either decent or never again  I wanted to like this place so much. I drove past it every day as it was being built and was intrigued by the large, shiny box. Once it opened, I was extremely excited to give it a try. I mean, it was built to be a diner. It had to be good. Alas, I went a dozen+ times thinking that I had had bad experiences because it just needed time to settle. After all, it's new, it probably has to work out the kinks. I've finally decided that's not true.   We had one waitress who was amazing. A mature lady with witty humor, people skills, and a peppy attitude.The best kind of server you never find. However, most of the servers are below average and a select few are the worst I've had. Ever. Now, what can save a place with terrible service? Amazing eats. No such thing here. The breakfast choices are okay. Lunch is okay. Dinner is okay. The food is not horrible but it certainly isn't great. Nothing tastes fresh. It all just tastes okay.   And okay food does not make up for service this terrible. If you sit within hearing distance of the kitchen or bar, you'll hear servers yelling or making nasty remarks and their hatred for each other fills the air with tension.
