Overall, I'm not willing to endure a hostile environment, terrible service, and sub-par food for cheap prices and a convenient location. I'll go to Mattie's Diner for great food, great service, and a pleasant environment and sacrifice my driving minutes instead.

From all those Shrimp & Grits pictures I saw , this place was on my list and I had to go here for those . We were here on an early Sunday Morning and were seated immediately . Our waitress was a Superstar . She was a ball of energy . We got the Omelette ,Pancakes and Grits . Boy o Boy were those grits Creamy ! They were so creamy that I never go to chew on them except for the shrimp. Gulp Gulp Gulp. I would have loved if the dish had more spice but I am not complaining . Omelette was great too . My only gripe was about the pancakes , they were flat ,rubbery and chewy . Not a Fan . Nonetheless I enjoyed my meal and service thoroughly and would go back .
Avoid at shift change.   Apparently that's when they deceleration.  Oh, and a 95 cleanliness rating.

I was highly recommended to go to this place by a few co-workers and since I am new to the area, I decided to give this a try because I love breakfast. However, once my food came out....Let's just say, I don't get the hype. Maybe it was an "off day" but my pancakes were teerrrible... I mean, how can I put this. You really can't screw up eggs, hash browns and bacon - this is almost IMPOSSIBLE to screw up. The pancakes? This is the only reason why I came. The pancakes were: FLAT, TASTELESS, PLAIN and Tasted like boxed pancake mix, mixed with water. These were some really bad pancakes. There was zero flavor and looked undercooked. FLAT. Oh, I said that already. The only reason why I'm giving it a 3 stars? Well, my husband liked his French toast. I'm going to give it another try because my coworkers SWEAR this place is great but I will steer clear from the Midnight Diner Special. No pancakes for me.   The service? This was another blah - I don't ask for much. But he was not attentive at all.

This place is way overrated! Although the staff is friendly and the food is ok+decently priced, even their to-go orders take forever= I've never waited less than 30mins for anything- including salads! Inside feels grimy, music is cranked up way too loud, the late-night crowd is a mixture of hood and trash clientele, male customers verbally harass you if you're not interested in flirting back with them, panhandlers bombard you in the parking lots... not surprised that shootings have happened on this property. I highly recommend going to the other 24hr places in the area.
The French toast and shrimp and grits are a must! The food is always consistently great!
I've been here before and the food is delicious. The staff  are super nice.  If you ever on Charlotte and Love GOOD COMFORT food, you MUST eat here

Definitely do not go here sober or during the day hours. The food simply isn't that good at all. The coveted fried chicken is alright but there are many other options in the area. It is a good late night option after a lot of drinking. The crowd can get extremely rough. The food is average but you will have some good people watching opportunities. Don't expect much from food and service and you'll be alright.

Midnight Diner is home of the best French Toast I have ever had. The grits are also amazing.  Don't go to Midnight Diner expecting a nice brunch place. It is definitely a casual diner, but the service is great and the food is pretty amazing! Plus it is always open!

Gotta love 'The Diner'. It gets busy here. Like, crazy busy. Service has always been good, but sometimes you need to just know ahead of time you'll have to wait to get seated.   If you're trying to call in an order --- you'll really have to get lucky and be dedicated. There are times where it won't go through, times where it'll ring and ring and nobody answers, and other times where you'll be put on hold only to get hung up on 3 minutes later. This is the one area that Midnight Diner realllllly needs to improve upon.  Breakfast --  Chicken & Waffles are good. Not the best you'll ever have, but definitely worth an order if you're craving chicken for bfast. My absolute go-to breakfast order is their shrimp 'n grits. The sauce is juuuuust spicy enough to have a kick, but still easily enjoyable. And the biscuit that comes with it?!?! Double up, buttercup.   Salads -- If you're feeling a salad, you will not regret ordering either the Picnic & the Firecracker Shrimp. Both of these are some of my favorite salads to order from a restaurant. not the healthiest you could go, but hey, you're comprimising and eating lettuce, right? And they come with garlic bread.   Wraps -- The firecracker chicken or cool ranch wrap are crowd pleasers.

Really good breakfast food. The grits are some of the best I've had, and the chicken and waffles are delicious as well. May want to go earlier in the evening however because the line is "out the door" anytime after ten.
Mediocre food and poor service. Noticeably went downhill over the last 5 years. Ambiance and location are still great. Free parking is limited.

Great place for breakfast!! Always packed and busy so get there early! I recommend the chicken and waffles, hash browns, orange juice, and fruit. The diner is very reasonably priced for an uptown Charlotte restaurant.

Ah,....the Midnight Diner.  One of the only places open late all the time so that I can be a super fattie whenever I want.  Let's talk about the decor/environment first.        I've been here at all hours of the day and it's usually a standard mix of people (Obviously the Twenty-something Club crowd is here in the wee hours of the morning) and average "Diner-ish" decor.  What I mean by that is, your standard framed posters of music icons and bright red paint and shiny stainless steel.     Now the food,... it's delicious.  Their burgers are large, tasty and served with gigantic steak fries.  Their Breakfast may be the best selection that  they have.  I highly recommend "The Bubba" which is a huge plate of biscuits and gravy, 2 eggs and my choice of Hash browns and Bacon.  It's at kind of a steep price ringing in at 8 bucks but like I said, it's a huge plate of food.  Their bacon is great and while that seems as if it's not a great feat, trust me it is.  I'm kind of an aficionado.  Today I had a fried chicken breast with a Belgian waffle.  Their waffle had just the right amount of vanilla extract and it challenged me to order a second one.  On the other hand, the chicken was slightly underwhelming.  The breading was just breading that lacked any great amount of flavor and while the actual meat wasn't dry per se, it wasn't exceptionally juicy.  I felt that it was just as good as any fried chicken I've made at home and I'm not a fabulous cook by any means.       The Midnight Diner gets my vote for late night feasting and you can't go wrong with the breakfast!

Horrid. Grotesque and if there were a worse adjective I would use that. I can't fathom how this place has any good ratings. Perhaps drunken millennial smasholes? It took us 20 minutes to be greeted at least. My well done burger was cold. Not quite sure how that happens and my husband is currently sticking his finger down his throat in the bathroom bc he felt so ill after his oh so delectable meal. Spare Yourselves, your digestive tracts and go elsewhere...you're better than this.
Best grits on the WORLD! really!!! Clean, fun, bright, 50's music. On the light rail at Carson blvd stop. Also has tvs showing sports.

I had a long blonde Hair in my drink (on the lemon) & what appeared to be the leg of a roach in my sisters grits.  I've always loved the food so if you're going to overlook sanatation issues then I'd get the shrimp & grits. Chicken & waffles is a good second. If you don't want breakfast I'd go with the cheeseburger sliders.  Good luck.

It took a while to get seated but hey it's tournament weekend.  My friend and I ordered entirely too much food and it was all good. Rae was our server and she was PHENOMENAL and very entertaining, friendly, knowledgeable, helpful,  and pleasant.  I'll be back to sit in her section.

Stopped into Charlotte totally on a whim with an incredible appetite. Midnight Diner definitely delivered! Small joint with private parking. The menu had great options for whatever your mood. Service was friendly & pretty quic. The shrimp & grits was amazing...very flavorful. We also ordered the chicken & waffles. The chicken was crispy and the waffle tasted like cake!   I sure hope to get bake to this place
The food is good however, I prefer to butter my toast instead of the cheap oleomargarine. Prices are fair though, and will come again!

Heard this was a Charlotte staple and I wasn't disappointed! This was my first time trying Midnight Diner and everything from the service to the food was on point! My bf ordered the French toast, eggs, sausage, and grits while I had the western omelet with turkey bacon. Delicioso (Kodak Black reference)! Couldn't be more satisfied. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a basic meal, particularly breakfast food.

Chicken and waffles.  Repeat after me: CHICKEN AND WAFFLES.  You must have this.  The fried chicken wings that come with it are the biggest dang wings I've ever seen.  Among the best fried chicken I've had in the South, too.  The large, Belgian waffle was a bit soft rather than crispy, but tasted good (and some people like waffles soft).  Maple syrup comes on the side so you can add as much or as little as you like.  Grits are very buttery so you won't need to add butter to them.  Cooked just right and creamy and yummy.  Satisfied my grits craving nicely.  My companions enjoyed their 3-egg breakfasts with bacon, and my Canadian friend tried grits for the first time.  He likes them.  :)  Very busy on a Sunday for brunch/lunch so expect to wait about a half hour to get seated.  Small amount of waiting in the foyer so if it's hot or rainy that day you should bring an umbrella for some shade while standing outside.  Alcohol available is limited to beer and a handful of distilled spirits.  Price of the meal depends a lot on what you order, as this place has a huge menu that is served 24/7.  But the three of us had breakfast for around $40 total.
Amazing food and service was perfect my 92 year old world war 2 vet grandfather couldn't come in the front and they let him in the back door. Food is cooked perfectly and is delicious.

We were visiting from out of town and decided to come here due to the good reviews. Our wait to get in wasn't too bad considering it was a Sunday morning. We were a group of 5 and it took over 30 minutes to receive our food. Our waiter was constantly talking to tables, flirting and giving out his number. This wouldn't be an issue if other tables that sat down after us didn't get their food before us. Our waiter stated it was because there were 5 of us and due to us ordering grits and sausage as sides our wait would be longer. My food was forgotten and while my family finished eating I still hadn't received my food. This shouldn't be the case because other tables were receiving the same food. Overall the food was okay.

This is my favorite diner in the Charlotte area. Their coffee is awesome, and the bubba is where it's at!!!! Order with a side of grits because they're amaze. Highly recommend. It does get extremely crowded on weekends, though, so keep that in mind especially if you're really hungry lol

Overall, the food and service were a-ok, but nothing about this visit blew me away.  As other reviewers have mentioned, parking is sparse, especially when you are there at lunchtime on a weekday.    Since I was by myself, I just sat at the counter.  The place was pretty busy and it took awhile before anyone came to take my drink order so I already knew what I wanted to order when my server finally did stop by.   I figured since I was at a diner, I couldn't go wrong with ordering breakfast.  I went with black coffee and the San Bernardino Omelet. The coffee was pretty good and did not taste burnt.  The omelet was made with diced chicken, cheddar cheese, avocado, and pico de gallo.  I went with hash browns as my side and whole wheat toast.    Overall, the omelet was not bad, but I did not care for the pico de gallo - it had too much harsh onion flavor for my taste. I pushed it to the side but unfortunately, it left an aftertaste of onion on part of my omelet.   The hash browns were "meh"... a little bland and just a touch on the greasy side. (I probably should have gone for the grits.... I saw in another review that they were creamy and tasty.)  The toast was not really toasted at all, which was not good.   (As a side note, while I was waiting for my order, I had a peek at their biscuits, and based on how yummy they looked, I should have gone with the biscuit instead!)  Another thing I spied while I waited for my dish was a plate of chicken & waffles...which looked pretty good.  If I go back, I may have to give that a try.    The employees were very busy, but nice, and I think if I had gone at a less busy time, I would have gotten more attentive service.  However, the manager did come by to see how I liked my omelet, so I appreciated that.   At $12.95 for a coffee & an omelet plus $3 for tip, the price was a little higher than I had expected when I walked in the door.   But, the menu is quite extensive, so if I happen to be in the neighborhood again, I would stop in to give them another try.

Went to the Midnight Diner for the first time.  It wasn't so bad.    A friend and I went at late night because we wanted something good to eat.  I suggested the Midnight Diner because I always see people going here.  I ordered the Chicken & Waffles, but I honestly wasn't impressed.  The waffle was good, but the Chicken was dry.  Maybe it was a first time thing, but I'm willing to give it another shot.
Went here for the first time last night around midnight, coincidentally. Server was super nice, veggie burgers weren't bad-not what they're known for obviously. I would go back.

Fresh off of an airplane and hungry for breakfast we headed to the Midnight Diner for sustenance. I had hoped for a biscuit with country ham but alas it was not to be found on the menu. I settled for biscuit with sausage gravy and an egg on top. Not bad.   The menu has a fairly good range of selections .My companion's omelet was good. Nothing extra ordinary nothing bad.
Everything about this place is amazing. I recommend the chicken and coconut French toast. Yum!

Had the chicken and waffles. Wings Crispy and juicy yet light enough for breakfast. Service was great especially chasmine! She let me sample her coconut French toast which was super good! Give this place a try.

Just take a half-step inside the shiny, chrome doors and see how Midnight Diner came to rest on Carson/Tryon. Uhhh....not so much hammer-and-nail here, but how about a nice trip down the highway on the back of a semi-truck? Sure. Rad. Pretty rad indeed.   Churning out pancakes, waffles, hashbrowns, omelets, and burnt coffee like they're going out of style, Midnight Diner is a haven for late-night carbloaders from all corners of Crown Town. If you're showing up for a 5-star meal, you might want check yourself at the door. It's a diner through and through. Low ceiling, cushy booths, counter seating, jukebox, old waiters, waitresses, line cooks. Like a Norman Rockwell. Just great.   You'll most likely walk out smelling like a mixture of vegetable oil and bad coffee, but sometimes pancakes are the only thing that will satiate an all-night rage before you hit the sack.   I'm especially fond of the hashbrowns that come "smothered, scattered, and chunked." Cheese, onions, and ham. Also, biscuits and gravy in this joint are spot on.   Glad that Midnight Diner is around and keeping Charlotte's nightlife well-fed with good ol' "brinner."

This place is a find!  We landed in Charlotte after a very early flight and Yelped it for a breakfast place. It was just what we were looking for. From the start the hostesses greeted us warmly, no waiting!  We ordered a few different biscuits but the best was the chicken biscuit with a little bit of honey... so stinkin yummy!  Also ordered a side of hash browns with ham on top and were not disappointed. They were flavorful and the portion size generous. Nice strong coffee, just right sweet tea with friendly service.  Great tunes playing in the background only added to the authentic diner feel. Gotta try this joint!

So this was my first visit to the Diner. I initially came in wanting shrimp and grits but was quickly swayed after seeing a Yelp review. Although what I ordered isn't on the menu, the kitchen didn't mind substituting what I wanted. So I ordered the fish dinner and subbed the fries and grits for grits. The fish is white cod, which I was super hesitant about but ended up LOVING! My server suggested I get it fried hard and with seasoning. I also ordered an egg and homemade biscuit. Great meal!! Please try guys

Love this place mainly because they have the best chicken tenders I've ever had!! It's what I've gotten every single visit since I discovered them. They're so juicy and are served steaming hot each time! I recently discovered that if you get them off the appetizer menu, you get a generous 5 tenders and a small serving of fries for super cheap - perfect portion, perfect price. Not to mention the peach-colored sauce that comes with it (smells/tastes like a mix of mayo and hot sauce) is bomb. If you're looking for a cheap late-night meal with friends and don't mind waiting out the guaranteed line, this is the spot to go!

Generally, since we only had dessert, I wouldn't review Midnight Diner until I went back for a full meal. The thing is I don't see that happening.  While the decor is completely charming (a clean, bright rendition of the classic diner vibe), the hours are where it's at (all of them), and the cake that I tasted (a bite of chocolate and many bites of carrot) was rich and delicious the overall experience was soured by the service.  Our waiter hovered over our booth (his only table at the post-midnight time) and kept asking if we were ready to order even though he was literally watching us still discuss what to split. Only once we decided on the brownie sundae, which he had suggested, did he tell us they were out of some of the ingredients. Maybe it's because I really hate feeling rushed or doing things twice, but by the time I ate fraction of my huge piece of cake I really had no desire to return. The food may be good, but there are other places to get good diner food in the wee hours in CLT.

Spent 30 mins in line with my pregnant sister which is expected for a pack restaurant. Unfortunately, half the tables were empty. When I asked why no one was being sat down to eat. The employees shrugged their shoulders. I then asked to speak to the manager. She explained it was a busy day and they would sit people when they cleaned the tables. I visibly saw them clean the tables. The managers name was Angie. Would not encourage people to visit here in the future

Nom.com   Charlotte staple and the latest bite in town. Being in the south can suck after midnight but midnight diner feels the void on quality food, quick service and late night hours. Whether your a banker grabbing take out in your way home or you've been drinking the night away at a near by bar. Skip the chicken and waffles and get the shrimp and grits. You won't regret it.

I'm an African American. I just left this place after waiting more than 5mins just for someone to say hello and seat my party of 4. I waiting while 3 servers walked by me and didn't provide any customer service. After I made a scene because it was a line at the door and several African American patrons waiting with seats available, I rang the bell on my phone and finally the hostess who was standing at the register looking sat us at a table. After less than 3mins sitting down, the owner asked us to leave because two patrons were upset about whatever was said which wasn't said about us about they way they had us waiting at the door. So w proceed to get a reason and eventually left.  I don't care how legendary or great the food is, TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.  CJ

Awesome food and great service. I asked to have some substitutions and they did it without even thinking about it. Music is a little loud so if you're looking for a quiet place this isn't it. Can't wait for my next trip to Charlotte so I can go back. Went for breakfast on January 30th, 2015.

It's not high art, it's functional food and it's an option. I went during dinner at 6:30. I had a minimal wait and was seated at a booth by the jukebox whose selections I forgot to peruse. Some other yelper please address.  The booths are comfortable and wide, enough for the two 240lb male consultants behind me or maybe three 120lb uptown clubbing women. I mention the clubgoer set because by and large I think that's where the patrons are going to come from for this establishment. What Charlotte has greatly lacked is a place making more substantive meals than bar food after 10pm between Uptown and South End/Dilworth.  The menu is as varied as you would want with a 24 hour diner. In terms of the breakdown of choices it's 50% breakfast, 30% lunch, 15% entrees, 5% dessert. I'd like if the low calorie choices were more interesting than iceberg lettuce + cottage cheese + protein on top. Iceberg lettuce is nutritionally bankrupt & except for a iceberg/blue cheese/bacon wedge it's not a salad base.  My order of steak & eggs came quickly and to order meaning the steak was as rare as legally allowed. This brings me to my opening statement as to what to expect. It is functional food served here, not haute cuisine. The eggs were a shade runney, which I prefer, the steak cooked well but could have used some rub and the hashbrowns definitely needed something. These are individual nitpickings as there was salt & pepper on the table and the waitress asked if I wanted steak sauce. The one gripe I have is the biscuit. It's more of a bread dough consistency than a Flying Biscuit/Zada Jane/traditional dough. It comes buttered so the flavor is there but the mouth feel is more spongey than flakey. It's not bad, it's just different.  Th service is warm & friendly without being hovering.  Parking will be an issue as there 8 spots. Carson St stop on the Lynx is a short walk away and I expect to see a number of cabs dropping off late night patrons.  Dear Charlotte, if your durnk if firmly on and you're not in the mood for another street side hotdog you now have another option.

The Food was Delicious! But the initial service was lacking. We came in around 9:30pm and place was packed. We were seated immediately but it took someone 15 minutes to even ask us for water. Once we got a server, (CC) she was pleasant and apologized for the shift change wait. Nice smile and very sweet.  Once our order was placed the food was out in 10 minutes, Hot and Fresh. I had the Fried Chicken, Biscuit, Mash Potatoes/gravy & the Famous 4 Cheese Mac&Cheese. The chicken was delicious! Seasoned and cooked just right. The potatoes were smashed and not instant and the Mac and cheese was pretty good, not the best I've ever had but still good. That Biscuit however was one of the best! Yum yum yum yum yum! I'll be back to try the Shrimp and Grits.  I did taste my Husbands Chili Cheese Fries and I'll be back for those too! That Chili was GOOD!

Less than a 1 - what a crappy place.  Went on Sat Nite around 2am and not enough help so I can't blame the waitress but seriously I was set at a dirty table and basically stacked the dirty dishes myslef and almost shoved them to the floor after 30 mins. Again not our waitress fault but horrible service and the food is not worth the wait .  You have been warned .

This is definitely a late night spot. Generally speaking, I wouldn't want to eat what they serve unless I had some liquor in me. And, the silver prefab pod thingey is a trippy novelty if your'e in a "creative" mindspace. The inside is lit with yellow recessed lights accented with pink neon, so it's bright but not harshly so. Service was great and the food was acceptable. We ordered the uptown breakfast(s) and I had a side of mac n' cheese. The portions were smaller than I had anticipated but I don't suppose you really want large portions of the kind of foods they serve. The mac n cheese was mostly butter topped shredded orange cheese which I assume was cheddar.  Coffee was excellent and our server was prompt about refilling. They have just obtained a liquor license so beer and liquor will become available in the coming weeks.   The dining experience was totally satisfactory for 'late night.' And, as music lovers, my party and I were digging the gold record montages.  Driving here is not recommended as there were at least 5 police cars on patrol and limited parking.

A few weeks ago had lunch with my sis and niece at Midnight Diner.  Was fabulous!  Loved the atmosphere and the food.  The dessert was yum, yum, yum and the grilled chicken sandwich was delicious.  Anxiously awaiting another visit.

Yesterday, I checked in at Midnight diner, and I am currently beginning my review as I sit at a booth in sleek, but old fashioned diner. As we entered, I was surprised at how big the place was. Everyone was extremely friendly, and we escorted directly to a booth. Despite the fact that we were we seated immediately, it took a while before someone came and took our drink orders.  When our was finally taken, it seemed as if it took a while for our food to arrive.  It can be a very frustrating feeling when you arrive at a locale before others and you see them get their food, finish their meal and pay before your own food ever arrives!  I was literally salivating in anticipation for our meal to arrive at our table.  Once it finally made it, my girlfriend and I immediately dug in.  My girlfriend ordered the chicken tenders w/fries and a side of collard greens.  She said the collard green were just okay... they were not seasoned with any kind of meat and were bland. She enjoyed the tenders, saying they were, "moist and tender".  I tasted the chicken tenders and can concur - they were excellent.  Some of the best tenders Ive had around Charlotte.  However, we both gave the fries a thumbs-down.  They weren't crisp or hot.  In fact they were the exact opposite - soft and room temperature.   I ordered the Midnight Special with my eggs being scrambled w/cheese, bacon, hash browns "covered and smothered", and I was allowed to substitute a pecan waffle for just $.50 more.  Everything was cooked to my liking.  The hash browns were PERFECT.  I thought the eggs were a little hard.  I prefer my scrambled eggs light and fluffy.   The best feature of Midnight Diner is its versatility.  You can go there early in the morning before work, for lunch, or late - after a night of carousing with friends.  In addition, they have any and everything you could possibly want to eat, and breakfast is served all day!   I felt like my experience at Midnight Diner was lessened by the service, because the food was above par.  Yes, our waitress was extremely cordial, but she was anything but prompt.  I went there looking to be in-and-out quickly and was greatly disappointed.   In closing, I've heard so much good stuff about this spot that I def want to go there again.  I'll just go when I've got a whole day to burn and I'll try to sit in a different section.
Great service and atmosphere make the delicious and affordable food taste even better. :)

Great spot! Right after seeing a show, looking for a place to get our grub on, we found this place and Daaang! Awwwwwww snaaaapppp! Them shrimp and grits taste so good make a grown man cry. If I'm ever on death row... This is where I'll get my takeout for my last meal. It's that good. ILL BE BACK!

The Black & Bleu was really good. Burgers cooked well done by default but still turned out delicious. Burgers are smaller than average but jammed pack with flavor. Had a pineapple mimosa, which is way better than traditional orange juice. Would definitely come back next time I'm in Charlotte.
I found this place very good. I had the chicken wrap it was great!!!!. Its a dinner car setup so its alittle cramped and lound at times but service is very good. You should be happy here
Very clean restaurant,staff is really nice,and the shrimp grits dish is so good..also that place is open 24/7 which is great!!!!

Hands down Midnight Diners Fried Chicken is wayyyy better than Price's Chicken Coops!!! The vegetables are great too.   When it comes to the dessert you will need to order the Strawberry shortcake cheesecake when you first place your order. Every single time I've waited after my meal to order the cheesecake it gone!!!
Great diner. Shrimp and grits were amazing. Want to crowded and a great menu selection. Friendly staff.  Highly recommended.

Awesome place, great atmosphere, excellent food, and as an added bonus they serve beer and liquor. Our receipt said our server was Latosha, and she was incredible- made what would have normally been a great experience something even more extraordinary with her incredible personality. Enjoyed this place thoroughly and would recommend to anyone.

Today was my first time at the classic Midnight Diner in uptown. We chose to eat here during the daytime/lunch hours due to easy parking, but unfortunately there were no spots. And the lot there charges $7 for 12 hours. Why not have an hourly system for when all the spots are taken?? Fortunately we parked and had waited around long enough that spots opened up in the "free" parking and then finally headed inside.   The Midnight Diner really has that old school Diner feel that I love. Their menu followed the same theme with a large breakfast offering and sandwiches and entrees as well. I ordered the chicken tenders and fries. The fries were really good and seasoned well, but the chicken tenders were not crispy at all and in fact we're kind of limp. I had to use a fork to dip them in the sauce because they kept falling apart.   For the price and atmosphere, I would definitely still come back, just probably would pick a different meal.

Loved the nostalgic feel. Breakfast was delicious. Belgium waffle was perfectly browned and shaped, so were the pancakes, and French toast. It was a very busy place, yet we were still sat and served very quickly.

THE Place to go in Charlotte for some good comfort food. You have to get the Fried chicken it's a must! The biscuits are delicious too and the grits and friendly service. It's a different kind of crowd after hours but I have still experience good service. Anyone visiting I will always take them to the good ole Midnight diner

As a first timer in Charlotte, my friend suggested this place to me... even though I was very skeptical since it reminded me of Silver Diner.  It was busy the night we visited but was seated in about 7 minutes.  Looking through the menu... I wasn't sure what I wanted but after checking Yelp and suggestions, a lot of people said Shrimp and Grit, which I asked the waiter on her suggestion and she also recommended it.  Yelp and the waitress definitely did not disappoint me, this was the BEST SHRIMP AND GRIT I have had in a LONG TIME.  Super flavorful and added some eggs on the side with my meal!  TRY IT!
In town for weekend and stayed at nearby hotel.  Loved this spot so much came back every day for breakfast.

After a few Midnight Diner experiences, I am fully convinced that there is absolutely nothing served at the diner that is anything short of utterly delicious!  My favorite menu item so far is the chicken and waffles. (But, instead of wings, I order chicken tenders. It requires ordering the chicken tender appetizer and then an extra waffle. #lifehack) In addition to the crazy good food, in my experience, the staff is always efficient, helpful, and all-around great!  If you go around brunch time on the weekends, though, be prepared for a wait!

Got the bleu buffalo chicken sandwich and it tastes like soap or the bleu cheese was fresher than fresh. Got fries that were frozen and gross. First time trying this place in a drunken crave but would never return. Most likely the worst items I have ever had after 10pm.  15 bucks down the drain.
My 1st meal in Charlotte while visiting for the holidays with family.   Loved the Biscuits and gravy but lost my mind over the grits!

Best grits ever, since New Orleans. French toast was OK. Mine's better. Very small, but surprisingly, they were able to cram a bunch in. In from out of town, so we stopped for breakfast before checking out the grace covenant church.

A Charlotte institution! 24 hour real diner food. Highlights are their spicy shrimp & grits, chicken & waffles, pancakes, etc. I wouldn't recommend showing up either too late in the morning or too late at night, or you'll be waiting in a pretty long line. It's worth the wait if you want some classic grub.

I visited this restaurant for the first time on Tuesday and it was quite an experience. While first walking in, it reminded me of Waffle House, however the environment was different and I don't believe it is a chain restaurant. My server for the morning was a woman named Dana, and she was very nice, respectful, helpful and patient (because the person I was with was ordering a large amount of food). She even helped him figure out how to get everything he wanted at the lowest price possible. He ordered some of the chicken wings they have on the menu, and they were some of the best looking chicken wings I have seen in my life. Plus they weren't baby wings, they were full large sized wings. I wanted to try them but sadly, I'm allergic to wheat. My food (hashbrowns and bacon) was good. I had already eaten prior to going to the restaurant, therefore I did not order much. My food was great though and so was service.

Food is more than adequate. I had chicken and waffles. It's a nice change of pace for a late night spot instead of ihop or waffle house. The selection is huge. Breakfast and brunch items as well as soul food offerings. The music is too loud and our waitress didn't have the best attitude. Overall, a good experience.

Any chance we can stop here we do.  Love the shrimp and grits!!   Breakfast is always good.  Love the Greek omelet.    It can be very busy on Sundays but the wait is worth it.  Classic dinner food with good service

One of my favorite things about Jersey are the diners. This diner was shipped on the back of a semi from Jersey to Charlotte and I am so glad it did! I visited with my husband for breakfast one cold morning and even though the line was out the door, it moved pretty quick. We got shrimp & grits, hash with ham, onions, eggs, french toast and some other stuff. The french toast was HUGE and delicious. It is a must-try. The staff is friendly and although it can be a little loud it is worth it for the delicious food. GO FOR THE FRENCH TOAST!

We came for breakfast, and it was fantastic!! Worth any wait for sure! Come hungry and you will not be disappointed.  Their pancakes and biscuits are to die for!!  I had their omelette and hash browns and it was great!  We will be coming back for sure!

This is a place that's pretty good at what they are - a retro diner with the predictable treats of burgers, milkshakes, club sandwiches and fried chicken fingers. Service was good, food was exactly what you expect and they do have a new age juke box. Decor matches the theme too.

Don't sleep on the diner!  I wasn't feeling that great but still wanted a traditional meal, so I ended up here on Thanksgiving day.  I guess everyone had the same idea or just wanted breakfast before their evening meal?! I don't know but the line was out the door and on the sidewalk.  I just wanted takeout and ordered the Thanksgiving special, turkey, stuffing, greens, mac n cheese.  It took just as long for takeout as it did to dine in, but other than that the food was really good, just what I wanted despite the long wait.  Although it was crazy busy, the staff handled it like champs with a smile and great attitudes.

Was looking for something to eat after a hanging out downtown Charlotte late one Saturday night.  We arrived around 130am and had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated.    This diner offered more variety than your typical Waffle House.  Friend and I shared the chicken and waffles, and chicken strips which came with fries.  The waffle wasn't good, it was too airy... the chicken wasn't fresh.  The chicken tenders and fries were actually tasty and seasoned well.  The ranch was fresh made and was also tasty.  The sweet tea was good, not too sweet and wasn't watered down.  There was nice R&B music playing that night, which added a nice twist to the dining experience.  We left around 230 and there had to be 50 parties in line waiting to be seated.  There were also several police offices present to ensure things remained orderly.

Went at around 4 today and it wasn't packed like it would've been in the evening (which is a good thing)! Food came out super quick and tastes fresh. Our server, Tiffany, was very sweet and attentive too. Will be coming back again, probably for some late night munchies.. Heh.

One of the worst diners in charlotte. Always crowded, loud and dirty. Everytime we go we get horrible service and nasty cold food. Will never go again. Tried giving it a second chance but it was an over failed attempt. If you want to be around rude, loud, obnoxious drunk people by all means go and try to make a good time out of it. But I do not reccomend it at all.

Great idea, horrible execution.... I'd give this zero stars if possible.  Came here late Saturday night/Sunday morning and nothing went right.  The wait was long, the waitress was terrible and forgetful, the refills never came, and the food was bland.  Great opportunity to put some grease on your stomach after a night of partying, but you're probably better off going home and grading a bowl of Frosted Flakes.  I'll never understand why this place is so popular....

My first American diner. It was as if I'd walked into Pop's milkshake shop in Riverdale(Archie comics). In short loved it. Ordered the chicken with biscuits, steak and eggs (wish I'd ordered it medium rare rather than well done) and the hot cakes platter( we were 4 people). It cost about $60 (including the tip). Once again I ordered iced tea, can't get enough of the stuff. It was the perfect breakfast. Our server, Greg was great. Actually the whole staff was. I highly recommend it, and believe me guys, I do not like every place I go to eat. I just write reviews for ones I actually would go to again. Also I got a (2nd) refill in a disposable cup for my iced tea...i mean COME ON. Yay!

Desperation = Going to Midnight Diner when sober  Ever noticed a mile long line extending from a chrome covered building with neon lights, at 2AM? That's Midnight Diner. It's a combination of drunken millennials pouring out from Southend for a final meal before stumbling home and people leaving the always lovely Uptown Cabaret, looking to make a second poor decision. I've had my fair share of late nights here, which I'm not too proud of, so this is coming from direct experience.  It's all of the typical diner fare you would expect to see, only none of it is done very well. My drunken 2AM alter ego, that would normally demolish an unholy combo from Taco Bell, has been able to see right through the facade that is Midnight Diner. Laughable fried chicken that's either been over or under cooked, over cooked hash browns, those lovely neon yellow hotel continental breakfast-style eggs, and dry waffles. A burger is probably your best bet here.  On top of all that, you will normally have to wait a good bit to get in the door and trust me when I say, it's not worth it. One thing that has always been consistent is the service. They are trying to get you in and out as quickly as possible, which I can appreciate. You're better off heading South about a mile to Skyland Family Restaurant, where you can at least take advantage of the people watching and finally getting that unforgettable Snapchat story.  Prime location with an always boisterous crowd, long wait, and half-assed food...2/5.

Is a review really necessary?... check the lines out the door when you pass by the place. (normally Sundays and late weekend nights).   You may catch this joint on an off night, but that's okay because the food is still good. Not the best.... but good.

Midnight Diner continues to score #1 in my gotta-go-to diners in Charlotte.  I get it's not everyone's cup; however, I love the food, the spirit of the staff, the great sounds from the juke, and the overall vibe of a place hitting on all cylinders.   I typically hang at the counter just to absorb the action.  Contagious.  Thanks CC for attending to me today.  Way up on my "Give 'em a whirl!" meter.

Visiting here in Charlotte, my cousin takes us here to eat after getting off plane.  Was totally amazing!  I got breakfast food.  Everything was wonderful, the service, staff, patrons...all so wonderful.  The grits are the best I have EVER had!  Very creamy, and thick. Yummmy

There for Sunday brunch this past weekend. Knew I was at the right place when we drove up! Parking lot and outside was packed . But the wait was less than the 15 mins quoted for a party of four! Ordered the "Bubba" the Hashbrowns w and the sausage gravy were perfect. No seasoning necessary!  PS: Forgot to mention the size of the platter!

What a cool spot. The theme is great with the atmosphere and music. Walked in for lunch was expecting a wait but they sat us down really quick. Our waiter was amazing too and the food came out really quick. I ordered the chicken and waffles. Those chicken wings where so moist it was amazing. I noticed almost half the people where ordering the shrimp and grits so I've gotta try that next time.
Good food, good atmosphere.                                        ...I'm particularly fond of the chicken slider.

My 10 year old sez "The food is delicious but you will probably eat so much of it that you will be full."  I had a bad turkey club earlier this week so I needed to wipe away that memory.    Great classic  diner vibe, good service.
Best grits ever! And Mona Lisa is the vibrant singing waitress with a sense of humor sure make you laugh!

Great uptown  (downtown) location. Classic diner food. Service was a little slow, that's the only negative. Delicious biscuits. Very crowded on Sundays. Will return when in Charlotte. Friendly staff. Within walking distance to all uptown hotels.

This is a divey diner just like my favorite places in the dirty jerz.  Great music? Check. Singing waitress who always brightens my day? Check.  Service is dependent on what time of day you are here.  At night its a zoovie, during the day after 12 it is not so bad.  Their chicken biscuit is ridiculous.  The chicken is so fluffy and tasty that I cannot resist one whenever I go.  Their other chicken will sucker punch Price's and put it in a cobra clutch.  I love the traditional breakfast menu and I am sucker for their pancakes as well.  This is definitely a great place to stop feeling hungover and start feeling fat.  Oh what a trade off!

I've been to this place a few times at different hours of the day. I have had the fried chicken (tasty), the "philly" cheesesteak,  and one of their most talked about items...the Cajun shrimp & grits (Amazing!). As a northern I typically don't eat grits. If I do, it has to be made like my oatmeal or cream of wheat which is with butter and sugar. In this instance though, take it as it is. You won't regret it!

The midnight diner is pretty much a 1am staple and always full on weekend nights. The patrons here are varied (the drunk, buzzed, almost-passed out, and people who just look like they got hungry in the middle of the night). I recommend getting filled up here if you've finished your night of partying and drinking. You'll feel much better the next morning. For the more sober customers though, the food is just okay. Servings are relatively large but I didn't care for the chicken and waffles. The chicken was decent--the classic Southern stuff. But, the waffles were sort of mushy like a defrosted eggo waffle.

Finally uptown has a late night spot to eat! I've been to the diner several times and the food and service is always good. Love the grits and and the open-face sausage, egg and cheese biscuit! I like that I can take my family there during the day and the girls and I late night!

Great for breakfast! Some of the best cheesy grits I've ever had! The corned beef hash with eggs was great. My husband and his friend shared coconut crunch French toast and loved it, I don't do syrup ;) we also had the biscuits and sausage gravy. I usually don't like biscuits, but this was GREAT. Our server did a great job too! GREAT GREAT GREAT. Everything!

It was 1 in the morning and we waited for about 15 or 20 minutes for a table.  The place was packed.  I enjoyed the fast paces atmosphere and the music made you feel like you were in a hip nightclub.  We ordered Philly Cheesesteaks which were huge and very tasty.  The service was slow for us but that was not the case for the tables around us so I think our server was new or overwhelmed.  Even still this is a great place to eat in Uptown Charlotte.  I would give it more stars but with the service being slow I can't
Jermaine was pretty f*cking cool. Shrimp and grits and coconut French toast was delicious. Great service and good times. Go.

Yeahh...the shrimp and grits ARE ALL THAT!!!  Never had grits so creamy!!!!  Firecracker shrimp(think that's the name) is also a good appetizer...shrimp is covered in a tasty sauce and they are kind of crispy...Yum!!  Mac n cheese was good too but needed a more cheddar taste.  Lil one had the peanut butter and marshmallow toasted sandwich...well I ordered it but she did not eat it...but that's just her being contrary. ...that sandwich was that bomb too...but on the kids meal.  Next time I want to try the Bubba!

I go back and forth...sometimes I think it is great, other times I tell myself it is the last time I'll eat there.   Service can be amazing...or amazingly awful.  Food can be dinerific or downright awful. One morning I was craving a burger before work and at 7a it was perfection!  I had one after flying home Saturday night, could not even eat half of it, just no good. A big soggy mess.  Carbasaurus Rex would love this place...the majority of the menu is carb bomb!  My son had the chicken and waffles and said they were amazing!    Give it a try if you are in the mood for diner roulette.

We sat there for 15 min with our menus closed ready to order. We saw the 3 tables seated after us receive service and drinks before we even saw a server. I got up and mentioned it to one of the servers. Instead of saying something along the lines of ,"I'm sorry about that let me find a server!" She looked at me with an attitude and told me that we weren't her table....wow. Really helpful. We certainly walked out after that. Never even got the chance to eat the food or even drink the water. Now I never will. They lost my business.

One of my friends recommended this place. We stopped by, she  told me to try shrimp & grits so I did ! It was so good !!! First time ever trying shrimp and grits.  The prices were okay. I Paid about $13, the taste is indescribable. It had a taste of a world class resturant. This has to be the #1 item on the menu

A real diner transported to this site. Very popular so you will need to wait to be seated either at the counter or in a booth. Once you do get you spot service is fast efficient but friendly. The place is crowded, bustling and noisy but that ads to the experience. Food us typical diner fare including breakfast all day with some interesting variations. Prices are fair but not a bargain . You go for the experience and for comfirt food in decent portions. Parking can be an issue with a paid lot behind with a few free spaces but free on tge weekend. Ask or go ahead and pay at other times.  If you want a meal at a diner, this is the place.

Okay, this newish diner I'm familiar with. It actually used to reside at a truck stop in  Kings Mtn where I used to live which is about 30 miles away. There are photos of the haul in the entryway. I was taken a back when I saw it nestled just outside of uptown Charlotte! What a great decision.  Apparently a great spot for post-bar hopping. As with any diner, you have the old fashioned decor and jukebox in the corner. The food is good, not great. The staff is good, not great. But it is usually a mad house when I frequent at 3am. There is usually a line at the front as any local will tell you. When you're tired and wore out from dancing your ass off at the bar, you come here for replenishment and good conversation. Then to bed you go ;)

Jessica and Alisa are best servers in Charlotte! Great eats, homemade and reasonably priced. Relatively clean and you can be in and out in 30 minutes if you are on a time crunch.   I tip 20/30% here and will keep coming back for the superb service and food.

Everytime I go to Charlotte for night life, I always have midnight diner on my mind.   By far my favorite thing is the shrimp and grits! They use a great blend of green and red peppers and just enough spice. This is paired with a fluffy biscuit on the side.  This time I tried the 2 piece chicken and waffles, and I will say again I was impressed. I am a pancake over waffle kind of gal, but their waffle had a nice taste and was cooked well! I added some hot sauce to the wings, and then devoured my meal.

Update: While the food is good here, the quality of service really bothers me. On more than one occasion I've been here between 2am-6am where they've been closed. Typically someone scribbles closed on a white piece of paper and tapes it to the door. More recently there was no sign, staff just inside doing whatever, get to the register and I'm told they're closed. Since there is a lack of 24 hour eateries here in Charlotte I'd really like to see consistency when it comes to operating hours. Otherwise when I am able to get food, I'm a fan of the grits, fried chicken, and French toast.
Get the livermush!! It is heaven! With the sausage biscuit, grits, and sweet tea..just what is needed after a long run!

I'm surprised I haven't reviewed Midnight diner yet because I come here a lot. I think I'm actually the duke, if that gives you an indication of how much I enjoy / frequent this place. So, let's get this out of the way. The food is 5-stars ... and by food I mean Chicken and Waffles ... and by Waffles I mean French Toast. I could literally eat their Chicken and French Toast for any meal of the day and I already have. I'm guessing their other menu items are delicious as well, but why mess up a good thing. I'm dinging them a star because it gets a little cray at night. You literally have to get pat down by an armed police office in order to pick up your take-out at 2am. I mean, I'll do it because once again the Chicken and French Toast is bomb, but yeah I don't like mine with a side of potential stabbing / drive-by. I will say that there's some pretty good people watching in the after-club hours. All shapes, colors, ethnicity, creed, organisms, and nations of ratchet. From the trap stars to the drunken southern bell that missing a shoe. Priceless entertainment ...  All and all, Midnight is the quintessential diner and I urge anybody to give it a try if they're in Charlotte. If this review has proved useful to you, please show your thanks by providing me with an order of Chicken and French Toast. :-) ... just kidding.  but for real though ... :-|

Been here only a couple of times even though we stay in the adjacent apartment complex lol. Probably that's why couldn't take this place seriously. But loved the food, it's proper diner food. Love their banana pudding and Death by chocolate cake more than anything.

So the shrimp and grits were great. Will definitely get these again. The pecan and regular waffles were great and slightly sweetened as my son and I do not eat maple syrup. They were light and fluffy and tasted great with nothing on them. The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the mac and cheese. Although homemade and cheesy it had no flavor/ seasoning.  But it's nice the food came out fairly quickly, hot, and correct.  The servers all seem to have great attitudes.

I've been here several times when visiting Charlotte. There is always a line however, it goes pretty quickly. The food is still always good and they have a full bar. Their fried chicken is awesome as well. I would highly recommend if your in Charlotte.

I would drive 4.5 hours just for their Firecracker Shrimp! Absolutely to die for!! Every time I take a trip (after going to the Midnight Diner) I see if there is any route I can take that is near it just so I can get some of their food! Staff is so so so polite and helpful. Pricing is great for the amount of food they give you. This is my all time favorite place to eat! Worth the time to get there; worth the wait time; worth the money! Thank you so much for this delicious food! I got a taste of Heaven on Earth.

The fried chicken was very good, better than any other sould food place in the area.  The place was a little dirtier than it was a few years ago.  Sanitation grade is a borderline 90.  Floors were very dirty although it had not rained.

Stopped in accidentally, place is busy and packed.  We ordered the chicken fingers which was yummy but the fries came out cold.  Dad had the chicken salad which he said was ok and my daughter had the veggie burger which she said was ok.  Chicken was the best thing. Not sure I would return.  Lots of staff, most just talking and not working, but friendly.

Well Well Well, after writing a few other reviews today, my friend and I started to talk about places to eat and of course one of my favorite places in the Queen City has to be Midnight Diner. The selection of breakfast, lunch, and dinner is to die for. if you try going here after the club lets out you might just die of hunger waiting to be seated....lol It is a diner though so don't expect them to move for Uptown to Pineville into an enormous building, this is not a China Buffet. I will say that it is larger than most Diner's that i visited up North. I have been here at least 5 times or more and still haven't made it off of the breakfast menu, when I here Diner I just think breakfast. I give them 5 Stars so you know what that means, they have free WiFi and Great Food. I always get a different waitress, but they all are so nice and great at what they do.   ENJOY!!!

Hands down this will be my new go to restaurant whenever I'm in Charlotte. I was being a fat girl. I had shrimp and grits, a wing and sausage gravy for my biscuit... hmmmm... The wait was a little long for well worth it. The only thing was my server looked dirty. And she would reach over our food to refill cups. I don't like anyone armpit over my food. Food was incredible still...

When I moved to Charlotte 4 years ago I was a steady customer to this place. I was extremely happy there was a 24 hour diner in the neighborhood, but unfortunately this is not the case anymore.  This place has gone completely downhill since I moved to this city.  First and foremost, this place has attracted a lot of sketchy people in the recent years and has had its share of violence on occasion.  Aside from this, the food is poorly prepared in contrast to how it used to be, and the staff is nowhere near as friendly as my earlier experiences dining here. Last but not least, management is extremely unprofessional.  On my last visit the manager begins screaming at the top of her lungs saying "this isn't uptown cabaret if you finished your food get the hell out of my restaurant!!"  I understand they need to clear the space for new customers but this honestly made me feel extremely uncomfortable.  I've never even seen this kind of unprofessionalism in a restaurant before, not even in a Waffle House. If people are loitering in your restaurant, handle this properly like professional management should by going to each table to see who's already paid their bill....comon now!!!  The owners truly need to hire better management to clean this place up.  I give this place 2 stars just because it's open 24 hours.

My sister and I had the pleasure of having a late breakfast today at the Midnight Diner. This was my first visit but it was sister's fourth visit. The food was incredible!!!! I had the "Bubba" and it was delicious. As a Southern Girl, I know my grits and these were some of the creamiest grits I'd ever tasted. My sister promised me that the Midnight Diner served the best coffee in town. The coffee lived up to it's hype. It was amazing.   I would have rated my visit higher but some of the staff members were absolutely RUDE-not to me but another patron. Apparently there had been some confusion with a call in order. When the patron came back due to the error, two of the waitresses, Lisa and Dana spent more time arguing with the patron than trying to rectify the issue . I found them to be abrasive and condescending.  I felt sorry for the patron and I wanted walkover and yell "just fix it". Watching the exchange was very uncomfortable and these ladies clearly need customer service training. Sometimes it's not about who's right but about just doing the right thing!

This place is awesome. Nestled in the urban city, this restaurant seems like a small fast-food dinner but it packs a serious punch. They have a full menu and carry a full bar of adult beverages. On this trip to the diner, we had the chicken and waffles and shrimp and grits. The chicken and waffles come with 2 or 3 wings and additional pieces can be purchased alacart. The shrimp and grits are probably the best in Charlotte and very delicious. The chicken and waffles is also very good but the best thing about this restaurant is the service. The servers are very nice, inviting and always accommodating. The only reason eye I can give this place is the parking. The free parking is very is very limited but there is a abundance of paid parking. It's great place and I do plan on returning.
Was a great place to grab a quick meal at the late evening hours! Menu has everything you could imagine and the service was excellent. Very friendly staff.

So I've been here twice. Once I don't remember (I had a little too much to drink) and the other time was for dinner. That one I did remember ;-) and I was sober so this is a LEGIT REVIEW!! I went with a party of 4 and around 9pm. We were seated right away, but beware- on weekends/late night/ Sunday mornings you will wait for a table.   I ordered the shrimp and grits and I thought they were awesome! Very good flavors. It was sweet (from the grits), but the sauce made it a tad spicy- just up my alley. There were about 8-10 shrimp in my dish so for the $12 this dish was a steal. When I return I will definitely order the shrimp and grits again. I've heard it's the token item here and they did not disappoint.

I stopped by at 3:57am earlier today for breakfast.  I knew something was up when I arrived and there were multiple police there one with emergency lights on and everything.  I went to the door and they have a line of people going out the door with police crime tape up and handwritten signs saying to stay out until they call you.  Once you get "called in" you have to do limbo under the police tape.  They sat me down towards the end of the diner.  I don't mind the music selection but they had it blasting to the point of distortion.  I sat there waiting for anyone to come and take a drink order or food order for 12 minutes.  I ended up turning on one of my TV shows on my phone and watched for a while until Anesha came to take my order.  She had herself and another person saying she was in training.  I placed my order for The Bubba and she told me it would be out in a few minutes.   My food came about 14 minutes later and I still had not received my drink nor any silverware.  The person who brought my food asked what my drink was and went and got that for me.  The food quality was pretty good minus a weird taste in the hashbrowns.  I finished my food and a little while later Anesha brought my check and told me there was no rush.  I went to pay and was told I had to wait for my waitress and then she came over.  I attempted to pay like I have here before with Samsung Pay and was told that I couldn't do that.   The manager the older white lady copped an instant attitude and told me that I was a liar and that I hadn't paid with my phone.  I have proof on my phone and statement that I have in fact used it here.  They then decided to bring the Charlotte Mecklenburg Police in to talk with me about it.  I greeted them and told them the situation and they didn't have much to say.  The only thing that he had to say was that "they have rules" I told him I understood that but there were no rules up at all talking about tap and pay or paying with my phone was not allowed.  The manager then smacks her lips and says that oh well I guess he's getting a free meal tonight.  The police then told me to "have a good night"  In fact, I would have never stepped foot into Midnight Diner had I known this new fact.  I choose not to do business with establishments who are unable or unwilling to accept payment.  The thing about Samsung Pay is it acts just like a regular card swipe but the sad fact is Midnight Diners POS is enabled for mobile payments they just choose not to accept them and now I know this but there was no excuse for the management treating me like trash and calling me a liar.  They are the liars because I can show evidence that they accepted my phone as well as witnesses who were there.  The biggest problem here is the slow service and treatment of guests.  I can say with certainty that I will never return to this location.

The late night diner that comes with a side of adventure.   The food is your standard diner fare but the atmosphere is what gives this place its charm, especially if this is a late night stop for you. If you come here right after bars close, expect to stand in line for 20-30 mins, more if you have a group larger than 2-3.   Food is not bad but there is always something going on at the diner. When I went last time, there was some scuffle that occured on the outside. Usually it is just how drunk people are but being from the south it was somewhat entertaining to watch.   The staff is friendly and courteous and the space is somewhat small but works for a late night stop.

I highly recommend eating here. My family is visiting from Boston and we ate here for breakfast and we loved it so much that we went back for dinner. The kids had the French toast and and one plate definitely could have been ordered to split for all of them. Everything we ate was delicious. Absolutely not one complaint. Great customer service.

Oh blah Midnight Diner why you gotta be like this to me? At this rate I might as well go to Waffle House.  I stopped by here at 11 recently after watching a play in NoDa with my date. Since 11 was pretty early for the drunk hungry crowd we managed to get seated pretty fast and our waitress was charming if inattentive. I sadly stared at my empty water glass for half of the time I was there. So basically the same as usual. "What made you lower your rating then Jimmy?" you ask? Well my usual order is 2 eggs scrambled and tomato slices. Granted their tomato slices taste like tasteless slave tomatoes (yes that's an actual term, look it up!) but they don't exactly have many options that are friendly towards people who don't eat pork or much beef and just want a cheap quick late night munch. Well it's because when the check came and my bill was double what it usually was this time so I glanced down. Usually tomato slices are free, but apparently now they charge $2.00 for 3 all but tasteless tomato slices and this change wasn't listed anywhere on the menu? I think I might've understood like maybe 75 cents for them or something. You can go ahead and call me cheap, but I dare you to order some tomato slices when you go there and tell me they're even worth near $2.00!  Yeah so as much as it pains me to choose a chain over supporting a local business I think I'd much rather just go to WaHo, or even better Mattie's(please think about staying open 24 hours on weekends Mattie!). The prices and quality of food combined with shoddy service here don't really justify the convenience to me anymore.

Been awhile since I've been here but still great.  Had to drop a sample of Mineral Sunscreen off this morning for analysys but after than, time for Breakfast.  Been a good while since we've dined at Midnight Diner and it was time for a revisit.  Dropped the sample off at 8:30 am and were here about 10 minutes later. Parking on the side was limited but did manage to score the last spot. My wife and I walked in and everyone was very helpful. I have upcoming hip replacement surgery so I'm using a cane but everyone jumped up and held doors for me while I navigated to a table. Very much appreciated.  Expansive menu with something for everyone including my wife who normally does not like breakfast.  I ordered the Western Omelet, Hash Browns and Whole Wheat Toast and all of this was made from scratch.  My wife had two eggs, over easy, Turkey Sausage, Toast and a Side of Fruit.  Everything was perfect The Omelet was very good, the Hash Browns were some of the best one's I've had lately.  Seems like most places are going to preformed Hash Browns from a Food Service provider but not here. These were the real thing.  Wife enjoyed her's as well and she confessed she occasionally enjoyed diner food.  Service was great and our Coffee Cups were never empty  Only thing I did not like and the restaurant had no control on that was that our table was next to an expanse of glass and it was 15 Degrees F outside so it was a bit on the chilly side.  Otherwise, great visit.
the coconut French toast creamy grits chicken wigs and waffles the mac and cheese I could keep going.............and so should you!

Midnight Diner is a good bet morning, lunch, evening and late-night.  They have an extensive diner menu - a few of the standouts include chicken tenders, onion rings, greek salad and chicken and waffles.   The portions are generous and the service is fast - the only caveat, if you come for breakfast or lunch on the weekend, you'll likely have a 30+ minute wait.

This is quickly becoming one of our favorite breakfast spots. I've been stuck in a rut our last few visits. I get the special which has two eggs, your choice of breakfast meat, grits or hash browns or fruit, and pancakes.   The grits are some of the best I've had outside of my own kitchen. And the pancakes. Oh, they are fluffy and delicious and the perfect treat at the end of my meal for this pregnant lady.

Great diner food with excellent taste. Came on a Sunday for lunch with a line out the door. Did not wait very long. Great food, hash browns cooked in butter and not an oily mess. Disappointed the "old fashioned maple syrup"  is the gooey mess that is not real maple syrup. The pancakes are good, but not with goo. Tried the onion rings and they are delicious.

Love...love...love!!! Best place for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Always happy with food and service. They are quick and very hospitable. We recommend this to everyone we know and they fall in love too!

This restaurant has one of the best shrimp and grits I have ever had!  The service is quick and prompt. I would highly suggest going on a weekday morning when it is not that busy so you can truly enjoy the experience.   Though I have only been once, I can honestly say I've been sold on the shrimp and grits alone.

Probably the best grits in Charlotte outside of The Flying Biscuit. I almost always order breakfast here because they have NEESES LIVERMUSH! Ok. I know, I know but I'm still gonna eat it and I'm still gonna not read the package because I still don't wanna know exactly WHAT livermush is lol.   Midnight Diner is always poppin. It's open 24-hours and they have a great menu so people are literally in here 24-hours a day. I'm a huge breakfast/brunch fan so the fact I can get it anytime here is a big plus! I always had great customer service and it's always been clean. They even have a jukebox! Today the sanitation score is a 93 (idk what that's about but um...) The only reason I'm giving 4-stars instead of 5 is because subsequently since they're so popular there is almost always a wait and parking is limited.  Seriously if you haven't eaten at Midnight Diner you are missing it!

I am a "fried chicken connoisseur" and I can tell you that this was one of the best fried chicken I've ever had!  It was crispy, but not greasy, super tender, and had just the right amount of salt.  The price was very decent as well.  I took the food back to the hotel so I don't know what the service or the atmosphere is like, but it seemed like a nice restaurant to me.  I'll definitely be back for the food!
Bring your ear plugs, it's a diner so it's loud by nature but good GOD, the music is WAY TOO LOUD. Is it a club or a diner???   Eat outside.

Oh Midnight Diner... I've heard about this place and that it's so great after drinking and that's probably when I should've gone. Hubs and I went during the day because I was starving and I wanted good diner food. It was just okay, I wasn't too impressed for all I've heard. It was crazy chaotic inside and we were ignored for a good bit before we got seated. The food was not the best, even for diner food. I guess with all the raving about this place and the line out the door, I expected more. Our server was really, really sweet though. Won't be back unless I'm desperate!
I loved the food.  They have the best French toast ever! The Turkey bacon and eggs were also good. If you can sit outside, that is best.  If not, know that t is really noisy inside.

This is our second visit to the Midnight Diner and it is phenomenal.  Jetaun is a master server very efficient accommodating, attentive, and positive. Robert was very helpful getting us seated on a busy Sunday and the food was no less than perfect.

Great tasting food.  Very, very lively atmosphere, especially late and in the wee hours. You'd best leave your expectations of a formal, proper restaurant at home. This is a very free flowing atmosphere. And the food is good. Fried chicken and shrimp with grits are my favorites.

Definitely a 5 star spot, no doubt!  The breakfast sandwiches are awesome and at the right price too.  I also love the coconut French toast.  If you like a little spice you have to try the shrimp grits.  Their fried chicken is on point too.  I have nothing bad to say, this is a great spot to get your grub on.
This place never disappoints! I've been here several times. Early morning and late at night. It's always awesome! Parking isn't so bad either!
Specific waitress could have been better but the atmosphere, food were great. Very clean facility and busy. Enjoyed.
Came here starving after a few bar stops and saw some recommend Coconut French Toast and Wings and goodness gracious it was goooodddd! It's worth a try if you're looking for somewhere open 24/7

Went to the Diner yesterday for the first time. I have no complaints about the food. The grits are creamy, some of the best I've had. Everyone at the table enjoyed their food. What I don't get is their fanatical insistence on "No Substitutions". To be fair, though, it may have been our server, who was not very pleasant even when he introduced himself. He was clearly irritated when 2 of our party asked for simple substitutions.   If my breakfast comes with either bacon or turkey bacon, what's the big deal if you get a Club sandwich and request turkey bacon and ask them to leave off the ham? The server rolled his eyes, and said he thought that might be OK. When the food came  out, though, none of the substitutions were honored. I think that's ridiculous. I know substitutions may slow up the kitchen, but come on...  The food was good enough, though, that we will be back. We will just know to order dishes that require NO SUBSTITUTIONS.
Service was excellent. Very reasonable prices where you basically pay for what you get. Satisfactory food but nothing special to make a point to go eat at.

I've eaten here at all hours of the day and have never had a bad meal. I do always order breakfast foods though, so I can't say much about their other items. But they do breakfast well!! Their Belgian waffles are great and you can get fruit topping added which is the perfect pair. The fruit topping is an extra charge, and seems a bit high to me for what you get, but it makes the waffles even better so I get it. I usually order eggs over medium which I've come to find is hard get right while eating out. I ended up with over easy, but that seems to happen at every restaurant I order eggs at.  Today I got the bacon, egg and cheese biscuit which was bomb. They really do biscuits right here and give you good deal of cheesy goodness to go with. No gross clear, fatty bacon here, it's the good stuff. And my co-diners all enjoyed their "Bubba" (which I've had and is awesome everytime) and the coconut french toast which I tried and really is good. Doesn't taste overwhelmingly coconutty so you still get a nice crunchy sweet french toast on HUGE, THICK challah bread... so good!  I'd recommend Midnight Diner to any breakfast goer or late night eater. Every time I've been there it's been a good meal and the service is always on point with a friendly smile and quick service.

Some of the best shrimp and grits I've ever had. The grits were southern style so they were creamy.  The shrimp were seasoned to perfection. I will always come here when I'm in the Charlotte area. The service was great and the place wasn't huge so I'm sure it gets crowded. Well worth the wait if need be.

We ate here and we didn't die, that's the best I can say.    We tried the so highly recommended fried chicken and some other stuff that for the life of me can't remember. The food was just OK, nothing great about it but there's no excuse for the complete lack of service in an empty restaurant - we got there around 1:45.    They sat us around the corner and out of sight  and promptly forgot about us. After a while I made a fuss and got a server to take our order ..... but he never came back....  .... and much later, almost an hour after we walked in the manager himself brought us our food. Which was like I said OK but not great. As for the decor, I'm just so tired of the old American Graffiti cliches, enough already!    I hear this place is terrific, when you're stinking drunk. Sober not so much.

Back again for some optic Midnite Diner specialty in my opinion which is shrimp and grits comparing them against those I've had in the Low Country around Charleston simply superb. The group so smooth and creamy shrimp is flavorful and plentiful. That's not to say that they don't make them in fried chicken and other Southern Comfort foods that I do enjoy also. The service is down home friendly, quick, and efficient. Its hard not to find something not to like and please your palate with the Midnight Diner and they always open and ready for you.

A busy, popular diner. There's a bit of a wait if you go on the weekends but if you get there early enough it's not too bad. The food was good. I had the pancakes and they were melt in your mouth fluffy. Good food and friendly service. Like someone else stated, the parking is bad but that's my only con.

3 words...chicken & french toast. Damn good, some secret batter and french toast was like cakeish.  It's not meant to be fancy, fly or edgy..it's a diner friends so adjust the expectations. It's a diner, like a greasy spoon..great for breakfast, lunch or late night after the bar is out bite and sober up food b/c its 24/7.

Fish & Grits w/ the creole sauce AMAZINGLY GOOD! Two downers the sweet tea is an express train to diabetes and the seasoned fries had to much salt. Experience was still good nothing that a glass of a wataaa and a new set of fries didn't fix.  Will return!

MUST try chicken tenders!! Arrived late after a concert - seated immediately!! Our waitress was so nice!! Chicken tenders are out of this world and we also tried the cheeseburger sliders which were fantastic. Food was piping hot and the fries were perfect!! Will definitely be returning!!

Bad service, great food. Our waitress came to the table once only to ask us if we wanted our ticket. We were sitting outside in the rain, and she never tried to get us inside or to a table with an umbrella. That's it for the negatives, onto the positives, the food. I ordered the shrimp and grits and it was phenomenal. The grits were amazing and the shrimp were great. The Creole sauce put it over the top for me! As for my girlfriend, well, she got the French toast and quite frankly; it was amazing. The bread was HUGE and it tasted great. All in all a good experience. I almost gave 3 stars because of the service, but the food was just too good.

Wow!  It's been a while since I've written anything, and why not start back up with the diner across the street from my apartment.  Since leaving Boston in September I've been trying all sorts of new places in Charlotte and this came to mind first.  It's an old style silver on the outside huge booths on the inside kind of place.  It is good for two things - hungover breakfast and I just left the bar and I'm starving! kind of meals.   For breakfast I always get the omelette with avocado and cheddar and hash browns.  My husband always gets grits which I think are gross but he loves them so they must be good.  I've also had the fried chicken and a burger there.  The fried chicken is good and the burger is just ok.  The service is great and everyone is so nice.  The sweet tea (which I've become an expert at since being here) is too sweet, you gotta cut it with water or you'll go into sugar shock.  All in all not a place to check out, especially when it's only a 2 minute walk from your apartment -  kids in Camden South End...this means you!

I will start by saying this, the midnight Diner is probably one of the better staple restaurants in Charlotte. However my experience tonight did not reflect that. After being sat and refused to change my order by our server, Ashley - we then received beyond mediocre service.  Feeling somewhat stereotyped into the mold of "black people don't tip". Luckily a server by the name of Larry a.k.a "Showtime" managed to salvage what remained of an otherwise horrible experience. He definitely exempified the prototype of what anyone would call excellent service. Needless to say our server received no tip. Hopefully she learns something from her peers. Definitely will be back...and requesting "Showtime" as our server for the duration of his tenure there.

I've been here probably a dozen times since my last review, so I figured an update was in order. Midnight Diner provides tasty diner food at fair prices, but unfortunately the iffy and slow service really overshadows that.  FOOD/PRICES I'll start with the best part of Midnight Diner: the food. I have tried a fair share of the menu, and everything tastes great. The fried chicken is crisp and well-seasoned, the burgers are juicy and topped with fresh toppings, the sides are prepared well, etc. The prices are also fair for the most part, which is great.
