Dessert is a bit on the expensive side, though. There really is not much more to say here: excellent diner food at fair prices.  SERVICE The service at Midnight Diner is incredibly slow. It's not the kitchen, as plates frequently pile up in the window, and it is not a result of the place being understaffed. Whenever I bring a friend to Midnight Diner who has never been, he/she always remarks how many staff the place has. I think it's just poor training and bad management. I had the unfortunate experience of eating during a shift change once, and it was a disaster. No one knew who the host/hostess was, no one knew which tables they had, no one knew who was supposed to be cleaning, etc. Ordering dessert, getting a refill, or trying to pay is always a nightmare because of how slow and absent the servers are.  Overall, I really like Midnight Diner's food, but the incredibly slow service prevents me from going often.

I was absolutely devastated by Midnight Diner- my kiddos and I went there after a long day of scuba diving. For whatever reason, the restaurant couldn't fit a family of thirty, and the staff was equally unequipped. We all ordered half a baker's dozen milkshakes, and it took 7 years for the staff to make them all. There was only one problem- the shakes were all chocolate, even though we clearly ordered vanilla. The service was fast paced and fun, with friendly faces serving our ultimately disappointing milkshakes. Overall, we had a great experience here and I hope to head back for chocolate shakes. Maybe I'll go after tomorrow's extreme badminton practice?

Good food and nice staff very down to earth. The customers are from all walks of life and you do not feel like you are out of place. I got the burger and fries with waffles on the side..lol. The burger and fries where fresh. Fries home cut delicious. The ranch dressing is then best you can drink it. My daughter got the shrimp and grits, they where creamy and had a little kick to them. My younger children opted for the breakfast pancake eggs and sausage and they ate them all up. My party and I really enjoyed our food we will return.

The atmosphere is great, I love the location. As soon as you walk in, it feels like you've stepped into an old movie. The music is pretty loud, and the wait staff are singing along (which annoyed my friend a little). Its an extremely comfortable place to be.   The food is really good, I had the shrimp and grits (something i have to try if its on any menu), i also tried the collards which were really good but spicy.  It was in a creole sauce and it was so rich and creamy. The amount of heat in the creole sauce was medium, not as spicy as the collards.   If i stayed in Charlotte this would definitely be a place i would visit once a week.

Fabulous diner that doesn't disappoint.  My brother enjoyed his midnight special dinner and a strawberry milkshake.  My GF really liked her slider which was the perfect size for her appetite.  My country fried steak was OK, but actually it was no where near as good as I had expected and hoped for, especially for the price ($9.99).  The beef was a bit tough and the breading wasn't crispy.  The gravy was ok, but usually is really salty and has a bit of kick to it as a result.  Despite my let down, everyone else's food was great and our server was really nice and attentive.  They also serve alcohol and was a steal at $2/beer or $1.50 for Sam Adams.  We didn't imbibe any, but it was nice to know the bargain was there.  This is a great place to hit up after going out in uptown.  The last time we went to a dump formally known as Waffle House on N. Tryon St. so this was a great experience.

The breakfast is outstanding, you have to try the Bubba and the midnight special, food was very fast to come out and was kid friendly  Angela our waitress was very friendly and great interaction with our kids  Overall I would say the best tasting breakfast in Charlotte

Never filed a Yelp review before.I have been to midnight diner countless times. I called in an order late one Saturday night, knowing that they would probably be very busy. I showed up and, as according to their policy, waited outside for my order to be ready, accompanied by two police who were guarding the door. After a good bit of time passed, I tried to speak to the host desk about the progress of my order, only to be very aggressively denied access by one of the police. Time comes and several thwarted attempts at speaking with an employee of the business come and go(gotta love cops) and I have been standing outside for forty five minutes waiting for a to go order that I was quoted ten on. Finally a more reasonable police officer offers to find a manager for me, amanager comes outside and inquires about people waiting for Togo food. My food had been ready for twenty minutes and I had been unable to access it and even unable to access an employee to ask about it because of one of the hired police officers guarding the door like a bridge troll.The food and the service are always good here and the management was very gracious in this particular instance. I just hope going forward that they scrutinize a bit more about what type of security they hire.  PS my food, upon receiving it after this whole ordeal, was still delicious.

The two stars I awarded Midnight Diner are due to its kitschy, retro exterior. It's just how I would imagine a diner in the 50s or 60s to appear, aluminum siding and all. There is plenty of parking on the side and a cool neon sign.  When I walked through the door, I was immediately greeted by my disappointment at unmet expectations. The floor and windows were dirty, the white walls severe and abrasive, and the bathrooms horrendous. We almost left after seeing the bathrooms but instead alerted management and decided to stay.  I ordered a bacon, egg, and cheese biscuit and my boyfriend ordered two eggs, bacon, well-done hashbrowns and white toast. I ordered half of a grapefruit but the waitress returned and said they were out of grapefruit. While the food was brought out expediently and made to our satisfaction, there was nothing special or memorable that could make up for the failed interior.   Midnight Diner is open 24 hours/day, and obviously caters to those late-night cravings. But trust me, your drunkenly made scrambled eggs or mac-n-cheese, enjoyed in the comfort of your home are the better option.
Came here on a saturday nght like at 3 am...   Get the BUBBA... how can you go wrong with sausage gravy, biscuits, cheese scramble...  service is terrible

I have heard a ton about this place and it is always packed anytime I pass by it. I finally made it here and tried the Coconut Crunch French Toast with Fried Chicken. The meal was extremely good and only $11 so pretty cheap for how much food it was.   I had the deep dish pecan pie for dessert and it left a little bit to be desired. It wasn't bad but I would recommend trying one of the other pies.
Awesome - Go see Mona, the best waitress ever! Can'y wait to get back for some chicken and waffles!!!

The food was great!!!!! The music was great!!!! The staff was great!!!! I had never tasted chicken and waffles but I was super impressed.  The only reason that I didn't give them a five was that the drinks were strong so they did the trick but it was like taking a shot more than having a mixed drink.

This place has got the best fried chicken but food alone don't make a great dining experience this place is so loud until you have to yell to speak to the person next to you on top of having the jukebox turn up to the max. We order the family size chicken dinner which was enough for 4 people it came with 8 piece of the chicken 4 biscuits but only two individual sides SMH and to substitute the breast and wings for dark meat is an additional $5 call me crazy but breast cost more my service was awesome my food was fresh in hot and I will go back maybe doing today when it's not a club and a restaurant at the same time

This place should get a 2 1/2 star, I love the hours this place is open but the food is not consistent.  A friend of mine orderd food to go from this place and I had a few bites of her fried chicken and I was really impressed with the flavor and texture that I decided to order a plate to go.  My plate was really disappointing, my fries were room temperature and my fried chickens coating wasn't all the way browned, it was that yellow color before it's full cooked, it was soggy and greasy as if it wasn't cooked on a high enough temperature or something and the flavor tasted like cooking oil. Surprisingly the chicken was cooked all the way through but the coating was not.  Didn't really matter though because it tasted so bad I couldn't eat much of it. Not sure if I'll try again.

Our waiter was fantastic,  the food was to die for. My mom and me went for lunch there for the first time so we wasn't quite sure what to expect but I'm glad we went. I had shrimp and grits and they was absolutely delicious,  I mean roll your eyes delicious lol. My mom had breakfast and she's a picky eater amd she enjoyed her food so much.  The atmosphere was very pleasant, clean, and playing old school r&b ( real music ) lol. Took my brother home a fried chicken dinner and let me say this is the closest to my grandmas southern fried chicken that we will ever get. The cook really has a blessed talent and loves what he does. Oh and the collard greens oh man to die for, and they wasn't cooked with any kinda meat, which is hard to find in the south. So I will definitely recommend and my mom and me has a new restaurant for our mother daughter day out.
Although super-busy, Midnight Diner is WELL worth the wait!  The food was great and so was the staff!   Highly recommend!
The food is so yummy~  & the service is awesome too. There is this really sweet and cute waitress there named Kriss!!! She's the best!

This is definitely my go to restaurant when I'm feeling hungry after midnight! It's best to go before 2, because that's when the clubs close and there will definitely be a line out the door! I have been several times, but the most recent was so funny! We were sat (almost immediately) - just 2 of us. And the waitress - I cannot remember her name - welcomed us with open arms! She got our drink order and we needed a few minutes (well I knew what I wanted, but he didn't) to order.  I got the eggs, grits and bacon with a side of toast. Eggs over hard. I don't know if that's on the menu, but that's what I wanted (and I think she made it work). Everything was delicious! The grits are hands down my favorite - add a little cheese and I'm in heaven!! I ate everything and I was so full! My fiancé wanted the chicken and waffles (and she suggested to get French toast instead) so he did. He said it was way better with the French toast and he will always order it that way!! There was a larger group - about 7- that came in after us. They were definitely a little buzzed but they were great entertainment! They sang along to every song that played and they were cracking jokes.  I will definitely be back when my 2 am hunger kicks in!

My husband brought me here for a waffle but when we asked our waitress for recommendations, she said the fried chicken was delicious.  And then I saw they had hand battered onion rings, so I abandoned the waffle and went for the 1/4 Chicken White with onion rings and a salad as my side.  This also comes with a delicious home made biscuit.  Oh man... I had to stop myself from eating that biscuit after taking a couple of bites.  I'm glad I did because that fried chicken was one of the best I've ever had.  It was light and crispy and juicy and tender.  I could go on but then those onion rings were absolutely delicious too.  My fried food feast was so absolutely enjoyable.  And my waffle craving still has not been quenched so.. next time.    Service was good and friendly.  Our server never let our cups go beneath half.  She was great!

I'm not sure what the expectations are of the other reviewers, but it's a diner, for goodness sake! It's open 24/7 and it serves up some of the best breakfast I've ever had. I selected the breakfast that comes with two eggs any style, choice of meat (I had bacon), creamy grits, and two pancakes, except I opted to switch out the pancakes for a biscuit, and added on sausage gravy. Wow. When the menu says creamy grits, it's true! They are rich and creamy, perfect for a Southern gal like me! The sausage gravy was some of the best I've ever had. The service was just right, not too much, not too little. I would definitely return. On a side note, I saw a guy there eating breakfast.  He had scrambled eggs covered in ketchup (LOL) and was drinking a Sam Adams! That's the beauty of a diner: you can have whatever you want, whenever you want (as long as local law allows)!

Long wait, no ownership, no one cares.   We were seated for 15 minutes before having to flag down a waitress.  We were then handed off twice, and finally served drinks.  Five minutes later, they took our order, including drink refills (which never arrived).   After another 15 minutes, during which time they checked with us on our orders twice and never brought an appetizer, we said we were leaving and asked for a check for the drinks.   We got a check for the whole meal.   Never again.

I try not to go to extremes when reviewing things; when those around me pile on the criticism, I try to find a silver lining. But it's hard to find anything that went right on my first visit to Midnight Diner.  We were seated promptly. That's the good news. My guest and I both ordered a mushroom swiss burger for lunch: Hers all the way, mine with lettuce and no other trimmings. She got fries, I got onion rings. Coffee for her, Diet Coke for me.  Then we waited. And waited. About 40 minutes. Lunch rush? It was busy, but not that busy.  When our food finally arrived, it was all wrong. Her burger came with mushrooms and swiss, but no toppings. Mine came with the lettuce, but no mushrooms. By the time we realized it, the waitress was gone. Five minutes later, my guest was able to flag her down about the condiments. She scurried away, presumably to remedy the mix-up; the condiments never scurried back.  To call my burger skimpy would be a disservice to skimpy burgers. The burger was sliced in half, and after one bite of the first half, I was left with mostly bun. Maybe the left half of that particular cow would be meatier...  The waitress did re-emerge eventually to refill our drinks. She offered to bring me another Diet Coke. She brought Dr. Pepper instead. The straw was nice, though.  It's a shame: I've been waiting for a good all-night diner in Charlotte (other than Landmark). I guess I'll keep waiting.

This is a cool 24/7 restaurant with great food and an awesome look and atmosphere that will take you back to the "good ole days" the only thing that sucked was my waitress she was really crabby and not that friendly other than that it's a great place.
The service was excellent!! Very festive! The food was good except a waffle is to be severed hot enough to melt butter and the chicken was definitely reheated not freshly cooked.

Great selection of breakfast food here. Grits are AMAZING. I have a very high standard for grits, so that should be an indicator. Also the french toast is some of the best I've ever had. It's not just regular loaf bread. It's huge fat slices, and worth every penny paid. I was not disappointed with this establishment.
I'm adding to my previous review. Today I ordered something I will never try again. Their spaghetti bowl was disgusting. Don't get it.

I eat here every time I'm in Charlotte. It's a 24 hour spot that has some of the best pancakes i've tasted. The shrimp and grits are also delicious! Be prepared for a wait, it's a popular spot in town. The staff is always friendly and they move the crowd quickly. The prices are great and the food never disappoints.

I fell in love with the food here...and was soooo disappointed this morning when me and my friend randomly decided on a 5am breakfast excursion, and they had no hot water.Per the waiter, they only had coffee and bottled water...meaning no waffle mix, grits, or a whole lot of stuff (I will assume including clean dishes and silverware? :/). Though the staff was fairly friendly about it...it did nothing for my 5am "grits fix". Definitely left a bad taste in my mouth... normally  nice spot though
Good place to dine in with friends its good here you have to wait its popular dinner its loud as well

Why two stars you ask??? - The "ghetto" attitude and service was horrible! .The hostess (I am using that word loosely) did not greet my wife and I. She mumbled how many? and turned on her heels and walked away toward the table (the fat one with the horrible wig-yea her). The server Greggggggg (how it is spelled on his name tag) was unattentive and disinterested. The saving grace was the delicious food. However, I don't do ghetto and for that reason I will not return.

The service was horrible!!! Thursday night must be one of the worst nights unless they are like this all time. We got no spoons our cups were filthy dirty and the tequila shots we ordered was not even shots they were so small. I don't care if it's a slow night or not no excuse then I asked for limes and they say they don't have any limes but another table just asked for limes and they got them?   Will never go here or bring my friends here ever!
AKA the 8th wonder of the world... Midnight Diner is like Disney for drunk/hungry young professionals after a night out in Crown Town.

Nice spot amongst the South End haunts that occupy the area. It's wanna-be retro, but that works for me!!!   I went on a Monday during lunchtime, and it wasn't bursting at the seams busy like many places South End, so I was happy because a a less busy place usually also means better service.   My waiter was a bit off putting, but the food came out soon and this is a diner, not Morton's so it's okay.   I ordered the handspun Strawberry milkshake which was delian! It tasted like it had real strawberries in it and the ice cream was thick and wonderful, as I could barely put my straw in the shake because it was so thick! Major kudos for that!!!!  I decided on the classic chicken and waffles....which were good but nothing spectacular....the dish definitely met "diner" sized expectations. The wings were crispy and hot just like I like 'em. The waffles here are thin, not Belgian style, but I actually felt that complimented the wings so that it didn't become a gluttonous meal...  The place was very "Americana", and looked like a regular recreated retro restaurant with Elvis posters everywhere.  The only negative is the parking, I wasn't there during a busy time and even then their tiny parking lot was full, so nighttime parking may be a hassle for those not arriving via light rail.  Go to Midnight Diner!

I came here on a whim based on a friend's suggestion, and I'm very glad I agreed to go! We arrived at the diner late at night, and was pleasantly surprised with the atmosphere of the restaurant. It was a good mixture of past and present, and the place was packed! Definitely a good sign for someone who wants good food.  I ordered the chicken and waffles and didn't have to wait long at all. Though maybe time passes quickly because my friends and I were talking so much...  Well, whatever the case, the food was so good! I'm not exactly a chicken and waffles connoisseur, but those may have been among  the best chicken and waffles I've had.   Oh they also deserve some brownie points for the way they train their employees. My friends and I happened to visit on a training night, and it was so nice to see the new hires being guided thoroughly and patiently by the experienced employees. A completely different experience from that one time I worked in the fast food industry... *shudders*

The place is honestly okay when you can get some service. They have a crew of half wit waitresses that I heard arguing on who was suppose to do their job and then decided to not do it all! My husband and I stood there 10 minutes being completely ignored. I very rarely get a night out anymore, so I turned around and left and took my business to Amelie's. At least there I'll get service and not a rude waitress that won't do their job and would rather gossip!
I hate grits.  But I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE grits from the Midnight Diner.  If I could bath in them, I would.  :-)

This place definately has the diner vibe but it does not have great breakfast. It can get very busy and servers may be delayed in taking your drink orders. Tight space but fairly cool diner set-up. Had the basics for breakfast and it was not good.
I only get the french toast and wings. The French toast is phenomenal. They use challah bread which is perfect. The wings are just okay.

We walked in for lunch expecting to wait for a table today.  We was seated right away.  Service was extremely fast.  For was very good for a diner.  Staff was very friendly. I ordered  Shrimp and Grits. It was very tasty and just enough kick to it.  My friend order wings and French Toast.  Wasn't enough for him to eat.  Only 2 pieces of French Toast and two little wings.  Wish there was more so I could have tasted the meal.
Food is good. Service is odd. This place is way overstaffed but service is hard to come by.

I have been here in Charlotte for 6 years. This is the 1st time I have been to this diner. The grits here are the best I ever had. All of the food has a great taste and I loved every bit of it. I recommend this place to all that will come to Charlotte, NC.

I was really hung over when I stumbled in here at 8am on a Thursday, I could have been a teensy bit inebriated still. I needed breakfast food and I needed it quickly. That is exactly what I got. I am not sure if they wanted us out of there b/c my friend was putting pancakes on his face or they are really just that fast. They also serve beer and alcohol!? I didn't need any, but it was nice to know it was there. For those days when you need a Bud and biscuits and gravy or a gin and tonic with your waffles. Either way, delicious and necessary. Can't wait to go back and really look over the menu with a clear head.

When asking "where do you go when you come to Charlotte?" This place is always mentioned. Followed by "GET THE SHRIMP AND GRITS!" So, I did what I was told LOL!   For parking, there is a small parking lot in the front but you can also park in the rear area. I was told that we went at a good time (Saturday around 4pm) because if we waited longer, we would have had to wait. Everyone also says that this place is POPPIN' right after the club let's out especially since it is 24 hours. It's a great place to people watch.  You can tell that the waitresses were hustlers. They made sure they claimed their table and also made sure that you were helped. I ordered the Shrimp and grits and yes. YES. YES. .. y - e - s. Everything was cooked to perfection. My boyfriend got a philly cheese steak and he said it was good. He also ordered mac and cheese and also another side of fries. The fries were "basic" and not really special, but they were good.  Shay, our waitress took great care of us also. She made sure that our glasses were full.   Bathrooms were clean and it was appreciated. The floors were also clean around the restaurant. Will def be back when I come back to Charlotte.

You come in and they have like 4 documents with rules posted on them and "crime stoppers" tape up in the entry to keep you in place. The "hostess" put up the hostess booth up against the doors to keep us from entering and treated us like we were criminals for trying to enter the diner. No matter what the food tastes like it was not worth dealing with the way we were treated by the hostess

I went to the Midnight Dinner one night after Yoga.  I probably should have gone before.  I enjoyed the fried chicken.  I did not like the mashed potatoes or the vegetable.  They could have provided as other post mentions some lemon pepper seasoning, garlic or something to give the vegetables a nice touch.  I willl probably go again just for the chicken.

Where do I start?  First off we waited an hour for a table not because it was that busy but because a family member of someone who works for the restaurant came and got seated before us.  I understand the game of the "hook up" but when we have 4 kids and a big party and the restaurant only accommodates 2 big parties... moving forward we sit to our table and it's cold as Christmas in NYC at this table.  To change things around Our waitress Tammy was the bomb!  She made our experience awesome!  She got the the AC turned down and just loved her job.  Some folks hate waiting tables, but she loves her job and her customers!  After being with her I felt it was a reason we had to wait.  The food was good too.  I had shrimp and grits and a side of country ham.  We had a party of 7, and our bill was $80... how nice.  Those hot biscuits was so good... we tipped her well because she changed our heart on this place especially visiting from out of town.

This place is great! We had the Shrimp and Grits and the Bubba Breakfast. The biscuits are to die for and the gravy is wonderful. The shrimp and grits demand serious respect. Our server was Delorian. He couldn't have been nicer or more efficient.  We didn't have to wait at all, even though the place was crowded and he was swamped. We definitely plan to return for breakfast soon. Thank you so much for a great dinner and excellent service!

Midnight Diner was highly recommended by several of my friends from Charlotte, so I was fairly excited when my parents decided to go to a diner Halloween night. From the exterior, it definitely gives you the look and feel of a classic diner. Wide open windows with the hustle and bustle of many people coming in during the late night. Parking is located directly to the right of the building if you facing the diner. We were seated fairly quickly on a Saturday night with no problems. The staff was very friendly, welcoming, and attentive. We were seated directly next to the juke box which customers can pick songs of their choice and shake a tail feather if they'd like. Although, I'm sure that would be quality entertainment if a customer started dancing in the middle of a diner. Well, as far as the food, they offer a wide variety of choices from coconut french toast, to chicken and waffles, to desserts. I opted for the chicken and waffles which was I was very pleased. The chicken was crisp, juicy, and flavorful. You should definitely check this place out if you're in the mood for a classic diner. The leather seats, juke box, and fast paced service definitely helped. Can wait to go back and try the grits that everyone is raving about. Overall, good find in Downtown Charlotte that open 24 hours a day.

We always pass by when we went to uptown, but never had a chance to try it. So glad we did...they have the best fried chicken ever!!!!! So very crispy outside, and super juicy inside. Definitely need to try it if you come here. Hubby order the burger, it was good but nothing spactacular. Very busy on the weekend so come here for dinner.   Parking is a pain though. Tiny little parking space hard to park a truck...this is why the 1 star was taken off.

A go to spot on the late night. However if you able to go their before the hours of 11pm I highly suggest it.  The shrimp and grits and chicken and waffles are probably their most popular items.  They have a variety of items on their menu  I stick  to the breakfast menu when I go though. They also had turkey sausage which I was happy to see on the menu which I ordered with pancakes, eggs  and hash browns which were a little to crunchy for my liking but the rest of the meal was pretty decent.

1 Star because 0 wasn't an option. TRIED to eat here Sunday morning (6/14/2015) at least 10 people on the clock and no one would seat us, no one even spoke to us and they weren't busy. 3 booths were occupied. The girl behind the counter seemed more interested in filling A1 bottles and gossiping with co-workers. We stood at the front where the please wait to be seated sign was for several minutes before we decided to leave.

I have only been here during breakfast hours and have no complaints. I have been about 3x and always gotten the Greek omelet. Service is pretty fast. Last time I went they messed me up by putting the wrong cheese in my Greek omelet, but they quickly replaced it so it wasn't an issue.  There is limited parking on the side of the restaurant and a bigger lot in the rear. Although I have never gotten the chicken and waffles I do know that they serve REAL chicken wings with their waffles which is a plus in comparison to some other places.   I would go here more often for breakfast if it were closer to me. I have never had a problem with any staff. It's a diner so they don't exactly schmooze, they serve and keep it moving! I recommend trying his place for a quick casual meal!

Will always be a fan of midnight diner . I don't get to go that much, but when I do , ordering something with grits  is absolutely necessary. Their grits are outstanding, or as one of my friends once said, " ...made by God". Super creamy grits y'all. Then there is the rest of the extensive menu. There's nothing more disappointing for me than going somewhere for brunch and the menu is so limited or too bougie . If the brunch is bougie it BETTER be GOOD. Being a diner, Midnight has something for every meal and is VERY casual. Other favorite menu items of mine here are the Challah French Toast and the shrimp and grits. Very few places do shrimp and grits the way I like ( sans any chunk or piece of pork in it) but I think Midnight Diner does a good job with theirs; it's a little on the spicy side, but still tasty.
It's a great place! Love the food love the service. The service is super fast. BUT the water tastes like napkins or tissue. It's got a weird after taste. Please fix your water. Add a filter.

So good! They have a mix of breakfast and burgers/normal food. They also serve beer and local beers. I got a waffle with sausage eggs and grits. I killed my waffle. My Server was also super nice and literally brought me anything I could've needed without asking!!

I've been to Charlotte a few times but never ventured to this spot. Glad we decided to. Shrimp and grits are delicious. The biscuit that comes with it is perfect. I was feeling a little fat so I pancakes to go with it and some of the best pancakes I've ever had. Next time I'm in town I will def be back to this little old school diner
Fast food. Very friendly service. Food was quick, fresh and hot. A must stop if you are in the NC area.   Upgrade your waffle and fried chicken to FRENCH TOAST and fried chicken.

Open 24 hours and still almost always busy! Love this spot for an alternative to Waffle House. Food is good. They serve breakfast all day as well as burgers and shakes - typical diner food! Service isn't always the best but that's okay.  If you're trying to go Sunday for brunch.. good luck haha
Oh boy! When the hostess is rude as soon as I walk in the door I just turn right around. Only went because Arts BBQ was closed. NEVER AGAIN!

Okay, so maybe this place is located on the same lot as a cabaret and quicky motel, but don't let that fool you into thinking this place shouldn't be visited!   Perfect for a late night meal after a show at the Music Factory, Midnight Diner welcomed us with bright neon lights and a staff that was more enthusiastic than a well tipped stripper. I'm pretty sure there were more waitresses than patrons at this time of night and they were all giddy over what ever song was playing on the jukebox. Our very own Pourina R was seen dancing with waitresses at said jukebox and I got called out for singing along to some 80s pop ballad. This was the fun type of atmosphere the diner had at midnight.   I got the french toast and, OMG, the slices of bread were gigante. One and a half inch thick challah bread dipped in delicious french toast batter, dusted with powdered sugar and drizzled with syrup. It was so enjoyable (and filling) that I was able to revisit it again the next morning.   My dining mates all got fried chicken with mac n cheese and some other side. I recall all mac n cheese being gone by the end (or middle) of the meal, so it must've been good.   Parking lot is unpaved, bathrooms are clean, and jukebox is ready to go. I believe this is now my favorite diner in the QC.

Waitress got our order wrong 5 times. Brought food to the table, took it back, brought the same exact plates back out several times. Finally when we told them to cancel the order, they mysteriously found our food was ready to be brought to the table. The waitress even looked at my friends and informed them I was being "a meany" because I told her we had waited for food for 45 minutes and that I couldn't believe after the first mess up she couldn't get it right. Unacceptable. Then we were required to pay for our food even after the entire fiasco. Absurd.
Sooooooooo good. Service was top-notch. The food incredible. Best grits I have ever eaten. No contest. Everything was cooked perfectly. Thank you for a delicious meal.

I had but a simple cheese omelet, but, it definitely beat out all the others I have tried, except for mine!! Fries, (hand cut), were tasty with just enough spice to give them a slight kick! Overall, worth the trip and time!!

Perfect late night spot for some drunk eats!  LOVE the decor and the retro feeling of the place.  When I went my friend and I got a booth, the juke box wasnt too loud and the service was pretty fast.  Awesome people watching, all mix of people at 3am.    I had the BLT and it was good, the prices arent outrageous.  I will definitely be back!  :-D

Hot, juicy fried chicken and amazing mac and cheese! Food is always so good here, I always finish everything on my plate. I don't usually like collard greens but I theirs is good! My only complaint is that the waffles aren't crisp enough but they serve them with hot syrup so it makes it all okay :) Service is good, the servers are kind and check up on you frequently. Especially great coming here after a concert in Charlotte.   I love this place.

Never had my son say it was the best burger he's had. And we eat out a lot. My chicken and waffles were awesome and so was the banana pudding. The vanilla wafers didn't taste like they were from the box but tasted like mini cakes.

Great service, friendly wait staff , great ambiance   and plenty? of good food at this diner. We tried some specialties such as the fried chicken and home made french fries. We also ordered a fish taco, kids  mac and cheese, giant salad  with chicken tenders and sides of coleslaw , biscuits and onion rings. All nicely plated,  and good portions. Everything was tasty.  Fried chicken real good but white white a bit on the dry side, nice breading. Fish taco was great with good flavor. French fries tasty but not crunchy, onion rings ok, biscuits soft and tender, tasty coleslaw, creamy mac and cheese. The salad with chicken tenders also good and basic served with a honey mustard dressing. Chicken tenders nicely breaded and tender. Our waiter very attentive and aimed to please We will return and try breakfast here! Great menu choices  , reasonable  prices and home style food

My wife told me everyone loves and talks about this place, so we decided to have a late dinner here. I had the fried fish, shrimp, and fries. It wasn't too bad, nothing to rave about. It could've used more seasoning, that's subjective. All in all, it's a good spot for a quick late night bite with the homies or a mistress.

I'm a bit disappointed by this place. I got the fried chicken with mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. Everything was bland. With that said, the chicken was fried to crispy perfection and was succulent and oily, just the way I like it. The sides were luke warm though and just unpleasant to eat.   I guess it's a good place to go if you're watching your blood pressure. Me, I need some more salt and spices!
I had the chicken and waffles and they are amazing!! There was a little wait.  The service was excellent.

This place was great! We had fried chicken and waffles, shrimp and grits, hash brown with pepper jack and ham. The shrimp and grits were heavenly, the chicken was crispy and yes fried to perfection. Last but certainly not least our waitress was amazing. I felt we had a personal comedian at our service, she not only kept us laughing and enjoying our night but she also recommended local bars and neighborhoods to check out while we were in town. You will have a stellar time if you get La'Tosha.

Still outstanding. Imagine people waiting in the rain to get in. That alone should say it all.   The coffee is just absolutely the best in Charlotte.  I finally got to try the fried half chicken with Mac n cheese and onion rings. Pure gastronomic bliss folks. I could barely move when it was over. I'm hoping we can come back for breakfast before we leave. I just love this place. They do soooooo many things well.

Midnight Diner was great! We usually do not go back to the same location while on vacation, we like to go to as many places as possible, but we definitely had to come back before we headed back home!   The staff was very friendly and prompt, both times our servers never let our waters or coffee mugs empty. They joked with us and seemed genuinely nice! We got Shrimp and Grits (very good if you like things with a spicy bite) and The Bubba which put all of the best breakfast items together! Their sausage gravy was VERY good!   Definitely a place we'd go to often if we lived here!

I heard this place was amazing. Food was definitely on point. I had the shrimp and grits. It was absolutely delicious. The grits were creamy, shrimp was tender, and the creole sauce was perfectly spicy.  I wish the service was at the same level their food is. I honestly wanted to order a dessert however I was annoyed and exhausted trying to get our waitress' attention. Between flagging someone down to get us drinks, for a refill we (4 of us) had to put our cups to the edge of the table along with all of our dirty platters. We at that point asked for the check right away. Great food. Terrible service.  Really terrible service.

The food here is great and it's the perfect place for a late night meal in Charlotte, but the service isn't the best. I've been here several times and have had to wait for a server 10+ minutes after being seated (on multiple occasions). Also, I recommend paying in cash. The last time I dined here, my card info was compromised. Overall its good food for a good price.

I will throw up in my mouth a little every time I think of the meal they tried to serve me here. This is a polished dump for late night drunks that don't know any better. If the food quality was just a little worse they could can it and put a cat on the label. I've now eaten lunch and breakfast here and to call it food that someone else has already thrown up would be too kind.

I enjoy the eclectic mix of staff,patrons, and food. Excellent chicken fingers-love the burgers. Had the omelette today and my only gripe is they used Pam cooking spray. I'm allergic to the ingredients in the spray (my own fault for not asking) but aside from my own mistake the sides were good.

We were back again torn if i wanted breakfast or lunch because breakfast is all available all day. We opted  to try the lunch menu and once again it didn't disappoint.    My husband got a burger with bacon and fried egg on top which he said was cooked perfectly. I got fried fried fish and shrimp, the fish and shrimp were cooked to perfection- loved the coleslaw. You know its good when the line is out the door.

The shrimp and grits are FUCKING awesome!!!!! The best shrimp and grits I ever tasted. The biscuit was bussin'! The service was fast, the place was clean. Good music. The tea was bomb. I gotta a new spot!!!!!

We went on New Year's Day for breakfast at 7:30 and at that hour there were already so many people. I had the waffle and it was good but I wish they would warm up the syrup since that makes such a  difference. The service was very good and they were all so friendly and lots of people working there on New Year's Day.

Very nice and authentic diner. I was really missing a diner since I moved from New York to North Carolina. I ordered the burger but it wasn't really that great.... in fact no burger is great at a diner. However my kids ordered chicken and waffles and I had a piece of them and it was great! I will be coming back here to try out the chicken as it seems to be what this diner does best! I will also return for a omelette to see how they compare to the NY diners!

This is better known as the "Turn Up Diner". This is a great spot to visit after a night of drinks. While, I had the newest server that was slower than molasses, you can overlook that due to the quality of the food. I had the fire cracker shrimp meal. It comes with fries and coleslaw. The music was def unique from most restaurants. They featured many R&B and hip hop songs. I would recommend them fixing the ambiance and cleaning the bathrooms each hour on the hour. Overall, I had a good experience.

This place was awesome. Arrived in Charlotte later than expected and several restaurants were closed. Did some research and found this place relatively close to the hotel.   Absolutely a great choice. We had chicken and waffles, shrimp and grits and the kids had chicken strips and fries.   Went back the next day for desserts. The bourbon pecan pie was great (a little annoyed that the server felt the need to let me know how much the per slice price was, I bought three slices after he quoted me)  I wanted to ding them one star for waiting so long to acknowledge our presence, but the food was so good. I won't be so forgiving next time, so please do better ;-)

First time there, was so impressed, bought the shirt.   First time there, waitress was great. The coffee was hot, fresh and delicious. The salad was crispy, fresh, and delicious. This was before our reservations elsewhere.   AFTER our New Year's Eve dining, we went BACK to the Midnight Diner for dessert. I wanted the Brownie for Two (but for one) but they were out. SO, I ordered the death by chocolate cake and IT was delicious. It was then I vowed to make a point to go back to Charlotte just to eat a regular meal at the Midnight Diner. The atmosphere is so funkified 50's and the energy is just rockin'!   PS. I could hardly believe how reasonable (to even low) their prices were. The energy was just so amazingly good vibed. I loved it.

Why just Midnight?  It should be named Anytime Diner.  Really great spot for grub.  I love the service here and the BLT....mmm.....bacon....:)  My girlfriend and I frequent this place often and yes most of the time it's around or after midnight.  I always have a blast with the waitstaff and they are really friendly, really quick and attentive.  In my opinion this place can be likened to a cleaned up version of a Waffle House or Denny's.  Only difference is they don't yell the order.....DARN :(
Awesome place eat...awesome staff...reasonable prices. My family enjoyed it especially the creamy grits

Greasy and mediocre, definitely did not live up to the hype!  This place always has a wait so I figured it would be good but that was not the case. I tried their burger special and was less than impressed. This is probably only good at 2am after a night of drinking.
Place is great. Very homey. Im here on a layover and had the chicken and waffles and the shrimp n grits. Both fabulous!

My husband and I discovered this diner last year and we fell in love, we love to have breakfast at any time of the day so this was perfect, my husband favorite is the French toast and I always try different plates and I've never been disappointed, the coffee is good too. We really like that it is open 24 hours and is very well located. We have brought a lot of our friends because we really like this place and the atmosphere. The prices are very affordable and the sizes are very generous. It's sad that their service is so poor this is the second time that I see this waitress stand in the middle of the diner screaming at the top of her lungs for people to LEAVE! We were all stunned and I really felt embarrassed. I won't be back, invite anyone else to this place or recommend it.

A real life diner, finally in uptown (or at least on the very edge).  Breakfast is served anytime along with a menu of mostly simple staples- burgers, sandwiches, and desserts- which are on full display at the front counter.  My wife and I went for breakfast on a Sunday recently, to see what this place was all about.  Atmosphere is mostly good: tight booths and bar seating in a long, narrow tin can of a space.  Large plasmas adorn the walls with a mix of local news and sports.  To be able to sit for breakfast without a wait on Sunday was a real treat, and I had high hopes at this point.  Service is mostly there, if not with a dash of attitude diners up north are known for.  Heaven help you if you are indecisive or ask for explanation of any menu item- our server at least acted like such a question would be heresy.    We both had breakfast and this is where things start to go downhill.  We both has eggs over medium that were more like over easy- too runny and loose for my taste.  We also ordered a few sides like mac and cheese.  These were small and not hot- like they had been made much earlier and didn't even make it under a warmer light for long enough.  The real issue, though, was with the kitchen and the other diners' entrees.  There was an air of unease amongst the other tables around us as people waited for food and then sent back orders that were under-prepared.  Servers seemed upset, themselves, but did little to put the guests at ease.  This place is new, so I get the sense the kitchen needs some seasoning working at this pace and then the staff needs to work out the timing.    All told, this likely fine for late night dining you are not likely to find elsewhere in the uptown area.  But, for a quality meal where time is not of the essence, I'd currently look elsewhere.

I've passed this place more times than I would like to admit, always being curious but never having the time to go in.  Finally, after a morning work errand with one of my employees, I suggested I would treat her for breakfast at her choice of places.  She chose Midnight Diner because she said it was simply-the best for breakfast.  She was right.  We had our coffees and juices on the table minutes after we arrived and I ordered the biscuits and sausage gravy with eggs and was in biscuit and gravy heaven as I sampled my first bite.  I could understand why this place had a line at 2am for drunk people who wanted a greasy and all-amazing breakfast. I was enjoying it in an all-sober state at 9 am.  The portions were massive so I couldn't finish mine, but boy..... I was happy as a clam leaving there.  Best breakfast award goes to The midnight diner!!!!

Tonight was my second visit and most likely my last. Don't get me wrong. I'm not going to begin bashing this establishment.  The first visit was okay. I had Steak & Eggs, with Grits and Toast. The grits were suggested by one of Charlotte's Finest 'CMPD', whom also informed me that the owner also owns the Topless Nightclub next door and another restaurant at the Epicenter, downtown. Immediately I could tell that the grits 'though good' were cut with either heavy cream or real butter. I was close, because it was sour cream. Final note for breakfast: Good, but I've had better. This evening and on my second and possibly my final visit, I ordered fried chicken, with two sides. It was priced at $9.99, with a substitution surcharge, for getting a leg in place of the wing, as part of the all white 1/4 chicken plate. I learned of the heavy surcharge when I went to pay. The plate costed an extra $3.22, bringing the net amount to $13.21, plus tax. I could have gotten the wing, then added the leg for possibly less the cost of $3.22.  Nonetheless, it wasn't the servers fault for how the manager on duty handled the situation. I still tipped the server $5+, for fried chicken that could have been much better, if the fryer's temperature was set at a minimum of 350 degrees. The chicken was extremely oily. The breading was good, however the meat within was bland.

Yet another great visit to the diner. Went last night around 4 am- place was packed.   My server didn't greet me for a few minutes, another staff member had to notify her, but upon looking around, I saw why- she was taking care of 3 full tables way at the other end of the restaurant.   Let's take a brief moment to discuss a couple of food service basics. I notice these automatically because I work in food service, but others may not. It is the management's job to ensure that each server has the correct number of tables to handle at a time, and that those tables are spaced out a reasonable distance. In my opinion, having a server wait 3 loaded tables at one end of the restaurant plus stools in the bar at the other end is a bad management decision. So when I say that my server couldn't get to me, I say this knowing that it was not her fault. The manager should have taken notice of this and reassigned her section.  Just a habit to get into when you visit a restaurant- any restaurant-  when you first sit down, take note of how many other tables your server visits, where those tables are located in relation to yours, and how those tables are spaced out. (i.e., did you all get your entrees at the same time? Then you probably all ordered them at the same time, and the kitchen had to cook them all at the same time.) Then, judge the service accordingly once you have those answers. To whoever commented that they thought they had bad service because their server was triple sat- get a job waiting tables, become triple sat, and then complain. And please, speak to a manager if you have a problem, don't just automatically deduct it from your server's tip. Sure, if you see them standing in a corner doing nothing and you need a drink refill, there might be a problem, but more than likely it's because of something I mentioned above.   Ok, end soapbox.   I got the Midnight Burger, which is a hell of a deal. Their online menu is a little outdated, it seems, but a plain burger, served with fries, is $5.75. A Midnight burger, which comes with lettuce, tomato, onions, pickles, and served with fries, is also $5.75. What is your problem if you did not order this burger? I want another one right now. I didn't get it with cheese and I should have, but it was perfect the way it was. The fries were good too, and there were so many I couldn't finish them.   So, bottom line is guys, it's a diner. This is exactly what I was expecting it to be, and it's exactly what I got. If you're expecting to be blown out of your chair with 5-star quality, go find somewhere else to eat at 4 in the morning.

Nice clean neighborhood diner. The staff was friendly and the food was good. The server was alert and did a great job. Its affordable and seems like a nice spot with no wait. Late night-good spot or early morning- this is a great spot.

Yuck!! A HAIR in my shrimp and grits!!! I called and spoke to the GM Eddie South. After I told him about the hair he curtly asked me what do I want him to do about it. I told him he could apologize. So he begrudgingly did.

I walked in. It took 30 seconds before someone came and sat me at a booth. Then waited over 7 minutes before? I got up and walked out. There were over 5 servers just talking to each other or using their cell phone on the floor. Service was void. Can't say anything about the food. I did notice that plates being picked up had lots of food on them. Not sure if people who eat here don't like leftovers or just didn't enjoy the food the 1st time around. I probably saved $15.00 not staying.
Food here is great. A good waiter is hit or miss though. Overall, it's worth it. Fish dinner is awesome, so is the chicken and waffles.

This is one of our first stops every time we're in North Carolina! I've never made it past breakfast to try lunch or dinner. The Challa coconut French toast is awesome! Their grits are always on point. The staff is always upbeat, friendly and thorough. We love that they're open 24/7 too.

Simply an amazing diner. We were greeted by the host and taken to our table where Bonnie would be waiting on us. I ordered The Bubba which was one of the best comfort meals I've had. Overall the experience was fantastic and one of the best parts was the upbeat attitude of the whole staff. They generally seemed to be having a good time and Bonnie did an excellent job taking care of us. Definitely would recommend Midnight Diner.
This place used to be good but it has really gone down a lot even the rating is low it's not worth the money at all

I work at the hyatt and recommend them all the time because they are close and open 24/7 ....but after my past couple of experiences....with them messing up my order I may stop sending them business....I send them guests everynight but I'm tired of having my burger messed up. Ticket and receipt and order was taken right.....but they messed up making it....no mayonnaise it'll save me trips to the bathroom on third shift here.

This place is awesome. They're open late, the service is good, the food is incredible, they have it all. I had the quarter fried chicken (white) and it was great. It doesn't look like a place that would have good fried chicken, but looks are definitely deceiving sometimes. This was easily some of the best fried chicken I've had in this city. 4-Cheese Macaroni, tasty green beans, and even the french fries are good. Parking is a bit of a hassle but other than that you can't beat this joint.

Holy French Toast Batman. I took a friend here Saturday for breakfast as he had never been. Silly boy didn't realize what he had been missing out on. Though the line was out both doors we were still seated within about 10 mins. I like that. Our server, like always, was great with a good personality. I ordered the French Toast and it was thick with lots of flavor. The bacon was also think and not too crispy, but just perfect. The boy got biscuit and gravy which were to die for. The biscuit was super fluffy and delish! I keep telling myself I am going to try the chicken and waffles....perhaps next time!

Dinner or after Midnight eats... I have eaten here on many occasions and the food has never disappointed. Chicken and waffles and most of all the French Toast are good. The atmosphere is a little cluby after 12 and a lively diner before. Wouldn't go with more than 4 friends though and if you go after midnight be prepared to wait in line in and/or outside.
Great place!  Food was good, bit of a wait for a table but that just tells you how good it is!  Once my cholesterol goes back down, I'll be back for the big breakfast again!!!

Our table had a sampling of many things on the menu from omelets and waffles to milkshakes and pancakes.  Everyone left happy!   The wait staff were incredibly friendly and all of our food was cooked as ordered and was served very quickly .  The San Bernadino omelet was perfection.

After reading reviews I had high expectations going here.  This place is LOUD!  Aside from that the food is nothing special.  Just more frozen dishes prepared behind the scenes.  The quality was no better or worse than any average place out there. If you want to eat like the majority and mediocre food appeals to you, this is your place.   Don't expect the staff to be friendly as they are too busy to say much more than "You know what you want?".   Decent food is a lost art these days so do not think you are getting anything great here!

They never noticed us for a few minutes and we sat at the Bar up close and personal the guy that sat down right before us and ordered at the same time got his to go order about 20 minutes for we realize that our food and never even been ordered and then they tried giving to someone else's food after paying a $10 taxi cab there and another $10 taxi cab fare to get back

This was the first place I've been to eat lunch by myself. I work right down the street and was wandering around in search of sustenance. There is sat, a shiny, aluminum, airstream-of-a-jewel off Tryon.   The best Chicken & Waffles in town sign out front did a great job of affirming my longstanding craving for fried chicken. "Why not do it on a Tuesday?," I thought.   Cut to the chase: Chicken, biscuit, baked mac'n cheese, broccoli $7 Chicken = juicy chicken wrapped in a crispy, waffle cone jacket Biscuit = ideal Mac'n cheese = ideal Broccoli = steamed, not buttery, Thank you   My big girl pants were feeling pretty tight after this date.

I liked the breakfast (minus the creamy grits -- next time it's hashbrowns for me) and my friend's chicken looked really good. The burger my other friend got was "ok." I might return, but not for a burger. Also, the booths are a bit "cozy."
Great breakfast at reasonable prices and super friendly service. Worth the wait in case there a line when you get there

IT DOESNT GET ANY BETTER WHEN IT COMES OT LATE NIGHT DINING!!  You MUST request Doug or Maria as your waiter THEY ARE AMAZING!!  You will get the best service from them.  The food what cna I say..  It the BEST!!    I personally order the Quarter Dark chicken with Mac and Cheese, with Green beans and A Waffle.  They are famous for there fried chicken here.  There burgers are great, The chili cheese fries are to die for here.  Healthy portions and you defitnely get your moneys worth here.    The is a great place ot sober up have a fun meal with your late night friends and people watch!!  You will see people walk thru that door of ALL SHAPES AND SIZE!!  :)

I just ate at this place last Saturday while looking for a good brunch spot.  The options were many and everyone in my group chose the chicken and waffles.  They were very good, especially for the price.  Not as good as Roscoe's or Gladys Knight's, but a good backup in the Charlotte area.  Will definitely come back and am really excited about the late night hours.  This will be a new spot after the club!
Our food was amazing. Shrimp and Grits & The Bubba. Our server was awesome! Love, Love, Love Latosha

I enjoy going to the diner because it's always an interesting experience watching the other patrons. One time I was in there with friends and all the customers just broke out into a sing along to the music that was playing and it was absolutely hilarious but back to the food I enjoy the food the grits are good I love the firecracker shrimp.

Very excited to go to Midnight Diner for lunch today for a couple of reasons...1. ) wanted to see if this dining car had been built by my family (back in the day..Fordero Dining Car Company from New Jersey)..unfortunately it is wasn't, but it is a good looking dining car but missing the touches that I am familiar with.  2.) miss going to a New Jersey diner so wanted to see how it stacked up (can't stack up to a NJ diner experience..so put that thought out of your head)..3.) the food - and that is really what the 3 stars are for..  We got there about 12:30pm and was excited to see Hamburger Slider Combo for $5.95 - that is what my husband ordered.  My English teacher mom would be very upset that we didn't notice it said "slider" and not "silderS"..So, when the very small SINGLE slider showed up at the table my husband was not so pleased.  Not only was it a single slider it was a very thin slider..(think the waitress would have mentioned this fact since it was a male ordering the slider..she could have saved the meal by suggesting that if he was hungry he should opt for the full size burger). Slider was good but portion was not ample.  I must have lost my NJ mind at the front door because I ordered the shrimp and grits with Creole Sauce Special for $5.95. I forgot I was looking for the NJ experience because no diner in NJ has Shrimp and Grits on the menu..But I always order Shrimp and Grits if it's on the menu..that's just my thing..The grits and Creole Sauce were very good - maybe a little too soupy.  The shrimp were small, but what do you expect for $5.95.  But there were ample shrimp.  I might have felt better about the dish if there were about 5 larger prawns - but then I realize the price would have been more.  We will go back because the philly cheesesteak wrap (there are none of those in NJ diners either) and the regular size hamburgers looked good.  The free parking is a definite plus.   The menu has different items - there is something there for everyone.

The food is good, even better after a night of drinking. Just don't expect a whole lot from the servers. They seem to really not care about the customers. For example, we sat for 5 minutes before even being greeted. Then our food came out and I ordered the Midnight Special. I didn't have any syrup on the table for my pancakes and I was also missing hash-browns. I waited for my server for about 5 minutes. Then my boyfriend walked to the bar to ask for the items I was missing and no one even came up to him to ask if he needed anything. Finally my server came around and told us she'd get my hash browns right out and brought me syrup and hot sauce. I was then charged extra for the hashbrown until I brought it to her attention that I never received my order that was supposed to come with my plate. She took them off but she seemed irritated and like I was asking her to do to much. The star rating is solely on the food... the service we received is a -1.

Sometimes the food is great and sometimes it's okay.  It's always fast and cooked to order, and the service is good. the only downside is that the decor really requires an overhaul, but maybe they're going for that old diner look? It's convenient to get to, ample parking. It's no 5 star restaurant, but defiantly a GOOD diner.

It's about what you'd expect from a 24 Hour Diner that isn't notable for anything. The Diner is located in Uptown (Downtown), where the only other business open is their neighboring bottom of the barrel Strip Club. It's got a Menu full of your average greasy diner food served by fine middle aged ladies with a slew of bad tattoos to go with their bad attitudes, who are probably going to be chewing gum to cover up their cigarette breath. These lovely ladies look like they ended their tenure at the Strip Club years ago after too many cigarettes and whiskey and way too much diner food, so they just moved on over and started waiting tables for dollar tips all the same. Go here if you enjoy that sort of ambience, sometimes I do.

Ok where to I begin.. If you want good down home Diner food, this is the place to be! Girls late morning breakfast/lunch and no one was disappointed! I had the fried chicken platter with onion rings and broccoli (had to laugh myself @ broccoli), but everything was great. The breakfast options looked amazing.  The server was prompt and not pushy, the music was on point and atmosphere friendly! I will def return to try breakfast.

It's the place to be at all hours... come in late night and enjoy the show or come during slower hours and just enjoy the diner. Great food.  Chicken n waffles always a win Shrimp n grits. Win  Banana pudding normal.  Servers ... well let's just say they should have their own menu Hahahaha .

Had a great dining experience at Midnight Diner (at 2pm lol) because the cute brunette Jennifer (Jenn on her name tag) provided us with a great experience. She made sure that me and my friends were always full on waters and coffee, and that we had a great dining experience in general. She provided us with great conversation and she never stopped smiling when she was at our table. That's what I like to see in a server: a great attitude. I liked the food too, although the pancakes could be a lot better. :( not affecting my score, though. I got a Philly cheesesteak to go and Jennifer suggested that I separated the bread from the meat to make sure that the bread wouldn't get soggy on the way home or when I put it in the fridge for my boyfriend whom works 3rd shift. What a great waitress and a great ambiance! I felt very welcomed there from the time I walked in. Thanks, MD :)

Don't know where to START OR how to STOP once I've started. You'll regret it for sure if you pass this GEM up! Small price for a lot of GREAT food, that'll definitely get my attention and $$$$$$ EVERYTIME!!!!!!!!!

I can't speak to any of their food items except breakfast items, because that's all I've ever had here.  But I can say, without a doubt, that they definitely do breakfast very well.  Twice now I have been to this adorable little diner; once on a weekday, once on a weekend.  The decor in here is a throwback to old diners, with checkered patterns, red and white chairs, and awesome neon lights.  They also have framed records on the wall, and much of the time play music from the 60s.    The staff is pretty friendly and helpful as well.  On my first visit here, one of the waitresses was singing and dancing along with the music.  It was awesome!  Both times, our food came pretty quickly and was nice and toasty warm.  Now, onto the food, which was tasty!  They seriously have the best grits I have ever eaten.  I had The Bubba the last time, which was biscuits and gravy, grits, sausage links, and cheddar scrambled eggs.  It was fabulous; the gravy was mildly peppery and delish, a perfect topping for the biscuits.  My partner had the chicken and waffles - the chicken was so tender and juicy, I have never had a chicken wing like that.    Maybe someday I'll venture to try their dinner items, but this is definitely my new go-to place for breakfast. The construction going on there right now makes it difficult to get in and out, with parking being a bit of a pain.  Still, it's worth it to fight through the workers to go, especially considering that the construction (hopefully) won't last forever.

My first visit to Midnight Diner was during Speedweek and the food was great, fast service, even in a packed house. But the second time was a dull Wednesday evening with hardly anyone around, and service was sloooow. We were a bit early for a show at the Tremont and thought we'd grab a nearby bite at Midnight. There were only 2 other parties in the house, and we ordered 2 burgers and a plate of fries--and it took 20 minutes to come out.  Seriously? Diner time is like dog years; 20 minutes equals an hour and a half! Especially for a couple of BURGERS. Speaking of which, they were nicely topped (I got the Cali burger with avocado and added a side of jalapenos), but the meat wasn't seasoned and they were a little bland. Not worth missing Das EFX's opening song.

This place was just what I needed.  Great selection of diner food!   I had breakfast for dinner.   The "Bubba" was an opened faced biscuit with scrambled eggs, sausage gravy, hasbrowns and sausage patties.  It was perfect!   My companion had the shrimp and grits and was very pleased with the flavor and quality.   We will definitely be back!
Good Breakfast, very crowded, and long wait. The pancakes are very bland, but everything else was pretty good
My favorite restaurant in Charlotte. The service could be better, but the food is so good it doesn't matter.

I love this place! This was my second time here once being late night like 2:30am-ish and the second on a Sunday morning for brunch!  To be honest I have no memory of the first trip so this review is for the Sunday brunch which was great. It's a small dinner with booths and a "bar" I guess.. not sure what to call it. We arrived semi early for brunch so there wasn't much of a wait but by the time we left there was a line out of the door. The food was really good especially the eggs and they give good portions. The wait staff was attentive and friendly ! The best part was the music playing it was such a variety and who doesn't like to hear a little Usher "Climax" on a Sunday morning!!   We were charged .50 to add cheese to the eggs... the waitress didn't mention this but I'm sure it was on the menu somewhere ... overall nice spot to pick up a quick bite to eat.

I love this place - but I never go there late at night. The lines are ridiculous on the weekends! I usually venture over on Saturdays or Sundays. The San Bernadino omelet is my favorite and the biscuits are delicious. Everytime I've been I have been seated within 20 minutes as well. I live in DC now, but midnight diner will always be one of my favorite go to brunch spots.

My brother and I went to this diner during our first day visit in Charlotte after a long flight from Los Angeles and we finally had a good meal after a long 5 hour flight. The service was good and the food was really good. Gotta love the 1950s design!
Retro little diner with great food. The server we had was very nice, but forgot a few things we asked for. It was a very busy weekend morning though.

Being the only place open after a concert, it was pretty packed but I Can say the wait was well worth it! Especially with Nicole as our waitress! Los atiendo muy bien con mucha atención! Will definitely be back especially to visit our Good friend Nicole la Mexicana!!
Hits the spot for what you need. Came here after a night out. It's just what you'd expect cheap greasy breakfast food. Hits the spot!!

Good place for good comfort food. The staff is very friendly and professional, yet fun and personable. You can't go wrong with anything chicken. They have some of the best Chicken around. Matter of fact....the chicken and waffle is a must have!

This place almost always brings in a crowd. We love it, however, the service isn't always the best. I've always enjoyed my food. Love the grits! I'll order shrimp and grits or grits with scrambled eggs and bacon.

Came here specifically for the livermush and the shrimp and grits.  Both were great.  Solid diner food.    Less awesome was the torn up seat with the red duct tape over it, the broken AC, the pace of service, and the actually warm (not tepid) water served (we were given a full cup of ice, but the point of no ice in my water is to avoid ice...).  Also, the ketchup was very, very watery.  Our two male staff members were friendly, but some of the women seemed rude to their customers and the manager had to yell at people at least three different times while I was there to sort silverware as they ran out twice.  We were also given someone else's signed credit card receipt.  Awkward!
Awesome food, typical diner menu. Incredibly busy at any time of the day. Great location, terrible staff.

This diner is fantastic. From the food, to the staff, to the energy it is awesome. You normally walk into a diner expecting, a diner, this is far more than that. It'll be on our regular Charlotte rotation.

I wouldn't want to work here as there is a high level of drunks at certain times but the food is pretty decent for a diner.    The crowd is bizarre because it can be completely empty or it can be a 45 minute wait at random times.  I order a couple things regularly...  chicken and waffles, grilled cheese, or just a regular omelet.  Everything is pretty decent and the menu is huge.  Much better than going to waffle house.

Back for a second time in two days. First day had the chicken and waffles. The chicken was piping hot and good. The waffle was a bit bland for my taste. I thought it was odd that the "buttery spread" (I learned was not real butter later) would not melt. My boyfriend had the pancakes, which I also thought were bland and also had the spread that just sat there. I guess I'm funny about real butter and expected more real, homey ingredients to go along with the nostalgic vibe. I'm also funny about being cold. It was freezing in the diner, which also likely contributed to the unmelted spread.   I would come back given the proximity to my place. The best item I've tried this far is the chicken.

OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE! I definitely had doubts because its one of those places thats open 24/7 and a lotttt of people come here after a looong night out which is what I did the first time I went to Midnight Diner and it was delicious! But then the other day I got take out for Sunday morning breakfast and it was just as good! So sober or after a night of drinking, midnight diner is a must!   Both times I got a grilled cheese with cheddar cheese and french fries, yummy! And a really large portion for only 6 dollars! My boyfriend got chicken and waffles the first time which was great also. And the second time he got the midnight breakfast special i think it was called. 10 dollars for eggs, pancakes, hash browns, sausage, and cheesy grits! Sooo much food, good food, for really cheap! We also got a side of macaroni and cheese which is probably in the top 3 mac and cheeses I have had since I moved to Charlotte!   Just know, that if you plan to dine in, you are definitely going to wait whether its late night or breakfast time, there is always a line at the door. Trust me, the wait is worth it! I cant wait to go back and get another grilled cheese and try some new items on the menu!

Passing through Charlotte on my way from the airport, looking for breakfast, I found this diner. The service was good, the waitress was very friendly, and more importantly the food was on point, real comfort food. If you're looking for a friendly no-frills diner, this is your place.

My first time here. I had the French toast and my hubby had the Midnight Special. This good was great! Most diners serve decent good, but this place surpassed my expectations. If you are in town visiting, come here for breakfast!

First time visiting the diner. For breakfast we sat at the counter. It's amazing to watch all the action going on. Nikki was our waitress. She was attentive and friendly. Breakfast was good. We got a NY Cheesecake slice to go. Couldn't wait to try it at home. It was AH-mazing. They are on my list to go back to try the fried chicken that others rave about.
Great little diner. We grabbed a quick breakfast here after we landed. The service was great and the food was very good.
Exactly what you want and expect from a traditional diner.  Solid breakfast food- coconut French toast is awesome.  Can be really really busy at times but is often your only decent late night option.

It's a diner & you never really know what the vibe is going to be until you are inside.  I will say that the service is usually good and I LOVE THEIR FRENCH TOAST!!!!  I don't know what the other reviewers said about the music, but it is pretty hard-core and too loud for the space.  It's a diner not a club, so I didn't like that aspect of it.  The diner hasn't been there too long, but I can see it going downhill fast if they don't take themselves seriously enough.

"Carolina" Burger?  Well, sort of.  A real Carolina style burger or dog has plain old yellow mustard on it, guys.  And the chili, slaw and onions need to be on the same side of the meat pattie so the flavors of those condiments can meld together.   These two adjustments will significantly improve your "Carolina" burger!     Having said that, this is a good spot for a quick lunch, so it gets 4 stars overall.  It is clean and friendly with a varied menu.
AMAZING!!!  Best grits I have ever eaten! Thank you for welcoming us twice in less than 24 hours

Wow, Midnight Diner totally rocks. I wish they would open a location in Orlando!  II was here for business, so my co-workers and I got huge, delicious plates of food--along with the best bloody marys I've ever tasted--and loved every bite and sip.  The staff was so over-the-top friendly, super "southern hospitality" and just made it a fantastic experience. Great service, food, and a knockout bloody mary!

I ordered a chili burger and it was pretty gross. Canned chili and the fries were bleh. However, the French toast was AMAZING!!! It was made from hullah bread and I could have it every morning... I would get big as hell but who care it's that good!! I give the French toast 4 stars the burger can go to hell.

If I wasn't starving I would have got up and left. Rhea the shift manager just stood at the bar. 5 coworkers walking about nobody ever acknowledged me or ask did I need help thank god for Kindra for the greeting when I entered the diner because that's the only greeting I got. Midnight Diner use to be one of my favorite places to come and eat but the service has really gone out the window.....
Great food with quick service even during the morning rush. Menu has that great diner variety! A must top in Queen City!!

DAMMIT. I want to like this place. Seriously, Midnight Diner, I want to like you. I want you to be my place where I go when I need to get a quick lunch, or a greasy breakfast to bring back to the office when I have a hangover. Why can't you be that diner? WHY?   I'm updating my review. Unfortunately, I can't add any more stars to it because, well, it was really a two star experience. I had previously only had lunch at this place, and if you've noticed my other review, obviously wasn't impressed. Everyone kept telling me that for a good experience, I needed to get their breakfast food. I didn't really know when that opportunity was going to happen, since I'm not a huge breakfast food fan, and I only work near here, not live near here. Then - BOOM. Heavy night of happy hour Thirsty Thursday-style, and this morning I was feeling the need for greasy breakfast. My head was saying, "Diner, this is your chance."   I ordered to go: biscuit with sausage gravy, an egg over easy, side of bacon, hash browns. Picked up my order with good timing, and as always, the staff was friendly, attentive, and awesome. Never have any complaints on my end about that. I like the people, which makes this even worse.  The worst part was the bacon. This sentence carries a lot of weight, because usually in my life I'm more prone to saying, "The best part was the bacon," and I'm talking in reference to anything. I have never not finished bacon until this moment. You could tell that underneath the overcooked, dried, burntish bits that it was good, thick, applewood smoked bacon that would have been INCREDIBLE if it had just been cooked right! I had to stop eating it not because of the taste, but because my jaw hurt from trying to chew it.   Eggs had no salt on them. I asked for over easy, but there was that transparent rawness to them that suggested more sunny side up. The hash browns were also flavorless. No seasoning/salt/pepper/nothing. Also, kind of soggy instead of crispy. I put some of the sausage gravy on them to make them a little more appealing.   Saving grace: biscuit and sausage gravy. I uh, didn't actually get around to eating them yet, but from the looks of it that scratch-made biscuit is going to be tasty, and from what I tasted of the sausage gravy, it's the best I've tried yet. Then again, this is my first restaurant sausage gravy.   I'll iterate from before: I hope that if I have to go to this place again, I'll be able to return with a more positive review. Still waiting for that good food experience.

We went on a week day, late afternoon. There were other folk scattered about but it wasn't halfway full. Service was pretty good.  Some things I didn't like: I ordered hot tea. My cup came without a saucer and no spoon. I wasn't asked if I wanted lemon. Also, the cup was pretty thick which made it hard to sip from.   I agree with the previous reviewer about the music.
