I heard cursing in at least one song and there was a family that had young children with them.  The chicken and waffles were pretty good. We'll probably go back again.

Stopped in here late night with some friends.  We all had breakfast and there were no complaints.  The food is a tad bit pricey for what you get.  We all had huge plates with a little food in the middle :).    Our waitress was very friendly and they offer alcohol.  I'm sure I'll end up here again at some point but I honestly prefer the Waffle House over the diner for breakfast food.

After an impromptu mid-week visit to Ikea with my bosses, we stopped here because it was recommended by my boss's sister. It was late night and most things were starting to close. I'm glad we went here! This is definitely a true diner. The greasy smell is overwhelming, as it should be. Ladies, just to warn you, don't come here right after getting your hair done, because it took me two washes to get the smell out of my hair. Aside from that, the portions are huge!! My bosses had overflowing plates and could hardly finish it all. Me on the other hand? Well, I would recommend you don't bother with the chicken tender meals. I ordered the biggest size they had and was pretty disappointed. The reason for this is because the tenders are really, really, really tiny. I'm serious. They were about half the size of a typical one from Zaxby's. I had probably twice as many French fries as I did chicken tenders. They didn't taste bad or anything though. My waitress also forgot to bring me the dipping sauce that was supposed to go with them. They are a little bland. Try to order something else. The French toasts and biscuits are massive. The syrup is really good. With such an expansive menu, it's almost a disservice to order something as plain as their chicken tenders and fries.

This place is always packed and there is good reason why. The food is delicious. The shrimp and grits are my favorite. Those grits are amazing, if I don't order the shrimp grits, I get the chicken and waffles and order a side of grits. I don't leave out of here without getting some grits! LOL You will regret it if you do. Anyway, the menu can be overwhelming but they literally have everything you can think of to eat. Plus a small bar. Diner food and alcohol. WHY NOT?
Favorite place love their famous shrimp and grits Nice and creamy with the right amount of spice.  Bang bang shrimp was also good.

This is my second time at Midnight Diner! I first went in July 2016! I heard it was diner food so, I wasn't expecting too much. And I think that's what makes it great, you get more than you bargain for! First let me say 'Order the grits' always! They have flavor and are so creamy. The first time I got the waffle it was good, but, tonight I got the French toast and it was great! the food is amazing! The atmosphere is regular diner atmosphere. So it's fast pace. Great for early mornings or late nights!

Horrible!  Don't waste your time or your money on this awful place.  Terrible service, dirty surfaces, food is one step above a frozen dinner...  just terrible.  We ordered what we thought would be the easist menu items, burgers & fries and breakfast = both choices were yucky.  We've been twice, thinking that we should give it a fair shake, but were highly disappointed on both occasions by the dingy, forgetful wait staff and the food that left A LOT to be desired.   We eat out every meal, every day but we will not be back to the Midnight Diner.

Probably my favorite late night spot. The crowd is eclectic, electric, and eawsome (forced that last one). I think their fried chicken is the best in town. Better than Price's. Freal. I know controversial, what will Lenny Kravitz think?  Sadly the waffles kind of suck but hey no one is perfect.  Cool story bro, get ready: I was wolfing down a club sandwich (that was pretty good) and Jared Leto say me and my fervor and said "I'll have what he's having". It feels pretty good to be Jared Leto's food muse.

So on a whim I went to Midnight Diner again since a friend was in town for the Holidays and we needed a bit of catching up. It was 10pm I was starving and am also dog-sitting so I didnt want to venture too far from home- off to the diner we went.  Our service was great- both friendly and prompt.   I ordered the Shrimp Platter $11.99 - a little pricey in my opinion but it came with fries, shrimp, and slaw.  Wow the shrimp was awesome- 5 stars for those! They were much bigger than I expected (sometimes you get the tiny ones at diners) and they were cooked just right.  The coleslaw was very fresh and homemade. They did not appear to use a mix so I really enjoyed that as well.   The fries were nothing amazing- but they weren't bad. They were standard- served hot- they are not super salty which is good and they had malt vinegar to put on them : ). They didnt give you a ton but they were heavy on the shrimp portion so I couldn't complain.   Overall I was really impressed - 4 1/2.  I think the price is the only reason for a non 5 star rating being that a diner is usually a bit cheaper but overall I would absolutely get them again!   They seem to be getting their act together in terms of actual quality of food- and that it something I can certainly appreciate.

This place is super affordable with most dishes under ~$10. The food was ok, nothing spectacular and nothing terrible. The service was a little slow when we were there, but our waitress was very nice and helpful. Overall, it's a good place to go at anytime of the day (literally, open 24/7) if you're looking for classic American dishes.

Been here plenty of times and service and food have declined. Brought a visitor from Michigan arrived and waited over 40 mins for food. Three tables by us received their food and almost finished and still didn't receive any food. Waiter advised food ticket was lost. Once food received asked for manager who basically said waiter lied and ticket was lost so only gave a $4 discount for our whole party. Waiters and other staff came over and advised that manager lied and ticket was lost. Service aside what manager puts blame on everyone else!!!! Will not be going back unless management changes. We could all tell our food was sitting out for a while.

My favorite thing here is their grits they are very creamy and always served w/o lumps so you know they are freshly made. I loved the grits so much that I ordered a second order. However, I was highly disappointed in the quality of the bacon they served here which was very hard and slightly burnt. Service was ok... but waitress was really annoying sharing way too much personal information. Won't visit this place often but when I do visit grits are going to be my go to item.

Standard diner breakfast food. Had the western omelet with hashbrowns and rye toast, and boyfriend had something called the Bubba, which was just a bunch of stuff smothered in sausage gravy. If you're into stuff like that he said it was good. I like both my hashbrowns and toast a little more done than they came out. Overall, large portion sizes, low prices and quick service. Plus there is just something about the diner atmosphere.

I had the firecracker grilled chicken sandwich and their homemade cut fries. The sandwich was bland and the bun was cheap and tasteless. A co-worker told me that they had the best fries ever. Definitely not. They were greasy and soggy. Some of the worst fries I've wasted calories on. My visit was during lunch. I doubt I'll return to this establishment.

I've only ever had the shrimp and grits. I've had it in the restaurant and to go. It's delicious ! It has some sort of zest to it and I love it ! If it wasn't cheesy and me being lactose, I'd go at least twice a week ! Worth trying for sure !

This has to be one of the coolest looking places around. Mattie's is close, but the size of the Midnight Diner eclipses it. Literally. The place is huge. Unfortunately, I think they spent way too much time on the outside of the building, making it all shiny and nice, and ran out of steam everywhere else.  For instance, parking kinda sucks. There is this smallish parking lot that can get full really fast, so finding a place to park is not easy. It can be done, but since it's not the greatest area, it can be a challenge. If you compare it to the expansive lots at Mattie's - a natural process - Mattie's wins this round.  Once you finally make your way inside, the problem is with the service. You are typically seated quickly, and promptly forgotten about. It takes forever to get anything. If you do get someone to come by, they are nice enough, but your glasses go empty and the food takes forever to come out. Once it does, it just isn't that great.  Really not worth it.
First time there today with family. All positive from friendly greeting at door, good service and very quick! The food and portions did not disappoint. ..will be back!
I used to love this place. Good and service have gone to crap!!!  So disappointed. Used to be our fav breakfast place. I guess if you're drunk or hung over it works.

Although the food is good, I have to give them a BIG THUMBS DOWN!!  The reason for this is twofold......first of all, when you walk into the Restaurant, the first thing you see is a list of RULES!!  Really......the list includes such things as "No Substitutions" (You can't even get all white meat or all dark meat when you order Fried Chicken).  So if you want something on the Menu, you are forced to order it "as is" and then order something else, if you wanted to substitute.  The Rules also state that you can't order a "Take Out Meal", then decide that you want to eat it there, or in a case I actually saw, a lady ordered take out, but when she wanted to sit down and eat her food while she waited on her ride to pick her up, she was told she had to go outside to eat!!  By the way, did I mention it was extremely humid and in excess of 95 degrees?  This restaurant is not friendly to African-American patrons!!!  The list goes on.....there must be 8 or 10 items on the "Rules List"!  I have been in Restaurants all over the world, Five Star, Diners and Dives, and I have NEVER seen RULES posted all over the place the way this place has them!  I feel like I am in High School eating in the Cafeteria again!  I loved the food, but I don't think I will ever go back because of this.   Also, two of the Waitresses got into some sort of disagreement while I was there and it had to do with something outside and the parking lot.  But it got so bad, that someone called the police and this was late morning, so alcohol was not involved.  Also, Wi-Fi only worked on one side of the Restaurant, and according to a Waiter, its been that way for several months. What a shame.......this is just a poorly run Restaurant which happens to have a good cook/chef.
I had the coconut toast and it was excellent! Waitress was really nice as well! Will definitely come back!

Yummy 24 hour a day. Always great service.  This is my go restaurant in Charlotte, NC. There are no bad menu items and nothing to avoid.  Warning because the food is delicious, plentiful, and the service is great - this diner is always jumping. People flow in and out so the wait is usually less than you expect and the time you wait is always worth the delay. I have had every meal breakfasr, lunch, dinner and after the club meal here. All wonderful, always great service.  I love the retro look it is so comfy and cozy. This diner even has a jukebox you can deposit your coins into to play your favorite tunes.  During my last visit, I enjoyed breakfast pancakes, bacon, eggs and coffee. My pancakes had pumpkin added (real pumpkin not the flavoring) and they were huge and amazing culinary treats. Did I mention that they have toasted coconut french bread toast? Great. Splendiforous! The staff never changes and that us because the owner is so sweet and engaging. Everyone checks on you not just your waiter. You will enjoy it.

Greeeeeeeeat spot.  Are here three times in one week while in Charlotte for a convention.  Friendly service.  Tammy made me feel like a BFF wanting the best for my experience.  Fried chicken was the best I had in the city!  Hated that the line was out the door on my attempt to go back on my last night...but I understand.  It's worth it!
This diner has great ambiance and amazing food! You absolutely must try the homemade chicken soup, it is delicious!!! Their biscuits and breakfast selections are also on point!!!

Went to the midnight diner after a late night! Our server was Aneasha (sorry if I messed up the spelling!) but she was awesome and made sure we stayed hydrated. The food was okay, we all order breakfast and made the best of it. I would also say a little overpriced also for the juices and a waffle.

I live just a few blocks away from Midnight Diner, so despite the reviews I read, I still had to check it out for myself. I don't know if the service and food have just really improved in the past two week, but my experience was pretty much the exact opposite of most of the reviews that I read.  We were seated immediately, even though the place was busy at 8:00 p.m. The wait staff were nice, and got us a soft drink in lightening speed while we perused the menu.  I ordered the country fried steak with mashed potatoes and green beans for sides. The country fried steak was awesome - exactly what I was hoping for. It was hand-breaded with a nice cream gravy. You could tell the mashed potatoes were handmade, and the green beans were just seasoned amazingly (I probably could have just had a giant bowl fo the green beans and been happy). My fiance got hand-breaded chicken tenders with mac and cheese, and had no complaints either.   The food came out within 10 minutes of ordering - and exactly like we ordered it. I couldn't have expected any quicker, especially since the place was pretty busy.  I really have no complaints about this place, and will be back regularly. The people that I've talked to about this place also love it - one guy I know has been there 12 times already. The only negativity that I've seen/heard has been online, and not just on this website either. But I had to give my two cents after an experience that I couldn't expect to have been any better. Quick service, good homemade food, friendly staff, and good prices - that pretty much sums it up for me.

Stopped in for a late night bite while in Charlotte with friends.  There was about a 20 min wait for table but luckily the folks in line with us were loads of fun.  The restaurant is a typical diner atmosphere with booths, neon lights, a belly up counter and...wait for it A JUKEBOX !   I had the chicken and waffles which came with fried wings & warm syrup.  This is a solid dish but honestly I have had better fried chicken (see Metro Diner).    The Shrimp & Grits were a delightful surprise.  Full of flavor and the grits were super creamy. Yummy !  They do have a full bar which was dope.  Unfortunately they were out of vanilla ice cream so I could not have a Kahlua milkshake...#Goals

Cool decor and friendly staff. I got the Midnight Special which consisted of 2 eggs any style, choice of a meat, and 2 pancakes. I got my eggs scrambled which were nice and fluffy, sausage patties were a bit overdone, and the pancakes were perfect. It took a while to get our checks and we were only checked on once by our waitress but they were swamped. Overall, would come again.

Let's just say I waited a few months to let Midnight Diner work out the supposed kinks I've been reading about, because I had a pretty tasty dining experience here! If I could give half stars, Midnight would earn a 3.5 overall.   The place: 24/7 diner that's quite snazzy looking. It's a really modern take on a vintage diner, if that makes any sense at all.   The scene: 8:30 am breakfast with a buddy on a chilly Thursday morning  The staff: Really, really friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Lisa, our server, was really laid back and offered some great menu suggestions - even noting that certain items were best for a hangover. That's important knowledge, folks.   The food: I went with a veggie egg white omelet, side of wheat toast and they let me sub fruit for grits. My buddy and I also shared a side of turkey sausage, too. My omelet was of average size (not behemoth) and stuffed with veggies and melty cheese...just what I was looking for. The toast was, er, toast! The fruit was fine but I'm not sure how fresh it really was...almost tasted like it had been refrigerated for some time. No worries though. The turkey sausage patties were flavorful and a nice accompaniment to my eggies.   The price: A touch more expensive than I expected, but then again each order comes with quite a bit of food. I believe my omelet was in the $7-$8 range but it comes with a side of grits or hashbrowns and toast. Carby carby! I will note that the turkey sausage was $2 for two small patties...a wee bit pricey but tasty nonetheless.   So, overall the food was good - a solid choice for a low key meal. I'm sure I'll be back to Midnight Diner as it's really, really close to my house and one of the few spots open all hours of the week. However, I do enjoy another local diner quite a bit more due to the freshness and overall vibe of that place.

Breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night, hangover cure- Midnight Diner covers it all.   The menu is huge. This is one of those places where if you can't find something you like here, well the problem is probably you. Their fried chicken is delicious (heads up: it does take a little longer, worth the wait). Marinated overnight, hand breaded- get it over a Belgium waffle or French Toast. Shrimp and grits (their most popular dish) is also really good. Burgers, BLT (huge), wings- you can't really go wrong with anything.   The place is not huge, so there's often a wait during peak times. They do have a full bar with beer (including local selections) and liquor. Music is always really great. I found myself dancing in my booth today while chowing down on a grilled cheese and green beans.  They are open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Warning: if you go here late night, just be careful. There have been a few incidents of crime, violence outside of the diner.

Wow!! I am in love with my husband's eagle eye (and much else) and thank him for spotting this classic diner on our way to elsewhere for lunch. Midnight Diner is amaaaazing. Shrimp and grits superb. Huge burgers! And Nikki's service exceptional! We'll be back.....Grazie mille.

Whenever I start to crave NJ diner food I find myself at the closet thing here in Charlotte,  Midnight Diner!   The chicken and waffles are my go to meal. The loaded fries are awesome after a night of drinking and the shrimp and grits are delicious. Honestly it's just good diner food!   Outside of the food the staff is friendly and makes you feel at home offering their recommendations of food and good ole southern hospitality.   If you ever find yourself hungry at an ungodly hour skip the fast food and head over to Midnight Diner.
BEST GRITS IN CHARLOTTE!!  The atmosphere is 60s diner Americana. You will never go home hungry. If you are wanting a hearty breakfast, then you should order the Bubba or chicken and waffles.

I love the Midnight Diner. It is the perfect place to go for a quick bite to eat. The shrimp and grits, chicken wings and Midnight Special are my personal favorites. The wait time is never a long unless it's after the club hours (1am or later) on the weekends. The staff is always nice and the prices are very affordable. You can never go wrong here.

Clean, no spotless!  Delicious!! Fantastic service.  Priced reasonably.  Comfortable and nostalgic.  We'll be back.  Thanks for a wonderful comfortable dining experience. I had the burger and fries and my husband had the firecracker shrimp salad and we topped it off with sharing a delicious brownie dessert.   No line at 5:00 pm Saturday but I can see that almost any other time there would be a wait.  Definately a fun place to stop in Charlotte.

Visiting North Carolina and I decided to try Midnight Diner. So I went in as I pulled up  the line was out the door so I thought if the lines out the door the food must be great so I took the time and waited in line to be seated, finally when I was seated I got the menu from Amber who was the waitress and place my order, I ordered Cornedbeef Hash ,poached eggs and and toast.  While waiting for our food i always familiarize myself with the waitress so we can have great communication.  So after Amber dropped our drinks on the floor and had to replace them , But as i for my food i received my eggs in a bowl with water still in it and toast cold and no butter .smh Unbelievable I WILL NEVER GO BACK HERE . i called to speak to manager never got one and i wish i could contact the owner.  They went to far ro say if i didnt have another form of payment since my chip didnt work they would have to get the officer outside , when i already informed them my chip was malfunctioning due to constant use and it happens to tons of people especially a person like me who travels. If i didnt have another family/ friend who had cash i wonder how far it would of went because i actually went in initially by myself and she played as if she was getting the officer absolutely horrible experience, to ad insult to it employees took smoke after order was taken and seem to be a norm . Not a good representation at all. I wish i could give a negative but i trust my review to handle that .

Great Diner Food...24/7.....Slack Service!  Been going here for a few years now.  Up until this  year... I would have given it 5 stars.  I love the food but have to say that they really need to tighten up the slack in the service.  They used to have a solid wait staff that had great energy and worked really well together.   They were entertaining and on the ball!   Now it seems like they have twice as many employees and the service is much less efficient.  Everyone moves at a glacial pace.  When you pull in, you can almost count on the majority of the wait staff being in the back parking lot on smoke break.    The visit before last, we got there at shift change.  NEVER GO AT SHIFT CHANGE!!!!  They happened to get slammed and everyone got confused and in the weeds.  After 15 minutes, I had to flag someone down just to see if we were going to have a server.   After our order was put in and the food was delivered.... Our server never came back to fill a drink....and we had to flag her down to pay the tab.    I've watched food being auctioned off to the wrong tables, drinks spilled, dinner plates dropped etc.  It gets quite comical actually. No one seems to know what's going on there anymore.  This past visit, there was a table that sat right beside us and it took 10 minutes for them to even be acknowledged.  One waitress asked the other waitress "Do you want them?" (Right in front of the customer)... They both rolled their eyes and walked off.  Eventually another server stopped to help them.    I think management needs to take a serious look at how things are being run and even possibly reclaim some of qualities that their former wait staff used to have.  All in all, I'll keep going because I like the food.... But I may really have to think hard about going because of what I know is in store for the service.   Perhaps they should can the smoke breaks.

Went here for an office lunch last week  on a cold rainy day and had a pretty good time. Our server was very nice and attentive. I tried an omelet with spinach, fruit and a biscuit. I was afraid of what kind of fruit I would get since I was ordering "fresh fruit" at a diner, but I was pleasantly surprised. It was very fresh chunks of pineapples, pears, and grapes! My omelet was very good. I also had a side of the mac and cheese but it was not what I was looking for. It was a little heavy for my taste. Others at the table had the fried chicken, mashed potatoes, pancakes, and one tried a burger. Everybody seemed very satisfied with their food. I would be interested to try this place again. The music took me back several years but it was fun to reminisce!

Love that this place is open 24hrs! It's excellent cheap food and good service. The place is tight with poor parking and it always bustling but it's worth it. Their tea is awesome as well as they're fried chicken, hot dogs & sides. I've been here multiple time and have never been disappointed with either the food or the service. I will for sure keep coming back!!

The Midnight Diner is a decent place to go for traditional diner food.  I ordered the eggwhite veggie omelette.  While they gave me cheddar cheese instead of the Swiss that I asked for, I still ate it up.  Hashbrowns a bit on the soggy side, and toast is toast.  My companions each enjoyed fresh fried chicken with macaroni and cheese.  They raved about this, and took their leftover mac to-go.  I did not leave disappointed or hungry, but not sure that I'd return unless it were in fact, midnight (or later for that matter).

Best breakfast in town. Basted eggs were perfect. Toast pre buttered. Perfect. Hash browns plentiful and perfect. Coffee was diner coffee as expected. Overall the best in town. Service? Just right. And fast. Licking your plate should be allowed.

The food was good...I ordered the coconut french toast along with their chicken wings the wings could have used a little more flavor. I also has their carrot cake it was pretty tasty and a good size portion!

The food is good. I ordered the shrimp and grits were excellent as usually. A littlehot at first but I got used it. They are usually very bust. The wait staff is friedly. My only complaint it the music is too laud which m@kes the staff talk louder the the customers talk. I can put up with that for good food.
Decent food but nothing special, decent prices.  Good place to eat late at night when youre drunk

Would only go here late at night if nothing else was open.  Nothing stands out.  Service is competent  most times, not great.  Bottom line if you have eaten at the Skyland Restaurant then you know what to expect from this place.

Ok i thought this place was ok over all. I wanted to love this joint but at least for this first visit I just liked it. As in its ok. The California burger was so so. It's described in the menu as a third pound burger. And for $9 you would expect it's gonna be a third pounder. And it was just a normal size hamburger. Like a 1.50 McDonald's sized hamburger.   Bottom line- if it's late night and other places are closed - this is a perfectly good place to eat. If it's 7pm, go to Hardys.

The BESTII kept raving about this place so now that I'm in Charlotte I'm trying it out...all I can say is that this place is AWESOME and I'm so glad she brought me here.  Everyone talks about chicken and waffles but I had the french toast with chicken and it is the best combination EVA, although I do love chicken and waffles...this is my new favorite combo.  The place has a great vibe and the people are super friendly!  If you eva in Charlotte stop by and try it for yourself, you won't be disappointed!

I couldn't even tell you what was best. The absolutely incredible menu, the tasty and very fresh food, or the amazing staff you want to bring home and make your best friends or neighbors. We went twice in 24 hours. No trip to Charlotte should miss a trip to Midnight Diner, and since they are open 24/7, you can fit them in for any meal.
Nice place with friendly staffs and very delicious food this is a great place to take your family.

Simple but delicious! There is a reason why this diner is alway busy. The food is good and very affordable. Due to it popularity, there is usually a wait when I deem to go, but it is never regretted. Friendly service,  but can be slow at times. I enjoy their breakfast dishes. The grits are the best in town, and the French Toast is thick cut and sweet. I have never had a bad meal.  Great to go with friends and family, or just to people watch at the wee hours of the morning. Not good for a quick bite. During busy hours there will be a wait for seating, your server, food and your check. I still think it's worth it!

This little diner has a special place in my heart. The staff is always so welcoming and friendly and the breakfast here always hits the spot. I walk past this diner every morning when I head to work and the wonderful smell of waffles make the morning walks in the cold a little less harsh.   And in case I forgot to mention, the breakfast is amazing!!

OK, I understand this will likely start a chicken Fatwa in the Queen City; but, I STRONGLY believe the MidNight Diner Fried Chicken FAR SURPASSES Price's.  Don't get me wrong, until recently I too was a Price's true believer. . .Midnight is better  It's clearly brined, given a gentle salt H2O soak (and possibly buttermilk) and hand tossed.  The oil is peanut.  It's fresh and not over-used.  The crust is lightly peppery, the mashed potatoes are homemade with JUST the right amount of pleasing potato chunks and you have a choice of classic southern white gravy or brown love.    Again, dig Price's for a quick in-and-out greasy adventure.  Nirvana is achieved at Midnight.  Couple lunch with a hand made strawberry shake.  AHHHH.    My apologies to many in the Charlotte Metro Region.  Don't believe me, go there now.  Oh, that's another plus, to wit:  MidNight is open 24/7, 355 days a year.  (Closed Christmas.)  No, I'm not an owner, a friend of an owner or stockholder.  Just DIG their chicken.

You only get one chance to make a first impression. The Midnight Diner aced it, knocked it out of the park, dropped the mike, & crushed it. I went to this location on ACC weekend 12/2/17. Parking was non-existent. I could have chosen to leave but I actually double parked and waited for someone to leave. Success! I was seated immediately once I entered. I came in with brunch in mind, but when I heard the table next to me ordering "collard greens" I quickly shifted plans. I ordered the 1/4 White Chicken Dinner with 2 sides and a biscuit. (Macaroni & Cheese, and collards). While passing the desert case I saw 1 single piece of Chocolate-Chocolate Cahke and ordered it to go on the spot. The food is EXCELLENT. if you're not careful you just might accidentally bite your fingers. I'll definitely return and can't wait to sample breakfast!

Hands down, the BEST shrimp and grits that I've had in my ENTIRE life!! I know, it sounds a bit extra, but trust me on this! I've heard a number of people tell me how good they are but questioned whether or not any of their dishes could be better than the signature chicken and waffles. We came in around 8:30p and were seated immediately. Our waiter was Leon and he was very friendly and attentive. Our food came out in a timely manner and was cooked to perfection. Of course I ordered the shrimp and grits, but my husband order fried fish and a side of grits. Everything tasted AMAZING!! I was more than pleased with our entire experience and would definitely recommend it! The bathrooms were clean and well kept as well. We will definitely be back soon!

I arrived in Charlotte around 9:30pm on a Wednesday night. I was starving and looking for a place open late around South End, which seemed deserted. I checked Yelp and found that most places were going to close in 30 minutes. I definitely wasn't in "Kansas" (read: Los Angeles) anymore.  The only place open this late on a weekday was Midnight Diner. And it was good.   When I came in I had a feeling I was going to get a great meal. The place was loud, bright and packed with a lot of diners. They were playing music from the 50's in the background. The ambiance was great.  I got the Shrimp and Grits which came out to only $11.90 (tax included). This was served piping hot and fresh. The grits were beautifully creamy and smothered in a creamy Cajun sauce that was savory and spicy. The shrimp were also cooked perfectly.   I LOVED the biscuit. It was brushed with melted butter so it had a beautiful glaze on it already. The biscuit itself was heavenly and flaky - it tasted like they just took it out of the oven and put it on the plate.  A perfect first meal for introducing me to Charlotte.

Came here on a Wednesday night for a celebratory dinner with a friend (but I've been here a million times). We sat at the bar and we were promptly greeted and had our order taken. I ordered the 1/2 French toast, an egg and the cheese grits. My friend ordered the same but with bacon instead of grits. Our waitress was warm and friendly and the other waitresses and waiters chatted us up too.   I don't know if it was all of the chatting and laughing but our food came out in a flash. Everything was hot and delicious. Now anyone can cook an egg but perfectly executed grits and French toast are hard to find.   The french toast was crisp on the outside and fluffy inside with the right balance of egg and milk and cinnamon. The grits were creamy at the cheese was already melting when they arrived which means they were hot and fresh.   The price wasn't bad for all of the food we ordered $13.77 for my half.  As always, Midnight didn't disappoint. Wish I made it here more often. Can't wait to come back.

My bf went there for lunch and had chicken and waffle. Then he couldn't stop talking about it for hours. So eventually we went there at 1:30 in the morning on a Friday night. This place was packed and the atmosphere was fun with 90s & 00s music playing. We ordered half fried chicken and the coconut French toast. OMG hands down the best fried chicken and French toast I've ever had. We are thinking about going back for Saturday brunch already...

Standard diner eats, it served its purpose. Staff was very friendly , I got the steak and eggs with hash browns and babe got the meat lovers omelette , I didn't take pics bc it wasn't photo worthy  , not my first choice for yummy breakfast spots in Charlotte but like I said it got the job done .

Ok, there are lots of reviews and photos for Midnight Diner, so I'll keep mine straightforward.  We ventured here on a weekend morning for breakfast.  Don't be put off by the parking signs - on weekends, parking is free.   Even on a Saturday, we were seated very fast.  Service is very matter-of-fact and efficient, but not Charlotte-friendly.  We liked their coffee, since it's stronger than most diner coffee.  And our food came out very fast.  But here's where it gets really good...the food!  I had The Bubba, an open-faced sausage gravy biscuit with scrambled eggs (including cheddar, yes!), and their creamy grits.  I thought Flying Biscuit's grits were the best until I tried Midnight Diner's.  I don't know, it's a toss-up now between the two.  And the eggs and biscuit/gravy were just perfect.    My husband had their corned beef hash slam.  He gets this dish a lot, and thought Midnight Diner's was the best yet.    We have returned a few times, and my husband always gets their corned beef (still the best he's had), but I've tried other items, such as the standard eggs with bacon, biscuit, yadda yadda.  Their hash browns and grits are both phenomenal.  Once you've tried both, try just picking one of them!  I always get both.  :)
Love this place. Excellent food, great crew, great atmosphere, chicken and waffles in Charlotte. May they never close.

This is hands down the best place to grab a late night bite in Charlotte! I had three people with me and even though there was a line out the door we were seated in about 15 minutes. It was more than worth the wait. The service was great but, the food was even better. Try the fried chicken with Mac n cheese or the blue cheese chicken sandwich and you will not be disappointed!

This was an excellent recommendation. The food was amazing!! We ordered chicken ad waffles, the corn beef and hash slam, and TWO bubba platters.  In the realm of artery clogging goodness, this diner was on point.  The sausage gravy was phenomenal, as well as the hash. The waffles were a perfect melt in your mouth density.  Also notable, the juice actually comes in a huge glass and it is not over priced.  Would definitely come back.

While I used to enjoy the food and I've been a customer since they first opened I will never go here again and it's sad it was a family tradition however tonight the messed up my order gave me 50% of the food and customer service is at its worse ... Check your order to the letter as in open your burger etc even if they tell you it's all there open every container because even when they admit oh yeah you should have had another bag they won't do anything to rectify the situation ... I can no longer go to what used to be a favorite Charlotte spot... What happened to customer service ?

I will tell you rarely do I ever say that I liked everything at a restaurant.  I have to say the meal I had was fantastic.  I love the ambiance just like an old 50s diner ya know.  The service was very good.  We went at like 930 at night it wasn't line out the door busy yet.  when we left it was. Now the meal oh my goodness.. PHENOMENAL ONION RINGS which I thought were the best in the city but my friend told me they werent even the best in the city. I'll do a review for that place in a minute. The fried chickens was absolutely the best fried chicken I had every had, it was crispy outside and cooked perfect inside.  The Mac and Cheese reminded me of my mom's mac and cheese awesome, broccoli was well cooked, cole slaw was out of this world and the banana pudding of my goodness,, words dont' do it any justice.  Run to this place get there quickly before the crowds barrage the front door. Great Great place

As far as breakfast goes in the uptown south end of Charlotte this is definitely a good place to visit.  I am new to Charlotte and wanted to try something not a chain so we came here.  Had the French toast and wings.  Thick French toast and solid wings.  Service was fine.  Pretty solid diner.

The shrimp and grits is so good my mouth is watering typing this. My husband and I always order it like an appetizer to share. Everything here is great. We love the burgers and the fried chicken is a must. The French toast is super thick and fluffy. Afforable, filling, delicious soul food. Go! You won't regret it.

It was my first night in Charlotte, it was late but I was hungry. I decided to Yelp a restaurant in the area and the Midnight Dinner came up at the top of the search. So I decided to give it a try.   Even though it was late the restaurant was packed to capacity by people who were dining in and people who ordered to go. The restaurant is kind of small but it was clean and I was comfortable. This must be the spot after the club on Saturday nights. There was a sign on the door that said no weapons past this point which was different for me because I had never seen that before. They also had an armed police officer inside who was very friendly with the customers.  I ordered chicken wings and my daughter ordered shrimp and grits. I had to send my chicken back because they were not cooked hard enough for me. The waitress was extremely nice. She took my plate back without an attitude. It took a while for her to bring me another plate of wings but the second time the wings were cooked just right. I nibbled on my daughter's delicious shrimp and grits until my wings returned so I was just fine. But my daughter wasn't happy because I was eating all her food..oops.   Although everything tasted delicious and I prefer eating at the restaurant, I will be calling ahead next time to order my food to go.

I live very close by and have for eight months. Not sure why today was my first time eating at The Diner, but it was pretty delicious. My friend and I both had The Bubba which was a beautiful combination of eggs, biscuit and gravy (I got my gravy on the side), hash browns and bacon. I enjoyed every single bite. I'm sure you're wondering "why only three stars?"  Well, the place was pretty empty given that we went on a Tuesday morning, they're open 24/7 so understandably they were doing some cleaning while the place was empty. One of the gentlemen was moving some booths, cleaning around the seats and whatnot and announced out loud there was vomit under one of the seats close by our table. Now, I can't say I'm surprised given that many people probably visit after a night out when they need greasy diner food, but did I want to know this at 7am while I was enjoying my breakfast... NO. Thinking about it now makes me gag a little. Plus I find it disgusting that they just now discovered it.

Follow-up on the challah french toast:   Visited on 10/5 (see review that date) and said I would go back for the french toast. No disappointment on that one!!!!  Oh, my: .the syrup just drained into the Mackinaw City crunch and powdered sugar covered delight composed of thick, generous pieces of lightly egg battered challah. What a delight, bite by delicious bite!!!!   Need I say more???
Another amazing breakfast place in Charlotte! We had to wait for a table for a long time because we went on a Sunday morning, but it was well worth it! The food was excellent!

Beware!!!  If you pay with cash you may get jipped.   This was my first time coming to this diner and the server (Angel) kept my change. My total came up to $27.23.  I gave the server $40 cash. When he returns with my change he only gave me $2 change. I was in a hurry to get back to work and didn't notice the difference. I left him an additional $4  on the table and left. When I got close to work it dawned on me that the server owed me $12 in change, not $2.  I called back to the restaurant and spoke to the manager (Kia) who explained that there's no way for them to track cash payments. I really hope that it's not commonplace for their servers to swindle patrons out of money.  The manager made no attempt to make this right for me. I was only left with the possibility that I may get a call back from the General Manager.  It's only $10, but it's my $10.  It doesn't matter if the food was good or if the atmosphere was nice, they stole from me. This restaurant will never get my business again.  I'm so disappointed.

Took my wife there for the 1st time with some friends. Party of 4 on Saturday night and we waited about 15 minutes, which is pretty good considering how busy they were. Staff was friendly. It did take about 10 minutes for anyone to come by and take our drink orders but bro, its a diner, come on, its busy, I was stoned anyway and was busy talking with my friends, so I didn't mind. I ordered the fish dinner which wasn't impressive but was just ok. I ended up eating my wife's other half of her Philly cheese steak later that night and it was delicious! My friends got chicken wings and waffles and said they were excellent. The place is a throwback diner with lots of rock n roll memorabilia on the walls.I will definitely be coming back soon and bring friends.

This is not my favorite place.  I think the food is basic and the scene is overrated for sure.  However, my mom loves it here.  It's one of her favorite places, so I guess I will put up with it every once in awhile.    It's open late, they serve alcohol, play loud music...ok.  The service is hit or miss and honestly is usually crappy.  You will get rude service here before good service. Prices are ok, some menu items are decent.    Just not my top pick.  In fact, I wouldn't ever pick on my own anyway.
Very good food...reasonable price.....great location.....outstanding atmosphere...Excellent staff!!!

I have been here roughly half a dozen times and my experiences have been consistently good.  I have had everything from eggs and grits to hamburgers and apple pie and it is all delicious.  You just can't go wrong here.  Aside from the food, I love the fact that this is a 50's throwback diner.  You would think it has been around for years but in fact it is pretty new.  Despite it being a fairly recent addition to Charlotte, this diner has character that usually comes with age and lends itself as a great haunt for all times of day and night.  A quick tip: Saturday and Sunday get very busy so either be prepared to wait or time your arrival (especially on Sunday - be mindful as to when church services get out).
Best Diner in Charlotte! I always get the chicken tender appetizer or French toast. Delicious!

What can i say but DAYUM!!!!! this food is off the chain. I had the Big Boy breakfast. Nice biscuits with homemade sausage gravy, a slab of country ham, and some buttermilk cheese grits. Needless to say I made a Happy Plate. If ever in the Charlotte area please stop by. Open 24/7 for the party people.
The shrimp and grits was amazing! The Grits was nice and creamy. The shrimp was cooked just right with sauteed vegetables! Served with a light fluffy biscuit! It was absolutely delicious!

i had been hearing about this place for a long time and finally decided to go. what a mistake! rude staff, my order was wrong and it was more of a problem to correct it. i will never, patronize this business again a waste of $45!

I really like this place. It's an ode to a traditional 50's diner, music and all.   The food. It's diner food. No frills, nothing fancy, but good food. And the portions are large. Their sausage gravy is probably the best in the area, I always order it on the side.   Coming from the north, I did expect a "diner" experience, meaning you order food and it's out in an unimaginably quick time. Not the case here, but that's not a qualm, just something I didn't know of when I went here the first time.   Parking- their lot is small, but there's a big pay lot behind the diner and there are spots (free) that are labeled for the Midnight Diner.   Also, expect a wait on weekend breakfasts and late night. Late night...it gets crazy inside. Overall, it's definitely worth a stop if you're in the South End area.
The Bubba!!! Hand's down my favorite place to eat breakfast in the QC. Service is great fast and it's cheap!

Food is good, there is always a wait.   I came here with my daughter on a Sunday morning. My three year old had to go to the bathroom, so I told my server that we were going but not done eating. When we went back to the table they had cleared all of our food. My three year old's meal was not even half way finished & my meal was about half way. When the server saw us come back she said thought we left. They politely sat us at a different table and said they would remake our meals, however I told them I didn't want them to remake mine but my daughter was still hungry so hers could be remade. Well it took an additional 30 - 40 minutes to get our new food, and when I got the check they only took off half the price of my sandwich because I had eaten half prior to them taking it. Personally, I found this to be extremely unprofessional, and not customer friendly.

This is my first day in NC and I'm hooked already!! Very reasonable prices, quick and friendly service, and AMAZING food!!!!!!. A friend recommended this to me when I asked where the nearest Waffle House was. She swore I wouldn't be disappointed, and boy was she right! I had the shrimp and grits which were far better than I could've imagined!! I've had shrimp and grits before but nothing like this. My son had the most tender chicken strips I've ever tasted, and everything was hot and fresh as well. Not a big fan of the macaroni but I'll definitely be back.
Arrived. I had the shrimp and grits . Seasoned so good . Grits was creamy. Waitress seem a little goofy but all and all I'll come back decor needs an upgrade music to loud for my taste .

This place NEVER LETS ME DOWN!! I currently live in Atlanta, GA but every single time I come home (Charlotte) I make it my business to come here for breakfast, brunch or dinner! I was recently in Charlotte this past weekend, so I met up with a friend for brunch on sunday. We were able to sit at the bar immediately so that was a plus because there was about a 20 minute wait for a booth. I got the fish and grits (My fave) with a side of hash browns, and one egg. It took maybe 15 minutes for everything to come out. The food was simply amazing, fish was seasoned and fried perfectly. The grits were PERFECT, so perfect that I did not need to add anything to them. Our waitress was a little slow with responding, but I understand she was pretty busy. All in all I HIGHLY suggest anyone in the Charlotte area try this place at least once!

Listen Mid night dinner is my go to place for breakfast lunch or dinner of after the club any time I'm getting those shrimp and grits. My brother loved the chicken and waffle and my BFF ordered fried fish that I almost ate all of her food and I clearly had my own plate. I love this place it can get packed after midnight they serve alcohol at the bar but every one is really there for  the food. I mean I seriously wrote dinners and drive in about this place because the grits are so damn good I want to know the recipe. If your in Charlotte come to uptown and check them out you wont be disappointed.

First time dining at the Midnight Diner and it was freakin awesome! Jane the waitress was amazing!   I ordered the steak and eggs with creamy grits...the grits was delicious. Although my steak had to be recooked the food was still great.   I dined in  on a Friday morning the place was pretty packed but my waitresses made it seem empty with how attentive she was.  Her food recommendations were spot on...I have found my new favorite eatery in Charlotte!

Went here for the first time today and wasn't impressed. Based solely on what my wife and I had I have a hard time believing some of the stuff on the menu.   The challah bread in my French toast seemed homemade but, the syrup absolutely was not real maple syrup. For what were supposed to be never frozen hand breaded chicken tenders on my wife's salad they did a remarkable job of looking and tasting like something frozen from Sysco.  The A/C seemed like it was being piped in from the 7th circle of hell, the waitress didn't know the menu, didn't seem concerned that my wife only ate 3 bites of her food and instead of asking if something was wrong just offered a box, etc... The decor is cool but that's about the only positive thing I can say. We won't be going back.

I was highly disappointed with this establishment. I was so excited to try the food here. That atmosphere was pretty cool walking in as well. But things turned around very quickly. First our waitress took our order and it took an HOUR for the food to come out. I ordered steak and eggs. All of my food was lukewarm....barely. Right after we received our food, the waitress decided to come right back over to ask about the check (we literally just started eating). Then she comes over after a couple of minutes again and asks to take my friend's empty plate if he was finished....but it still had food on it. So he scraped the food onto another plate to get her out of our face. When we paid for the food, we have her exact change and she asked if we wanted change back Lol. I can't make this up. I'm sure they over charged us as well. My friend got the chicken and waffles with an extra side of 2 eggs. We were billed $6.98 for a two egg breakfast. Needless to say, I will not be revisiting this location.

If it looks like a diner, smells like a diner, has slippery floors and drunk people like diner...its just a diner. I will say, the chicken and waffles were delicious as was the shrimp half of the shrimp and grits. A word of advice...leave your party about an hour early to avoid the line that will run outside and down the block after the clubs close.

So if your use to going to Waffle Houses and like them... You will like this.  The diner is styled after the 60's or so everyone is overly friendly and the food is good. Though this is a greasy spoon. I am sure this is a really nice place to hit after your night uptown in the bars. My breakfast was just ok. SORRY.    Yea I would go back for  quick breakfast.  There is other available parking near the diner that is free just follow the signs or the folks there are kind enough to help you.   yea... This place is not dog friendly.

I have been here a few times and really enjoyed my meals here on every occasion.  The coconut French toast is particularly outstanding and the waitstaff is extremely friendly as well.  If you're looking for a diner in Charlotte, look no further!

Jennifer was our server and she's the bomb! I ordered the Bubba and it was great. My wife ordered the chicken tenders and thought they were the best! All the time we were there. there was an out the door line. Will definately be back for more! BY thje way....the coffee was not burned!

I've visited Midnight Diner 3 times since I've moved to Charlotte. Only got one picture of one of my meals.   Chicken and waffles were out of this world good. Hot wings and onion rings were CRAZY GOOD and spicy just like I like them. The shrimp and grits meal was ok the biscuit was better than the actual shrimp and grits.   Server was extremely nice and helpful on all three occasions never had a problem. Nice environment for anyone of any age. Definitely recommended to anyone in Charlotte

This is one of my favorite breakfast places- but definitely be ready to eat! This is the opposite of a light meal. Midnight diner has great, southern inspired dishes and classic 50s diner atmosphere. Be ready to wait a little because this place is popular!  My favorite thing to get is the Bubba: an open faced biscuit with scrambled eggs, cheese, and sausage gravy on top. It comes with your choice of meat and hash browns, grits or fruit. Wowee- definitely allow time for a nap after this meal!  The chicken and waffles are also delicious and a staple at the Midnight Diner. My take is,  if you go for the traditional breakfast staples you will not be disappointed!

Every time the line is out the door and it moves kind of slow because people don't like to get up and leave right away. It is a good late night spot and their desserts are always good. A little noisy though.
The shrimp and grits were awesome! The staff was very friendly and attentive! I will definitely be coming back during my next visit to Charlotte.

Holly, our waitress, recommended the Carolina Burger...it was delicious!!! The service was fast and the food was amazing. I can't wait to come back to try the chicken & waffles and visit our girl Shelly, the hostess with the mostest! She was so friendly and welcoming! I highly recommend this to anyone visiting Charlotte.

The Midnight Diner really attracts the late night crew (post-bar) and the brunch crew looking for diner food on the weekends. Expect a wait if coming to the diner late on a weekend night or around lunchtime on a weekend day. It is not uncommon for the line to be outside and down the block.  The diner has a small parking lot, but a lot of the patrons walk to the diner. The food is typical diner food, and it's reasonably priced. If you are looking for greasy diner food and you don't mind waiting, this is your spot! If you're looking for a more upscale breakfast meal, there are awesome brunch options nearby in Charlotte - Tupelo Honey, Toast, Leroy Fox, and the list goes on.

Food is the only reason I give this place a star...food was good....service on the other hand is the reason I will never return to this diner. It was my first time there and definitely my last. My server was the dark skinned black lady, tall with long braided hair....Jesus Christ if she wasn't the rudest server I've ever met...I work with pretty terrible servers but she was not afraid to just be blunt and rude and mean. She tried making us feel stupid and patronized us the entire time...we came in at 4am so maybe she was just aggravated with her job but Jesus you can't speak to people the way u did to us...will never come back
I ate the Carolina burger and it was the BOMB! Great service too. Our server was Sonny. Also ordered the collard greens, those were good too.
Get the coconut French toast with chicken wings...out of this world good. I still crave it
Yummmmy..... The shrimp and grits are on point.  The fried chicken does not disappoint! For french toast, this is the joint.
Late night food, amazing service and adult beverages too!  Outstanding experience!  Must try!

Fried chicken was so good; tender and juicy. Definitely a good portion too. I had the Mac & cheese and fries as my sides and get this you get a buttery fluffy yummy biscuit. I went on a Saturday well after midnight so naturally it was packed. But here's a tip: call ahead and order. Full disclosure though, you may have to call 2 or 3 times to get through but oh so worth it. Once you've placed your order over the phone you're able to "skip" the line to go pay for your food at the register. Easy peasy. The cashier was very nice and even personally delivered my food to me once it was ready. The officer who was monitoring was nice too. It was very packed but it's good cheap food so go figure.
The Shrimp and grits was some of the best I have ever had. The sauce is just the right mix of creamy and spicy. Exceptional.

If you like the Waffle House, you'll love the Midnight Diner! I had some of the best fried chicken I've ever had. Simply amazing. I had chicken and waffles. I was a little disappointed in the waffles, they were a little dense. It made it seem like it wasn't cooked all the way. The fish dinner was incredible. It was light and battered just right.   Now, this is a great place to people watch on a Friday or  Saturday night. I saw some very entertaining things. The 21st century iTunes Jukebox is great. They jammed some serious old school and new school music. It was a fun dining experience.

I'm from Louisiana, New Orleans to be specific. I've eaten in places all over this country. I've been a fan of shrimp and grits ever since I heard it in a rap song years ago, but every time I've tried it I was disappointed. Now I can stop looking for a place to get it. Midnight diners' shrimp and grit are what I imagined SNG should taste like and more. They have the solution!
Stellar service great hours and solid food. Prices are all reasonable too. Try the fried chicken and coconut French toast.

Great diner food!  Great atmosphere!  Friendly staff!  I've been there a couple of times and have gotten the BLT, fried chicken, and breakfast sandwiches. It's typical diner food, so be prepared to get your food a little greasy but with popping flavors. It is the best diner food that I've had in Charlotte!

I don't think I have ever had a bad meal. Everything on the menu is good. But the grits, I have never tasted grits so good in my life. I usually order Shrimp and grits (best I've ever had), but this visit I decided on chicken and French Toast and again Midnight didn't disappoint. The only improvement is the sweet tea, they have to do better. My last visit the sweet tea was brewed too long and had a bitter taste, no amount of sugar could tame. I would recommend Midnight diner to anyone.

First, let me say that I DO like this place. It's been said by someone that it's hard to mess up breakfast and, well, Midnight Diner prepares what I would call a decent breakfast. I think Midnight Diner is more about the cool, funky diner atmosphere and at any given hour (open 24 hours a day except for Christmas) contains all walks of life - which I love. We waited for a table for a bit and were seated in a plush red booth. I ordered an omelet and your standard breakfast fare. Again, decent. Nothing to write home about but certainly - good.  That day there were random tables of strangers arguing back and forth about the best NFL teams which was mildly interesting/annoying. Oddly enough, the Panthers were not being discussed. Anyway, I digress...   This place is an interesting and fun choice when you are in the mood to hang out in a lively diner on the fringe of Uptown Charlotte.

Wonderful diner with nice ambience. Short wait times for great diner food. The shrimp and grits were fabulous, get it with a biscuit. The French Toast is better thank expected and thw fried chicken is golden and succulent. The servers are quirky but hospitable. Next time I'm in Charlotte,  I will visit again.

Breakfast and just took the "Special " of eggs , grits & biscuit.  They know how to PROPERLY Cook grits . .salt in cooking water.  Great service.  2 for under $12, & lots of fresh,  hot coffee.  Definitely worth a return visit
Waitress was a total sweetheart. Ended up getting my food to go, will eat it at work later today... Review to be continued.

Foods good. Typical diner style food, at diner style expectations. The line gets really long if you're visiting at night during the weekend. I recommend trying the bubba. Really filling, really tasty, and only ten bucks. Enjoy!
Great shrimp n grits. Nice down-home diner feel. This will bless your life. If you're in Charlotte, I suggest you stop in. Dooo iiiittt!

Solid, but nothing to write home about.  I had been craving a waffle all day and was disappointed with the waffle here, as it was really nothing better than what I could make at home with a waffle iron.  Also, the menu stated that it was supposed to come with whipped butter, and it did not.  I had to use the little packets of imitation butter and it just wasn't the same.  The corned beef hash, on the other hand, was excellent.  My husband had fried chicken, which was also excellent.  Service was adequate, but again, nothing to write home about.  They seemed to have about ten servers walking around looking frantic... somehow overstaffed but at the same time not delivering good service.  It was strange.  I will be back, however.  I want to try to desserts and something other than the waffle.

Absolutely the best fried chicken I have ever had!  So hot, crispy and fresh!  The fries were delicious.  I walked through the restaurant and was eyeing everyone elses food.  It all looked fantastic.  I can't wait to go back and try it all.  But I won't try it all, I'm always going to get the chicken.  It was that good!

Yeah so I needed my fat pants for breakfast after eating at Midnight diner! I couldn't resist and ordered the Bubba, which is biscuits covered with scrambled eggs and cheese, and then covered in sausage gravy...shut the front door it was good!!!  You know it's good when you need a nap after breakfast.  The staff said their slogan should be "Eat here for food comas!"  I agree.  My husband ordered the chicken and waffles with no complaints.  This uptown gem is a must for breakfast even if not staying uptown overnight.  Oh and it was packed at 9am on a Sunday (most places don't get busy until 10).

Went there on a Sunday evening, shortly after 9pm after leaving The Liberty because their kitchen was closed (at 9pm!).  I'm glad this place is open 24/7, but it either needs to have better food or be cheaper. I got an egg and cheese biscuit with a side of hashbrowns. This ended up being about $5. The biscuit tasted like it was previously frozen and had a hint of plastic. Eggs were pretty rubbery. Hashbrowns were pretty good. My husband got a peanut butter and jelly sandwich for $4.99, assuming it came with fries as the menu seemed to indicate that all the sandwiches came with fries, but alas no. It was $5 for a pb&j with no fries. Really?  The service was ok. Our server just brought our food and never came back but fortunately another server did refill our drinks.
Everything you want in a diner and more! The food, service and aptmosphere were better than expected. Gotta love the Bubba Breakfast!

Onion rings were excellent and full of flavor. The big fish sandwich was the best fish sandwich I've had in years. Prices are great as well.   The only complaints (which warrants a 3 star instead of a 4 star review) the waitress told us no substitutions (we wanted a different side which was the same in price) and the bathroom and floors were dirty.

Went here for a late breakfast with the husband.  This place is chrome-shiny and  appears larger on the inside than on the outside.  Our server was abrupt, almost military-like, but she was on it with the service.  My man got the coconut French toast.  He liked the topping, but wished that it was made with thinner bread than the challah.  He also longed for real maple syrup (I have spoiled him).  I ordered the veggie omelet, hash browns and biscuit.  The biscuit was light and fluffy, and the omelet and hash browns were decent.  Hard to mess up eggs, but also difficult to make an omelet stand out.   I like the vintage styled memorabilia on the wall.  The booth where we sat featured "I Love Lucy" and the Rat Pack.  Motown played on the juke box, which added to the retro charm. At the end of our meal, our no nonsense server gave us a sweet, little smile.  That was nice.

I love this place and never have a complaint when I visit. I've both dined in and ordered to go. The staff is friendly and very helpful. There's an extensive menu but I always go with the shrimp and grits which is my personal favorite. Good portion sizes and even better pricing. There's a parking lot in the back and plenty of seating. It gets crowded on the weekend and there can be a wait.
great kind service and atmosphere. awesome chicken sliders and an even better strawberry milkshake. yummy meal for only $7-$8. i'm so glad its so close!

I love a good diner! There are quintessential elements to a good diner that evoke that sense of nostalgia including vinyl bar stools, row of booths, open kitchen where you can see and hear food sizzling on the grill, delicious & cheap food, and bottomless cups of coffee. Add a friendly waitress that calls you Hon and you've got it all!  Diner food is  everyday comfort food and if it's done well then you're reminded of home. Well, Midnight Diner does it well! The outside of this diner is beautiful! There is Chrome Chrome and more Chrome! The inside of the diner is clean and visually stimulating with plenty of places to sit. You can sit at the counter in one of the vinyl stools or at one of the many booths.   They have a pretty extensive menu with so many good options. 9 pages of options to be exact! They even have a small selection of liquors and beer.  We ordered bacon, scrambled eggs, and toast with a side of fruit and the Shrimp and Grits. The first order was good but the star was the Shrimp and Grits. At the base of this dish are the creamiest grits that I have eaten in a long, long time! Like my Granny's! It's topped off with shrimp, pan sauteed vegetables, and a creamy homemade creole sauce.  The portion was ample and I was completely full by the time I was done. I needed a nap! This dish was delicious from the first to the last bite! Karla, our waitress, was attentive and really sweet!  The other staff were friendly and had a positive attitude despite having to work on Thanksgiving. I was a happy camper and plan on returning to this diner again!

There honestly isn't much to say that already hasn't been stated. Staff was friendly and attentive. The restaurant is on the tight side inside but it was very clean.  I got shrimp and grits and they were delicious. Definitely more than worth the $9.99 price.   I will definitely be returning to try out some of the other food options.

Save your money, buying food here is like throwing it in the trash.  Went in to pick up some takeout, all the waitresses were arguing with each other for ten minutes before they asked me if I needed help, mind you I was standing at the front door. When they look at my order they tell me they're out of everything  pretty much, no chocolate shakes, so I got a rotten milk vanilla one,  no Mac n cheese, so I got these disgusting blob they called mashed potatoes.  The grilled cheese sandwich had cardboard for bread and the cheese was cold. The. The BLT was just as disgusting. They lost my business for sure, oh yeah, and make sure you take plenty of change for the 5-10 homeless people hanging out in the parking lot

MIDNIGHT SPECIAL!! The food here is amazing no matter the time of day. And dem GRITS is uh-maze-N. If you've enjoyed the breakfast buffet at Uptown Cabaret after a night out, then you'll love this place because it's the SAME FOOD!  Fun fact.

I love this place. The shrimp & grits are to die for.  So creamy and delicious. The fried chicken is good also. It's the perfect place after a night out on the town or breakfast.  You can eat, drink and chill in a very casual downhome place. Good food, Good Fun, Good service.

Seriously amazing.  Two of us went for a late breakfast on a Saturday. Attentive, cheerful waitress who helped us order in a way that would be cheaper for us.  I've only been here once and only ordered 3 items so I can't vouch for consistency BUT I can say that everyone on the planet should try their fried chicken wings with the coconut French toast. WOWWWW. The French toast was not super sweet like you'd expect, so syrup on top of those with the wings was perfection. I'm a big roscoes chicken and waffles fan and was worried this wouldn't meet my expectations lol. It was different but just as good. Also I've never had such buttery home fries in my life. Everyone go here right now!!!

Wow. This diner is unbelievably great! Came in town for weekend and brought 3 kids. There was a long line outside but they move people thru so it was only a 15 minute wait.  Well worth it so stick around!  I was starving so I had the Midnight Special. It was huge and delicious.  2 kids had waffles and chicken. They loved chicken so much we ordered more chicken.  Pancakes were also ordered and fluffy.  The staff is on it and place clean and dinerlicious!  We will be back!!
This was a nice reminder of NYC. The prices are affordable. The service was great. The food was good. It was family and date friendly. I will definitely come again.

This place is amazing! It is so worth the wait! Try the salads - they are surprisingly huge and delicious! Yes girls, there is a way to eat semi-healthy even at a diner! Make you and your man happy, amen!

If Southerners know one thing, it's breakfast.  In particular, you'd be hard pressed to find better biscuits anywhere besides the Deep South.    Midnight Diner looks like a diner you'd find somewhere along a highway in the northeast, but it's in basically downtown Charlotte.  I met some friends here for breakfast and loved my breakfast of a biscuit with two perfectly fried chicken tenders and a slice of cheddar cheese as well as the hash browns.  The hash browns were ideal in their simplicity of shredded potatoes.    And like many of my other Charlotte dining experiences, the service and value for the money couldn't be beat.    One of the best 24 hour dining options out there!
Nice shrimp and grits w a fluffy biscuit was a great way to start my weekend ! The music here is old school and customer service is good.

Uptown Charlotte's 24 hour diner,  it's a traditional one. Right down to the chrome all over the outside. Nicely placed with a large parking lot. Very close to the stadium, so expect it to be filled with fans wearing their Black, Blue and Silver on game days. Booths and a few tables inside.  Traditional diner menu with burgers and eggs and things. I did see other people with waffles and wings, but it was actually breakfast time when I was here. I chose to go with the "Uptown" which is two eggs and hash browns with a waffle. Eggs were cooked perfectly, the hash browns were both crunchy and soft. The waffle, however, was beyond desciption. Crispy on the outside, flully inside, it was still nice and hot to melt the butter and it soaked up the hot syrup. Excellent flavor.  Service was great. My waitress refilled my coffee often and cleared plates as I emptied them.  Free wifi, though no power outlets that I could see.

Went in for a take out order for 3 people. Waited at the bar for it. The waitress handed me two bags and I assumed everything was in there so I didn't check. Got home and realized I was missing my order (shrimp and grits). I was not going to drive back so I called and she admitted the kitchen forgot it so she said she'd refund me the money back to my card which I thought was great. However, never received a refund so I guess she lied? And now that I try to call, phone doesn't even ring. Terrible. Basically they charged me for shrimp and grits that I never got.. I would say I got robbed.

Hmmm, finally went to Midnight Diner.  We had breakfast for lunch.  The service was excellent and the food even better.  A big plate of home fries, eggs, bacon, and two great big flapjacks!  I am glad I was sharing.  The ambiance is pretty nice with the colorful and there was a nice crowd in the diner at around 1:30 pm.  All of the plates I saw coming out were piled high - good to know if you're hungry.  However, as with all diners in this area, the menus are not as varied as they are in the North but this one is definitely worth a trip to receive the Northern diner feel.
Although the line was super long to get in, the chicken and waffles was amazing. The waffle tasted home made quality and the wings had the perfect flavor and seasoning.

After an early morning watching EPL at or favorite bar my girlfriend and I were looking for a late breakfast.  As we were near Uptown we though we'd give Midnight a second try, first for breakfast.  We were seated fairly quickly considering how busy things looked but it took quite a while for someone to come over to the table, perhaps 5-8 minutes.  After ordering a fairly basic breakfast it took what fellt like 15 minutes for out food to come out.  While our waitress was thoroughly apologetic for both waits she said it was because they were so busy.  I appreciate the effort but for a diner noon on a Saturday is prime time.  They might as well be short staffed at midnight on a Friday or Saturday.  Food was pretty good, but the burger I had on the previous visit brings down their average here.  Thin, dry and seemingly mostly made of filler and not hamburger.  Overall not a bad experience either time but nothing to keep me coming back either, there are better diner options in town if you're willing to make a small effort.

I enjoy going to the Midnight Diner, it's always there when you're hungry. We've gone many a morning afters, and many a late evenings. I love the firecracker shrimp salad, warm delicious shrimp tossed in firecracker sauce and put on a bed of sexy lettuce...(didn't know lettuce could be sexy did you?).  I've also had an omelette here, fries, grilled cheese, carrot cake. I haven't had anything I didn't like. My friends have tried the chicken and waffles, and even french toast and chicken (upon request), chili cheese-fries, hot dogs, and the Mexican burger YUM.  The crowd here gets interesting, so keep a look out for some good people watching moments. We love when we get a fun waiter/waitress to like Lissssssaaa, which is exactly what her name tags reads.  Try out Midnight diner for your next late nite, or after hours get together, or morning after a good time Uptown!

I usually don't write negative reviews and tend to focus on praising businesses but our experience was so terrible, this place deserves this rating. I went for the first time with my husband for breakfast and service was terrible! The scum of the world works there. Not even to mention the 90% sanitation score they have that I noticed only after eating. The food was disgusting, people who rave about the "amazing" food here, have clearly never had "good" food before. The chicken wings I ordered were cold, and the french toast was flat out gross. My husband ordered a corn-beef hash that looked like dog vomit, it was not fully cooked, the eggs also came out raw. He requested to get this fixed or something in place, and the gold teeth manager in the kitchen refused to. We were extremely disappointed by the terrible customer service and food and will never be returning. What a dump of a place!

3.5 stars   We've come here before, I had the dynamite shrimp grilled.. Was ok, not spicy at all though. We decided to stop by again today for brunch. It was packed but luckily the bar was wide open.. Who needs tables right? Our server was not as attentive as I had hoped though she was nice. Only filled out waters once. It also seemed very busy but still.   I got the midnight special with a side of rye toast while the bf got the bubba special. Food didn't take too long considering the crowd. Wow, I got a lot of food, couldn't finish it. The grits were so good! It feels like so much butter you think there was cheese in there. Not for the dieter. The chocolate chip pancakes were good, I like that they give the syrup warmed. I took stars off because I asked for poached eggs and a majority of my eggs were overcooked, almost to a full boil. Bleh.. The rye was also overly toasted and very hard. The bf's bubba special looked amazing, I couldn't take a pic, he ate it too fast lol open faced biscuit, cheddar scrambled eggs, sausage gravy, hash browns and turkey sausage. Very yummy and great bang for your buck! I'm getting this breakfast the next time I'm feeling eggs!   We also took a slice of chocolate cake home. It's very rich.. Took 3 days for us to take it down. Tip: use vanilla ice cream.. It balances the richness. Midnight is open 24/7, nice! Great drunk munchies! Breakfast, lunch and dinner, everything sounds good. Will be back, hopefully my eggs are the way I like it. Maybe for the shrimp and grits next time, imagined they are very good here.

I had the Philly Cheese-steak and enjoyed it with a side of cheese grits. Both were good in my opinion. The wait was long at 11, but once seated I was immediately acknowledged. The waiter we have was attentive. No complaints!

Ive come here on two different occasions and I truly enjoyed my food and dining experience as a whole. I love the quaint little diner. The first time I ordered the shrimp and grits which is to die for and the second time I ordered the fish sandwich and my counterpart ordered the fried chicken. The food was good and the service was good as well. I cant wait to bring my mom and some other out of towners. This is my new go to spot.

Met my daughter there on a Tuesday night.  Although busy, there was free parking available, we were greeted, seated and served right away.  We did not expect a gourmet experience.  We ordered the fish platter, mac & cheese, and spaghetti.  The food was acceptable and reasonably priced.  In summary, we had a nice, relaxing experience near downtown.  We would definitely recommend to others.

I suspected the tales of epic Shrimp & Grits and life-altering Chicken & Waffles at 2am were bound to be exaggerations, but alas, the Midnight Diner is gold, Ponyboy.   My friend and I stopped in after a very long day at work upon my brother's recommendation. Even after midnight on a Sunday night (actually Monday morning) the place was packed. Boisterous diners of all shapes & sizes were busy celebrating LIFE and FOOD!   We were seated promptly and quickly greeted by possibly the BEST SERVER EVER!! Jaya (sp?) was quick, sincere, knowledgeable, and a genuine pleasure to be around. We asked about the Shrimp & Grits and Chicken & Waffles, and she confidently recommended BOTH. I ordered the S&G, my friend ordered the C&W. Jaya suggested that the waffles were good, but not that special. She then recommended the Chicken & French Toast.   In short order, our food was brought to us, and NOTHING was a disappointment. Maybe the Shrimp could have been bigger, but they gave me 8 instead of the advertised 6, so I was just fine with that.   Yes, it was awesome.
