The S&G was spicy enough to start a fire, but gentle enough to savor every bite, the undeniable warm, fluffy goodness of the buttermilk biscuit puts Bojangle's to absolute shame, the C&FT was so good it should be illegal and the atmosphere was thick with electric, deep-fried, southern goodness. Stop what you're doing, and go to Midnight Diner NOW!

Their biscuits are always fresh but for the most part the food is just average. The location is great and they are open 24hrs. Do not try to go after bars close at 2am because the line is always wrapped around the building on the weekends.

This is a classic Charlotte restaurant. It's good quality, diner food. Comfort food with breakfast options any time of the day. The fried chicken, French toast and Midnight Burger are some of my favorite menu options. I don't think you can go wrong with any of those. I also recommend the mac and cheese for a side. You can also order alcohol here which is kind of cool.   The parking situation sucks, plain and simple. Not enough spots and the only other option is to pay in the lot behind the diner...$7 for 12 hours, plus maneuvering around that lot is actually pretty stressful with the tight quarters.   This is a pretty popular spot for after hours as well--it's one of the few places open at 3am with a great menu...so expect a wait!
Good diner food and prices, average service, great hours.

Shrimp & Grits.... the rest is history! Like any other diner it's a very fast paced environment. My server was friendly and more importantly - quick! I definitely recommend the Midnight Diner to all my foodies.

3.5 stars... One time I had to wait 20 minutes on a Friday, and one time there was no wait on a Wednesday. When there is a line, THERE IS A FUCKING LINE!!!!!   There were so many ghetto drunk people on the Friday night it was appauling how some people behaved. I was thankful for the heavy police presence.   I had shrimp and grits both times and both times it was the tastiest thing you could find to eat at midnight. There service is good for how many people they have to deal with. The tables and booths were clean and despite all the drunkies, the bathroom was surprisingly clean. I gave 3.5 stars because nothing else open at midnight has food as good as the grits here.
Update: Jetaun was an amazing server this go round. The food almost felt like it tasted better on this trip. I have no complaints and am so happy I found this lovely diner.

I had some of the lightest, crispest, sweetest Belgian waffles I've ever had at Midnight Diner.  Don't let the lines discourage you, both times I went on the weekend they moved pretty quickly.  But it's obvious that this place is so popular because the food is delicious!!  Highly recommend for breakfast.

I arrived in Charlotte relatively late in the evening, and I quickly realized that my meager per dime wasn't going to cover the cost of meals at my hotel. Thankfully, the midnight dinner was open, and a short walk away.  The restaurant was clean, cheap, the service was friendly and good, and the food was very comforting. I had shrimp and grits(excellent), and onion rings (also very good, but more than I could eat; they became a midnight snack later on).  A road weary traveler can't ask for much more in a restaurant. I thank you, Midnight Diner.

So I was back in Charlotte again! I'm from Charlotte, but this place is new to me, seeing I've been gone a few years. My sisters friend brought  us here during our visit... I believe it was late Friday night, right around 10:30PM. So we were there before the club/party people... however it was still full, but we were seated quickly. Our server was friendly, but my water glass stayed empty.  First off... so are you saying I can get breakfast at 10:30PM?!? YES. I'm already inclined to like this place! I had the Midnight Special: Eggs, sausage, grits and pancakes. The do something different to their grits.. those things are super rich and creamy. I'm a grits fan, but I could only eat but so much of them. The pancakes were kind of thick... but they didn't get soggy as fast as IHOPs so that was a plus.   Sister ordered the shrimp and grits and she LOVED it. I'm not a shrimp and grits fan, but I tasted... and tasty it was lol. And my sisters friend ordered steak with eggs and hashbrowns I believe. She said the steak was tender, but it wasn't really seasoned, so the A1 sauce was a must. She comes here often, and was raving about the chicken and waffles.... something to try next time.  This place is definitely a late-night joint and would definitely hit the spot for me simply because I love breakfast at night.

Okay so maybe I did dance with one of the waitresses next to the jukebox. Don't judge me! Heh, the staff is friendly and the jukebox jams will cheer up any unhappy camper. I applaud them for that and keeping their cool when dealing with these obnoxious, immature ruffians at all waking hours from all corners and crevices in which they crawled from (I plead the fifth!).  Nothing glamorous, just your average diner with average food. But, with it being one of the few spots in the QC open 24 hours, how can you go wrong? Automatic bonus points for that and more bonus points for them serving fried chicken and mac 'n cheese alllllll damn day! Can I get an Amen?!

Best southern meal during my three days in Charlotte.  The waitress was a sweetheart and helped me order something I'll never forget!  Livermush, two eggs over easy, a biscuit and grits.  I like liver, so the taste was up my alley. It's really the texture that surprised me; a super crispy crunchy outside with a pate like texture inside. The biscuit was fluffy and not greasy. The eggs were perfectly runny. But honestly, the grits style the show for me.  I had been haggling my friend to get me some outstanding grits, and by bringing me here; he did. Super creamy and thick with the right amount of salt.   I cleaned my plate better than the guys at my table.

This might be my favorite place to eat in Charlotte. It is definitely a come as you are kind of place, I love it for that simple reason. Anything on the menu is pure deliciousness. I usually get the Shrimp and Grits, I must say ....it's better than my mother's. Hopefully she never reads this review. The fried chicken is my second favorite, along with the massive French toast. I always intentionally order more than I know I can eat, simply because I love to be in the presence of such wonderful food. Every time I bring someone here they become a believer, I should receive rewards points. You honestly can't go wrong with anything from here at anytime of day. I went in today with my little brother at 4pm and ordered and entire breakfast. Only because I could. If you have never been, I highly recommend. There is also one server who so passionately describes every dish on the menu, you would think he created and cooks them each personally. I could go on forever. But I will stop here.   Enjoy the edible.

The server basically stole $2 from my husband. Point is - you never pocket a customers cash change. We placed a call in pick-up order. He paid with extra and was due back change along with my sister in law's order with over $5 due back in change. The service with the cashier she basically cashed them out and picked change for both orders! Processed to leave the counter, well over 5min they waited for her to give change and utensils, ketchup etc. She avoided them. They asked her, for items by raising their voice over the crowd so she could give her attention. She then responded "oh are you waiting for change too? Let me do that" she proceeded to avoid them.. well after 10min they asked another sever for utensils and Left! How ridiculous. How can you work for a tip off a pickup order and basically steal it. Terrible

Honestly, I have only been once but do not think this place is worth the hype. Even after a few adult beverages, the food wasn't very good and not as cheap as I expected diner food to be. Everything just tasted like salt. Their only saving grace is that they are open 24 hours. Plan to wait if you go anytime between breakfast and 3am though.

Was impressed with my first visit here.  Everything is super shiny and didn't have to wait too long for a table, but I can see this place being packed on the weekends.  We came here after a party at a bar on a Thursday night so we were definitely starving.  The wait staff was nice and seated us right away.  Ordered and the food came out.....  typical diner food - nothing too too special that caught my eye, but good late night food at that.  Add to the fact that I LOVE LOVE breakfast... this place is golden for me.  I can eat breakfast any time of day now with just a visit here.

As I grew up in PA, these types of diners were everywhere - the metal outside, the round counter seats, and booths lining the outside wall of the building.  When you had a group of 5 or more, you knew you had to split up into more than one group as large tables were scarce.  This diner has all of that but they have corner round tables that fit larger groups.  The diner itself is actually larger than some of the other ones I've been to, including another local one, Mattie's.  Service here is what I would expect to find at something like this.  Exceptional when they are not busy but I would imagine it could get pretty chaotic in here at busier times but it's something you just accept from the atmosphere.  The menu is broad and you can get anything at anytime of day.  Breakfast at 4pm, check!  Well actually I was working an early shift at work and got off at 10am and treated myself to breakfast.  I ordered what I typically get for breakfast, an omelette, hashbrowns and a pancake. The omelette was their San Bernadino omelette which came with pico de gallo, sliced avocado and cheddar cheese.  The pancake was huge and dense and quickly absorbed the syrup I put on it.   It was good but not great.  Same with the omelette but the food was nothing to write home about.  I didn't expect it to be.  I came here for the experience.  One downside is I thought their prices were a little high for a diner.  I can get a better omelette, better pancake and better hashbrowns at a place on the other side of Dilworth for cheaper.    But everyone needs to realize when they come here, you come for the atmosphere and to get a decent meal.  It's not a 4-star restaurant and in my book, it shouldn't be. But it is still worth coming to at any time of day!
good food, good service, classic diner with a counter.

Great place to come and take a load off! It is a bit crowded but it is worth it. Great food well worth the price! They have fresh-cut fries that are really good. There's not a bad seat in the house and you should definitely try it.

Heard so much about this place. Stood at the front and waited for someone to greet us for almost 5 minutes. Most of my table ordered chicken and french toast. My husband's chicken came out extremely burnt and had to be sent back. I ordered a breakfast plate with eggs, sausage and french toast which was just okay. I was extremely excited to try it,big highly disappointed. I can say our server was great and made good recommendations.

What a fun place to go late night to see the staff cut-up with impromtu dance parties and witty salty come backs. The energy in this place- no matter how long you have to stand in line to get in- makes it all worth it. The food is good- I got chicken and French toast and my friend had a Carolina burger. Both meals were satisfying and delicious. We had a great time and can't wait to come back.  Ps- Vett is awesome and so is Ms. Angela!

OMG,The Shrimp And Grits are out of this world.I found this place on Yelp and so many people raved about the shrimp and grits with a biscuit,I just had to try it for my self.The Grits were creamy the shrimp were cooked perfectly.I Was in Charlotte for the CIAA tournament and I had to try this place before going back to the ATL.

Best Shrimp and Grits EVER.  Love dining here Breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night or all night. Food is fabulous and the staff are warm and welcoming.  If you're downtown for a show the desserts are also very good. My favorite is the apple tart.

The freaking sweet tea is freaking awesome and the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich...well, you'd have to be an ass to mess that up. Now the service: the service is subpar. I have been at least 7 times and half of those times have been orders called in for pickup. The women on the phone are usually pretty rude and rush you off but I guess that is because they are also running around to tables, either way, each customer should get the time they need if they are ordering, paying for their food AND have the opportunity to tip you. When you go in for pickup, you typically have to wrestle an elephant and do a handstand to get anyone to pay attention to you so that you may pay for your food which is sitting RIGHT behind the counter waiting to be paid for and eaten.  Great place to go for the quality of food and is open 24 hours. Will return here so long as I worked 5 minutes from this place.

Your basic diner- that's how I would describe this place. Came here for breakfast- typical breakfast food. Service was fine- waitress was pleasant. Prices were inexpensive. I got a biscuit sandwich- the biscuit itself was wonderful- savory and sweet. Wouldn't mind checking this place out again for lunch or dinner- I heard it's good.

They were packed at night of course! The wait wasn't too bad. Very loud at night because everyone is drunk and hungry. I got the shrimp and grits and it was by far the best I've had. Service was great even tho they were busy. I would go again. Even if I wasn't in the area and I wanted some shrimp and grits. I'd drive there just for it.
